speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Accompanied by Olaf, the sentinels arrive at the top of the glacier...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...where Vex is about to unearth the strange magical artifact from the ice.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Dig faster, Shadow. Let’s get this dumb sparkly thing back to Viego.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: There she is. Looks like we’re just in time.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Ugh. Sentinels again.

speaker: Vex

responses.dialogue: Yeah. We tend to not quit when someone’s trying to ruin the world.
I dunno. I feel like I’m trying a pretty average amount.
I normally don’t. I swear, I was a complete underachiever until these people came into my life.

dialogue: Has anyone ever told you guys that you try way too hard?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Yeah? Well, I don’t even want to be here right now.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: But Viego needs this dumb sparkly thing to make the world awful.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: And an awful, ugly world is the only thing I want.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sentinels, I say we smoke this critter.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Ugh. I’ll finish digging, Shadow. You go kill these tryhards.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels unleash a hail of gunlight on Vex, but her shadow leaps to her defense.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The shadow belches out a thick miasma of Black Mist, making the sentinels wretch and writhe in pain.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Berserker—we need you. This is your chance! Get in there and fight your epic song-inspiring battle!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Ah, I’d love to, but…

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I can’t. I just don’t have it in me anymore.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: WHAT?!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You’ve all calmed me with your kind words and comradery. I can’t enter the berserker state this way.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Way to go, Rookie. You had to talk him down.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So how do we get you riled up again?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I don’t know. I normally just fly off the handle, unprovoked! This has never happened before!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: We all get our fill of death sooner or later. Happens to everyone.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Not Olaf! Olaf’s a vessel of pure rage and violence! ...At least, I was.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hmm. If we calmed him down with words, maybe we can make him angry with them, too.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes. ...YES, it just might work!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ooh, splendid! Allow me to try!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Olaf, you… HAVE NO JOY, you foolish, hairy man who isn’t appropriately dressed for the cold!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Sorry. You’ll have to do better than that, girl.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Hmm. Maybe the problem is you’re too stupid to understand language.

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: Because you have a poor grasp of words and their meanings. You’re basically an illiterate caveman.
She’s just trying to help you by pointing out a flaw. But frankly, I’d start with your body odor.
Because we all hate you? We hate you and can’t stand your ugly face?

dialogue: What? Why would you say such a thing?

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: Shh, careful. Don’t wanna scare away all your lice.
Okay. Just got a whiff of that breath. Do you eat anything other than yak droppings?
Careful. You’re starting to spit, and I really don’t want to catch whatever nasty caveman disease you’re carrying.

dialogue: I’VE HEARD JUST ABOUT ENOUGH FROM THE LOT OF YA!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Okay, friend! That does it! You are awaited in the spirit realm!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf turns beet red and charges at you, axes poised.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This is it. He’s berserk! Quick—help me point him toward the target!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels all band together to grapple Olaf and turn him toward Vex.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a fit of mindless anger, the berserker hacks his way through Vex’s shadow and continues toward the yordle at full speed.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: AAAAHHH! DIE!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...But Vex has just retrieved the magical artifact from the ice. It appears to be an ivory comb.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Huh. The dumb sparkly thing is a dumb comb?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Whatever. Come on, shadow. Let’s get off this stupid ice mountain.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Using her shadow as a sled, Vex slides down the glacier, leaving Olaf hacking at the empty air.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Come back here and fight! Give Olaf his hero’s death!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We can still catch her! Just need to find a quick way down these slopes!

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: Just the one. But at least I know not to refer to myself in third person. Idiot.
Yeesh. Your speech is barely intelligible. You been hitting the mead, or did you take another blow to the helmet?
I’m sorry. I’m trying to listen to you, but your fetid stench is just so distracting.

dialogue: Olaf is fluent in nine Freljordian tongues! How many do you speak?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I’ll have you know that Olaf bathes every fortnight!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Mm. Yeah. I imagine it takes that long just to collect enough yeti urine.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s what you bathe in, right?

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: That’s a good question. I guess I could make fun of your dimwit ancestors next. I mean, they settled here. How bright could they have been?
Well, I haven’t mentioned the bugs living in your beard yet. That’s next though. We really need to talk about those.

dialogue: Make fun of my appearance, will ya? How much lower can you go?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Using your clever taunts and Lucian’s guns, the two of you quickly dispatch the wraiths.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though you’ve managed to save Rengar’s life, the same cannot be said for his ego.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Ughhhhh…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You alright, cat?

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: My blades did nothing to them. My teeth and claws… equally worthless!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hey, you’re alive. Guess that was one of your nine lives, huh?

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Yes. I live...

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: ...but with my tail between my legs.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Happens to everyone. Sometimes, you get the wraith, sometimes, you get got, right?

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: It does not happen to Rengar! Rengar does not get gotten!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I am an apex hunter—the top of the food chain!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: Aw, chin up, big guy. Everyone gets humbled. Consider it a learning experience.
Yeah. And those were just wraiths. You wouldn’t stand a chance against their boss.
I could help you find a lesser creature to kill. Would that make you feel better?

dialogue: At least… I was.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I must face the reality of the new jungle order…

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Rengar is no longer at the top.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Now, I am but lowly prey.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Aw, come on! Stop your whinin’, cat. You lost one fight.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: In the wild, you do not get one defeat. One defeat means you are food.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: It is only a matter of time before Rengar suffers such a fate.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Rengar, I know exactly what you’re going through. I too have been bested by a predator before…

dialogue: [Lucian shoots you a look, imploring you to say something.]

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: You wouldn’t know it to look at me, but I spent some time in Icathia, fighting, uh... Void wyrms?
I haven’t told many people this, but… I got kidnapped by a yeti once.
I spent two years inside the belly of a kraken.

dialogue: Rengar is intrigued.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: And though I thought I was done for, I eventually escaped, and found my way to a nearby monastery.

dialogue: [Rengar listens in stunned silence.]

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: After a year of convalescing, I took my first steps, found my way back to the beast, and…

dialogue: [INQUISITIVE PURR]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: And what? What happened?! I must know how this hunt ended!

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Choked it to death with my bare hands.
Beat it until it begged me to stop, promising to grant me three wishes.
Told some local soldiers about it. I’m sure they took care of it. ...Pretty sure.

dialogue: Yeah, I kinda wanna see where this is going.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Boy howdy. That story is such a hot pile of—

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Inspiration.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Truly a tale of triumphing over adversity, young one!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: You have made me realize that becoming prey does not mean one must remain prey!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Really? You got all that from—

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know what? Never mind. It is an inspiring story.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: If an inexperienced human like this “Rookie” can return to defeat such a menace, then so can Rengar!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Let us continue our hunt for these wraiths!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: And this time, I will show them who is predator, and who is prey.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: There ya go, cat.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, it seems like the Mist is flowing through these trees into that clearing over yonder.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Must be something over there.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: [SNIFF-SNIFF] Yes, I can smell it!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: It is a smell I do not know. But whatever it is, it is certainly big game!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As Rengar runs off to follow the Mist trail into the clearing, Lucian looks at you in disbelief.]

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: You’re not going to believe this, but… none of it was true!
You know I made all that up, right?
And it was 100% true!

dialogue: Wow. That story...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You don’t say.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: No. There is no recovering from this. I have been bested, and the whole jungle witnessed my humiliation!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: No. There is no recovering from this. I have been bested, and the whole jungle witnessed my humiliation!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: Oh, yes. It was horrible. One in particular was so vicious. It ravaged me with its…

dialogue: Void wyrms?

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: With its… Void jaws. Which chewed on my body, day and night, for an entire week!
Its… purple... stinging things! All of which injected me with… Void poison!
With its...countless eyeballs. All of which shot beams of destructive energy!

dialogue: Go on. Ravaged you with its what?!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: Indeed. It took me to its lair, and attempted to…

dialogue: A yeti? Truly a vicious predator!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: Raise me as its child. The beast nursed me with its awful yeti milk for a fortnight.
Wed me. I became… closer to that yeti than any human should ever be.
Force me to learn yeti folk art. I wove… so many scarfs and doilies. It was unspeakable.

dialogue: Yes?!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: I do not jest, sir.

dialogue: No… Not a kraken! Surely you jest.

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: At first, it was unpleasant, but in time, I learned to not only live in it but thrive there.
I built a shelter from pieces of driftwood it had swallowed, and lived on undigested fish.

dialogue: However did you survive?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Accompanied by Miss Fortune, the sentinels charge into the harrowed chaos of the docks.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A cacophony of screams, both human and inhuman, rises from somewhere within the Black Mist ahead of you.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Lots of Mist, lots of screams. This is the way to Viego alright.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: What is this squishiness I keep stepping in?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: That’d be fish guts, little lady.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: They don’t call ‘em the Slaughter Docks for nothin’.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my, I’m going to… what do people call it? Vomit?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Yes, that’s it—I’m going to vomit!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I was about to say: Even though the idea of walkin’ ankle deep in fish parts may not seem appealin’ to some people...

speaker: Graves
dialogue: ...this neighborhood has some of the best waterin' holes in Bilgewater. Secret spots that only us locals know about.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Was that directed at me? If so, hard pass.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No time for a tour, Graves. I think we’ve got wraiths ahead. A lot of ‘em.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: There is something else, too. Something that lurks in the shadows and hunts with much tenacity.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Rengar opens his mouth and grimaces, as he tastes something foul on the air.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: It reeks of… seawater. And death.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Sounds like a party. Let’s go.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You take a few steps, and stop abruptly as a crazed, salt-worn voice comes from within the Mist.]
To the deep with you!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Oh, that is definitely a monster.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne aims her crossbow at the crazed figure, but before she can shoot, the figure leaps away with its knives drawn… ]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and tackles a nearby wraith.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: YOU are on my list!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With supernatural precision, the figure attacks the wraith with three rapid slashes from his blades.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though his knives have no effect, the crazed figure leaps to another wraith, continuing his attack unabated.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Salt in the eyes of the Harrowing!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Gods above, what kind of psycho is this guy?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Someone who hates the Harrowing apparently. Or salt? I can’t tell.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Goes by the name of Pyke. Never seen him up close before.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Truth be told, I always thought he was just a ghost story parents told to make children behave.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Are you on my list, too?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Indeed you are! Float ‘til you sink!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pyke lunges at yet another wraith, stabbing through it to no effect, and quickly moves on to another specter.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, I do admire his undying enthusiasm!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: He’s making no progress, yet he never gets discouraged. We could all take a lesson from that.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Angered, the wraiths swarm Pyke, attacking with dark magic that would destroy any mortal.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Moments later, Pyke emerges unscathed.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Creepy bastard can take a hit! He just came out of a swarm of wraiths and didn’t have a scratch on him!

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Sink ‘til you float! I will have my revenge!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Hmm. This creature seems to carry some vendetta.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: But only against these wraiths. Does he harbor some grudge against Viego?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [For the first time, Pyke turns his attention to the sentinels.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Viego? Yes, Viego! Are you Viego? If so, you will breathe the brine!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: No, I am the Lunar Mother, Aspect of the Moon, She Who Holds the Night Torch Aloft—

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: You! YOU are Viego!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Your blood runs cold as you realize Pyke is looking directly into your eyes, judging you.]

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: NO!
Uh-uh. I am not having this ridiculous conversation.
I mean, who are any of us, really, when you think about it?

dialogue: Rookie—SAY NO.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: You cut my line? What is your name, line cutter?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Oh, can we please just shoot this thing already?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: No. Wait...

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There is some power at work within him. I sense he may serve a purpose here, for the good.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Okay, Moonbeams, I get it. You’re above everything. Must be nice.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: If your name is on my list, you will chum the waters.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: WHAT IS YOUR NAME?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look anxiously to Lucian and Senna. They motion for you to “make with the talking.”]

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: My name is… Jeffy… J...
My name? It’s… Lillibelle Umbegerth...
My name is unpronounceable, but it is written simply as the symbol %.

dialogue: Just tell him a fake name, kid. Seems easy enough.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Ugh. Not that name.

speaker: Pyke

responses.dialogue: Wait. I didn’t finish. The last name is… Snolfel...snoot...son… ington.
Sorry, was that for junior? You might be thinking of my dad. He cut lots of lines.
Check the middle initial on that? It’s spelled #.

dialogue: Yes. You are on my list. You cut my line!

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: You are… not on my list?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Nope. Kid’s in the clear. Never cut a line in his life.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: If we’re not going to kill this thing, can we just move on?!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: If I figure correctly, Viego went somewhere in this direction...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne points toward a warehouse at the end of the Slaughter Docks, where the majority of the Black Mist seems to be originating.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: At that very moment, a massive throng of wraiths comes shrieking out of the warehouse, ruining everything in their path as they rush toward you.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Our path is fraught with peril. We cannot possibly withstand so many wraiths.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucky for us, we know someone who can.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Pyke? That’s your name, right?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Yes. Pyke. Harpooner of The Terror. Were you on my crew?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: If so, you are on my list!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We are Sentinels of Light, and we have a list of our own.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And if I’m not mistaken, both of our lists share a name.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Viego? The Ruined King? I’ll put my harpoon through his heart!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s the guy. We’re on our way now, to give him a... harpooning.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: I will harpoon him! I will watch him sink as his lungs fill with the sea!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay, okay. But in order for that to happen… I’m gonna need you to take on those wraiths for us. Can you do that?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pyke turns and surveys the throng of wraiths heading straight toward you.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Wraiths… Wraiths are on my list.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With astonishing speed and purpose, Pyke lunges into the press of wraiths, absorbing their attacks without flinching.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: There. That oughta keep them occupied...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With the wraiths focused on Pyke, a clear path forms around them, leading to the warehouse at the end of the docks.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Having safely passed the mob of wraiths, the sentinels arrive at the source of the local Harrowing: an old shipping warehouse.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay, sentinels. Looks like Viego’s holed up in this warehouse.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I can feel him, Miss. He’s gotten stronger since last time.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I feel it, too. Everyone, make sure you’re ready.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Viego will chum the waters on this day.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sarah, those pistols won’t protect you in there. Why don’t ya let me hold that fetter?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Why? So you can take it and run? And leave me stewing in this mess? I’m not stupid, Lucian.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Maybe not stupid. But definitely paranoid.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Just keep it out of sight, Sarah. And stay close to us. This is going to get hairy.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Where are you, my love? Crate after crate I’ve opened, yet you are nowhere to be found.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: No matter. For our love, I would rummage through every stinking fish barrel on this island.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looking for something?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego turns to see the sentinels, Pyke, and Miss Fortune with their weapons drawn.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Senna…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: ...at last you come before me, to offer your soul to the Last Great King of Camavor.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. I come to offer you a short trip back to the afterlife.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna aims her cannon at Viego.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You would really shoot me? Is that truly what SHE wants?

responses.dialogue: This is going badly. We should use the Wayfinder and get out while we have the fetter!
Shoot him! Everyone shoot! I’d do it myself, but I don’t have a gun!
Let’s let him monologue some more. That always goes well.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Since no one else has the guts to do this, I guess it might as well be me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Miss Fortune strolls toward Viego, coming between him and Senna’s gun.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sarah, what are you doing?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I’m putting an end to all this.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Miss Fortune reaches into her coat pocket and withdraws the brass bell.]

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Let’s talk, King.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fortune! NO! WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: What is this? You come bearing gifts?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: That’s right. A piece of your missus. Just like you wanted.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: And as a little something extra, I come bearing another gift…

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: ...all those troublesome sentinels who have been hounding you across Runeterra.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: WHAT?! Sarah, you low-down, back-stabbin’ sea krait!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You are NOT gonna embarrass me in front of my new partners again!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Why do you do this? You cannot resist his power. He will ruin you!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Yes. I’m counting on it. That… is my last gift.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You watch in horror as Miss Fortune turns her back to Viego, and spreads her arms wide, accepting what is to come.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego approaches her from behind, and—almost lovingly—runs his sword through her heart.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, my goodness… It’s okay! I can stitch that up! You’ll be right as rain!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: No, girl. This is my wish.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: This is madness! I-I don’t understand.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Like I said—you’re nice people…

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: ...but I intend to get the spoils.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Even if I have to share them.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: See how easy it is, Senna? You, too, can stop this futile struggle… and relinquish what is mine.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I told you: I’d rather die!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna angrily fires her cannon at Viego. Miss Fortune responds in kind.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Soon, gunlight and blunderbuss shot rip through the wooden crates and pallets in the warehouse. Shards of splintered wood fly like shrapnel in all directions.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: You. I have a question for you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You feel the blood rush from your head as Pyke fixes his dead gaze on you.]

speaker: Pyke

responses.dialogue: THAT’S what’s on your mind right now? Is something wrong with you?!
I’m trying not to get shot! Shut up about your stupid list already!
Yes, Pyke. I think it’s safe to say she’s near the top of your list right now.

dialogue: That woman—Fortune… Is she now on my list?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Thank you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pyke disappears into the shadows as gunshots continue to zip by your head.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: See how your subjects fight over you, my queen. But none of them could ever grasp the depth of our love.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Let us flee this vulgarity and continue our reunion.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a satisfied smirk, Viego pockets the bronze bell.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, dear. He’s leaving with the piece of her!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Fret not, sentinels. I am not an unjust king.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: If you will not serve me, I will permit you to die with your freedom.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a single, mighty wave of his sword, Viego causes the warehouse to quake.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: What’s happening?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You hear the wood beneath your feet snapping and splashing into the bay below.]

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: Is this a bad time to say I told you so?
Everyone gather around! I’ll Wayfinder us out of here!
We can still stop him!

dialogue: That daft bastard is tearing apart the docks! He means to end Olaf’s saga with an epic drowning!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Just as you draw the Wayfinder from its holster, a large beam of wood falls onto your shoulder, knocking the device from your grasp.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before you can react, the falling Wayfinder skitters across the warehouse, then disappears through a hole in the collapsing floor.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Your heart sinks as you hear it splash into the bay below.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie! Son of a— What’s our plan B?!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: We run like our asses are on fire!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I’ve got a better idea…

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I like your spirit, kid.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: But spirit only gets you so far.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: The kid’s right.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: You’re all just going to sit here watching politely?

speaker: Pyke

responses.dialogue: You’re not going to stop asking until I answer, are you? Fine. Yes, she’s on your list.
[CHECK IMAGINARY LIST] Okay, calm down. I’ll check. ...Yep, there she is! Right there.

dialogue: I must know! Is her name written on my list?

speaker: Pyke

responses.dialogue: You’re not going to stop asking until I answer, are you? Fine. Yes, she’s on your list.
[CHECK IMAGINARY LIST] Okay, calm down. I’ll check. ...Yep, there she is! Right there.

dialogue: I must know! Is her name written on my list?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re way past that! Just Wayfinder us the hell outta here, Rook!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re way past that! Just Wayfinder us the hell outta here, Rook!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels rush to meet Karma at the Lasting Altar, eager to hear her strategy for resisting the Black Mist.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Irelia stops in the doorway and looks back at Riven in contempt.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: She will have to wait outside. The Lasting Altar must not be defiled by her presence.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m sorry, Riven. Would you mind just—?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It’s fine. Really. I’ll see you once you’re done here.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: This is it. Remember, this place is sacred. Karma is communing with the Spirit of the Land, so try not to—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As if on cue, Olaf releases gas from every bodily orifice.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Really, Olaf. She specifically said NOT to defile the altar.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I can’t help it! Running up mountains makes Olaf’s stomach churn like the forge of the Ram God Himself!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [All of the sentinels glare uncomfortably at Olaf.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Awww, blood and damnation! I’ll wait outside with the Noxian.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You must have an interesting recruitment strategy.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You have no idea. So, about this Karma...

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: She’s just inside.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You enter the inner sanctum of the Altar to find Karma not meditating, but staring into the middle distance, with her eyes wide open.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: So this is Karma. I can already sense that she is no ordinary being.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Not an Aspect, but connected to something vast and deep, all the same. It’s…

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: The collective spiritual wisdom of all Ionia?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Indeed.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Irelia. You bring visitors.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: I do. And what’s come of your meditation? What has the Spirit revealed to you?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I’m afraid it is not good. He is coming for it.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: That sounds dreadful! Who is coming? And for what exactly?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma reveals she’s holding something: a silver flower, crafted by a jeweler in some past age.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [It shimmers with a familiar glow.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A fetter. It’s another piece of her soul.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And the Ruined Freak will be coming for it.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Yes. I have seen him. He is... obsessed. Powerful beyond reason.

speaker: Karma

responses.dialogue: You’re just giving up? Surely you have some fancy magical spirit thing you can hide it in.
I know—Gwen could shroud it in Hallowed Mist! It worked on us. Why wouldn’t it work on a fetter?
Well, that sucks. Guess it’s time for you all to move.

dialogue: He will soon take what he seeks. And Ionia with it.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: There is only one way to keep this fetter from his grasp.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: We must take it to the Grove of the Ancients.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: A vastayan forest not far from here, its woods are thick with ancient magic that even the Black Mist cannot penetrate.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: There… it will be… safe.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma trails off, roiled by some internal struggle.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Is she always this spacey?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: No. Something is amiss.
[SHRIEEEEK]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Wraiths. They’re outside!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Sorry to defile your temple, but—

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: THERE’S AN ARMY OF BASTARD WRAITHS OUTSIDE!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, my. Their wretched claws are prying at the windows! Shoo, awful specters! Back to the ghost realm with you!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen snips at the wraiths with her scissors as they slither through openings in the windows and doors.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels join her, shooting and hacking at the harrowed intruders as they continue pouring into the sanctum.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It’s no use. They’re coming in from everywhere!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We can’t just stand here and let them overwhelm us! We have to get the fetter to safety!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Karma, if we can deal with these wraiths, do you think you can make it to that forest?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: There is so much I cannot see. His sway is strong.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: But I will try.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma pockets the silver flower as she prepares to flee.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good. On my signal, we open that door and shoot a path through this press of wraiths.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Somebody get Olaf riled up.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: ALREADY! THERE! RAAAARGH!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good. Karma, get ready to run!

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Sadly, I do not.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I could, but… it won’t hold forever. I’m not strong enough yet!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Move where? The First Lands have been our home since the dawn of the ages.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah, and if we don’t stop it here, there won’t be anywhere to move to. You should really think about that, Rookie.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I’d normally suggest slapping the kid, but, uh… Karma doesn’t seem like the slapping type.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You, Lucian, and Senna have successfully thwarted a wraith invasion at Sentinel Headquarters.]

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: So I suppose you’ll tell me sooner or later, but WHAT EXACTLY WERE THOSE THINGS?
That… That was the Black Mist, wasn’t it?
What were those things? Does this have something to do with that Ruined King I’ve been reading about?

dialogue: I think that’s all of them. Good work, sentinels.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna places her hand over her heart, as if feeling for something.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah... a history.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Senna, what’s wrong?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s strange, Lucian. I can’t get used to it.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s... gone.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: When I was in danger back there, I couldn’t feel her comforting me.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Um… are you missing somebody? Who’s “she”?
Sounds like quite a friend. I’m sorry for your loss.

dialogue: When I fired my gun, she wasn’t calming my nerves.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You wouldn’t understand. You can’t. She’s been part of me since I was little. Part of my soul.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Now, I’m… I’m lost.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You’re alive. And that’s what’s important.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: For how much longer, Lucian?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: All those years in Thresh’s lantern, she was the only thing protecting me—the only reason I survived.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No. It was you. And me. Fighting together.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And we can damn sure get along without some creepy ghost queen whispering in your ear.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You don’t know what you’re talking about. She was—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From out of nowhere, you hear the familiar wail of wraiths, and the clamor of battle.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Another wraith. And it looks like it’s fighting someone!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It looks like… a girl. With giant scissors?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Snip, snip! Back to the shadows you go!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Hello, all. Sorry for the noise. They do scream ever so loudly when you snip them.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: How did you…? Who are you?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Quite rude of me. My name is Gwen. I sew things.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sewing, huh? Is that what that was?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: This world is but a fabric, and the Black Mist is its frayed seams. So I stitch it up!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: How’d you do that? I thought only sentinel weapons could put a wraith down for good.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: A needle and thread to bind the undead. The Hallowed Seamstress is here to assist, good sentinels.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, her needle and scissors? They seem like relic weapons. Like our guns.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And that’s not all. There’s something... strange about her. Odd, but familiar.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What… is she?

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Hmm. She is a little strange. But she seems to be on our side. Give her a chance.
Why are you asking me? I just started this job.
No way. I don’t trust anyone with scissors that big. Cut her loose.

dialogue: No idea. What do you think, Rook? Should we trust Miss Scissors here?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: As long as those scissors keep killing wraiths, I say we keep ‘em around.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You can stay, Scissors.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, delightful! I’m sure we’ll get along splendidly!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: What say we start our new friendship by killing more wraiths?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: More wraiths?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Indeed. There’s a whole storm of them coming ashore right now!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ah, hells. That’s even more than last time.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This looks grim. If this is how we’re going out… It was an honor fighting with you all.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Now hold on. There’s no need for farewells just yet. I’ve got just the thing...

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: A protective garment made of Hallowed Mist! To guard against the servants of the Ruined King!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You watch in astonishment as Gwen envelopes you in a shroud of shimmering silvery-blue Mist. The wraiths pass by, appearing not to notice you.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Fits perfectly, if I do say so myself.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: They can’t see us.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t believe it. This is pure Hallowed Mist! The only thing a Harrowing can’t touch.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Scissors, you keep surprising me.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This is our chance. Let’s make a run for the headquarters!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, boy. You’ve got a lot to learn, kid.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Did your mentor teach you ANYTHING?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Go easy, Lucian. I remember when you didn’t know everything.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That, young Rookie, was the work of Viego, the Ruined King.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You might say we’ve got a history with him.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Ah, I see someone paid attention in training.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Check out the booksmarts on Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yes, that was the work of Viego, the Ruined King.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You might say we’ve got a history with him.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Ah, I see someone paid attention in training.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Check out the booksmarts on Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yes, that was the work of Viego, the Ruined King.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You might say we’ve got a history with him.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It was nobody, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She wasn’t a nobody. She was the Queen of Camavor. Viego’s wife.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I didn’t always know it, but… she looked out for me.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: She was a curse, Senna. A spirit that haunted you. And you’re better off without her.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Okay, I can see I’ve opened a can of worms here. Can we, maybe, change the subject?
Hoo boy! Yeah, who hasn’t been possessed by an undead queen at some point, right?

dialogue: Who are you to decide that, Lucian?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She was the Queen of Camavor.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I didn’t always know it, but… she looked out for me.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And now, I’m alone.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Oh. Yeah. I’m... always here if you need a shoulder to cry on.
Sure. I mean, you’re my superior officer, so I pretty much have to be here for you.

dialogue: Alone? What are you talking about? You’ve got me! Uh, and Rookie!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hmm. That makes sense. The enemy of my enemy and all that.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You’re keeping a level head, Rookie. I like it.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I asked for your opinion.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: If I wanted you to stand there and act dumb, I wouldn’t have said anything.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What he means is—you’re going to have to step up a little, Rookie. Assert yourself.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So you’re scared. I don’t blame you.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: But you’re gonna see a lot more than giant scissors in this job, kid.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Best get used to it.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a revolting ride, you come to the bottom of the sewer chute.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Ptuh… Ugh!... ACK...

speaker: Diana
dialogue: That was... most unpleasant.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Eww! Ew-ew-EWWW! I fear I will never be clean again!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Eh. I’ve had worse.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Far as I’m concerned, we don’t ever need to talk about that again.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Hey, I—I just brought it up as a theoretical possibility! I didn’t intend for us to do it.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, we’re here now. Time to get back on the trail of our fetter thief.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You see the Mist flowing into a lower level of the undercity.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like he headed toward the lower reaches.

speaker: Ada
dialogue: There’s nothing down there but chem-waste.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: And chem-gangs. You do not want to mess with them.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That no-account gunslinger… He’s tryin’ to sell the fetter!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’ve gotta get down there and ruin his sale. Come on—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna stops as a shadowy pall comes over the group.]

speaker: Ada
dialogue: What just happened? I feel… really… sad and slow. Like I just want to roll over and die.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, no! I... know this feeling… it’s…

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Yeah… It’s me.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Shadow Lord! Have you at last come to slay me, and put an end to the grand epic of Olaf?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: [SIGH] Nah. I dunno. Maybe? I think I’m just s’posed to… y’know, stop you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a wave of Vex’s tiny hand, a shadow appears beneath the sentinels’ feet.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You feel it holding you, slowing your movement, like tar.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’re on the wrong side here, Vex. Let us pass so we can get this fetter.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Yeah, see, that’s the part I have to stop. Viego needs that dumb, magic fetter thing.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: He’s going to use it to make the world awful and depressing and ugly. For me.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That what he told you? Heh. Must be quite a slick talker.

speaker: Vex

responses.dialogue: Viego’s not doing this for you. He’s trying to resurrect his dead wife. That’s what all this is about. You’ve been played, Vex.
Those fetters—they’re not for making the world ugly. They’re for bringing back his wife, Isolde. He’s doing this for love.

dialogue: What’re you talking about?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: What? ...No. You’re lying. Viego would never do something so... uncool.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The kid’s telling you the truth. The Ruined King just wants his queen.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And we’re about to lose another piece of her. Please, LET US PASS.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: No. NO. I am not going to listen to your tryhard lies.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You’re trying to manipulate me. Just like my parents.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex hurls a shadowy projectile. You struggle free from the shadow at your feet, just in time to evade the attack.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: “Vex, honey, you’re so much prettier when you smile. Vex, you’d feel happier if you wore brighter colors.”

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Well, this is the truth. This is the REAL ME.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: So, just accept it. ...Or don’t. Whatever.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex casts shadow after shadow at the sentinels. You all dive for cover behind an old steam pipe.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re running out of time. If he sells that fetter...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look down the dimly lit street to see the Black Mist flowing into the lower reaches, clearly marking your path.]

speaker: Ada
dialogue: Go, boss! We’ll hold her off!

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Ada’s right! We can handle this!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. I couldn’t.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Commander, this is what we’ve trained for! We’re well-versed in shadow magic defense!

speaker: Ada
dialogue: We’ll be fine! Trust us!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna agonizes for a moment, uncertain of her decision.]

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: They seem experienced. I bet they can hold their own.
That shadow yordle is almost as strong as Viego. They don’t stand a chance against her.

dialogue: What do you think, Rookie?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna gives a nod to Dess and Ada.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Right. Cover us.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sentinels—let’s make a run for it!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [On Senna’s signal, you and the other sentinels sprint toward the passage to the lower levels.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Behind you, the sounds of gunfire and shadow magic resume. You have no time to look back though, as you leap into the depths of lower Zaun.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What choice do we have?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Some of us could stay behind and fight alongside them.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: If we meet Viego down here, it’s going to take all of us to hold him off.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Vayne’s right. Keep the team together. We all run for it while Dess and Ada hold off the Shadow Critter.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Later…]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...And may we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...May we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Vayne.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Fight bravely, and remember your oath.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ooh! I’m quivering with excitement!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: May I help you choose your sentinel accessories? Oh, do say yes.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Sure. Let’s go, Scissors. Suit me up.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As soon as the recruits leave, Lucian finds Senna lost in thought.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What’s wrong? It’s not like you to miss an induction ceremony.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I can’t believe she’s still in there. Still clinging to me.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We talkin’ about the ghost lady again?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Shh. I’m trying to listen for her. But...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Wait— YES! There she is!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s soft… not even a whisper. But she’s there.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s holding on for a reason. She wants…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She wants me to fight him. And win.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Not sure about that, Senna. I know you’re not going to want to hear this, but...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Maybe Scissors was right to protect you back there in the mageseeker vault.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t you start again.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: All I’m saying is if this piece of the Ruined Queen is what’s keeping you alive, and it’s what Viego is trying to take…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Then maybe it’s best if you stay far away from him. And let the rest of us go fight him.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Dammit, Lucian! This is my fight!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You don’t get to tell me how to fight it.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, everyone, you must look!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Isn’t she simply wonderful! A wardrobe change for the better, I must say.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah, not bad. Thanks for the haircut, Scissors.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: The fancy magic crossbow feels good too.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Now let’s go find some wraiths to test it on.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Indeed! I do love it when they shriek!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: See that? You’ve got an eager team.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: At least let ‘em help you.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fine. Tell them to fire up the Worldstone map.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We need to get on Viego’s trail before it goes cold.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Meanwhile, far across Runeterra...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego holds the mirror he stole from the mageseeker vault, staring at it with satisfaction.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: The rest of the pieces are out there. Hiding...

speaker: Viego
dialogue: I will find them all, even as the world itself stands in my way.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: For my Mist spreads far, to all corners of Runeterra, searching for what I’ve lost.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Your victory is imminent, my king.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I know I have not always been a loyal servant. But it would be my honor to aid you in finding the fetters—

speaker: Viego
dialogue: I have no need of your help, Thresh.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: My Harrowing spreads faster than ever. Thanks to my new advisor.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah, Vex. I was just speaking of you. How did you fare in your mission?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: I did it. Spread the Mist all over the place, just like you wanted.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Well done, my sad, pallid cohort.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Aw, you don’t need to compliment me.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Spreading misery is what brings me joy. I mean… brings me misery. I mean— joyous misery...?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You know what I mean.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Certainly. And now that my Harrowings are everywhere, I can at last find what I have sought for so long.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Soon, I will have all the pieces.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: And may reclaim what was lost… oh so long ago.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As Viego revels, his throne room swells with potent Black Mist.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the rear of the room, unseen by the king, Thresh siphons souls from the Mist... with curious results.]

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Indeed. Let us reclaim what was lost.
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels meet up with Miss Sarah Fortune, who's recently recovered a fetter. When the sentinels explain the object's value, she leaves to make a deal with Viego, and the team pursues her.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Senna tries to talk her out of the deal, but Fortune insists her power struggle with Gangplank is too important. The rest of the sentinels persuade her to join with them, and to give them the fetter if they can defeat Viego. Still, no one trusts her.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: On their way through the slaughter docks, the group comes upon Pyke fighting a group of wraiths. After a tense misunderstanding, Senna convinces him to fight the wraiths barring their path, allowing them to keep tracking Viego.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels find Viego in a warehouse, where Miss Fortune betrays them and offers Viego the fetter. At her urging, he ruins her, and a battle breaks out. Before fleeing, Viego collapses the warehouse, and in the struggle, the Wayfinder is lost.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Dispirited at the loss of their only transportation, the sentinels' day gets even worse when Miss Fortune shows up to finish them off. At the last moment, Pyke shows up to drag her to the deep and returns the Wayfinder to the relieved group.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Having ruined Olaf’s chance at a hero’s death, the sentinels fend off his furious attacks.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Stand still, and take what’s coming to ya!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf repeatedly swings his axes at the sentinels, who narrowly evade or deflect each blow.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know, I think ol’ Olaf’s gotten angrier since I saw him. And more forgetful.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Must’ve taken a lot of blows to the helmet.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Wish I’d taken more of those. (...There’s a lot I’d like to forget.)

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Perhaps he just needs some help finding his joy. You know, some kind words to soothe his hot temper?

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: Gwen’s right. Sometimes, words can be used to quell violence. I was a diplomat before joining the sentinels. Perhaps I can talk him down...
You’d be surprised how quickly you can gain someone’s trust by talking. I used to be a con artist. Allow me…
Actually, talking to someone can work wonders. I took several classes in de-escalation during training. Watch and learn...

dialogue: If you think you can deal with this guy using words, you’re even dumber than the Rookie here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, what are you doing?!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Ya think ya can use fancy words on Olaf? I’ll remove your blathering head from your weakling body!

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Uh, Mr. Barbarian, sir? Instead of killing me, why not have a seat and tell me what’s really bothering you?
It’s a shame you’re about to kill me. I was hoping you’d show me how to craft one of those fashionable helmets.
Ah, going to chop my head off, huh? I suppose I deserve it. But before I die, would you mind telling me how I can grow a beard as lush as yours?

dialogue: [Olaf takes a swing at your head. His axe just misses your skull but takes off a piece of your hair.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Hey, I know what you’re trying to do! And it won’t work!

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Wait! I know the reason you’re so angry. You’re just afraid you won’t be remembered. That’s all any of us want, right?
Fine. Take your best shot. Kill me now, if you’ve got the guts.
PleaseDon’tKillMeI’mTooYoungToDie!

dialogue: [Olaf raises his axe above his head, ready to split you in two.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. Now that you’ve calmed down a bit, I’ve got a proposition.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That yordle you were fighting—she’s got something to do with the Harrowing here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What if we help you find her? You get your worthy foe. We get to fight the Harrowing. Everybody wins.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Hmm. I like the part where Olaf gets a worthy foe!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: But how will ya pin down the shadow lord? She’s powerful, and moves through the Mist at will, aided by her devious shadow servant—

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: There she is. High atop that ice mountain! As drab and joyless as ever.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Carry me faster, Shadow.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Let’s just get that stupid magical thing and get out of this dump.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s after something in that glacier. Looks like some kind of glowing artifact?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Another magical trinket. But why?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, Olaf. There goes your worthy foe. Now, how do we get up that ice wall?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Oh, Olaf can get ya up there.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s what I like to hear. Let’s move.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: It should only take a couple of hours if we take the ice caves.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A couple of hours?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ice caves?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Of course. You southerners… You think ya can just walk straight up a glacier?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Unless any of ya has a magic shadow servant to carry ya, it’s the ice caves for us all.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [SIGH] I’ll probably regret saying this, but… Sure, let’s follow this maniac into a cold, dark cave.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What? Oh… well, if ya really want to hear about it. It all started when I was...

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Oh, it’s easy! First ya find an animal, preferably one with horns.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Then ya take your sharpest axe and...

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Certainly! But I’m not sure how much I can teach ya about beards. Most of it’s in the Freljordian blood, I’m afraid.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: My father had the same beard, and his father had the same beard, and his grandmother had it, and...

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What? NO! I mean...

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Of course I want to be remembered!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I want songs to be sung of my glorious death. At the hands of a legendary foe.

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: I know, Olaf. I know.
[SNICKER UNDER YOUR BREATH AT OLAF’S VULNERABILITY]

dialogue: To not fade from this world without leaving some bootprints in the snow.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What? You’re just going to stand there while I carve ya up?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What kind of madness...?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Ah, you’re looking for a hero’s death, too!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Well, you’ll not be getting it from me, ya daft rascal!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You know, I misjudged you. You’re alright…

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: (...For a daft rascal.)

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Aghh! Enough with your sniveling!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What kind of cowardly...?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I can’t even waste the edge of my blade on ya. It wouldn’t be honorable to kill such a weak, craven—

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s enough. Nobody abuses our Rookie but me.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Aw, I don’t even have proper insults for ‘em anyway!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You’ve taken the vinegar right out of Olaf. And that’s no easy task.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As you follow the trail of Mist through the jungle, Lucian vents his frustrations.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...And that’s the problem, ain’t it? The more I love Senna, the more I wanna keep her safe.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And that just gets her more rankled.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Hmm. Rengar is certain she will come around.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: It sounds like she is just focused on her own hunt.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah, well, the way she’s going about this hunt... it just might be her last.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: If only there was some way I could end this before she gets herself killed.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Shh. My whiskers are twitching. We have found our game.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Just ahead of you, a large cloud of Black Mist has accumulated outside the ruins of an old temple.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the center of the cloud, a pale green figure stands, arms and fingers splayed, absorbing power from the Mist.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: This is no prey. It is… another apex predator.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Thresh!

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Ah. Sentinels. I was hoping we might meet here.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie, Rengar—get ready.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: We should signal the others!
Thresh? As in… Senna’s Thresh?
Say the word, and I will kick this ghost in the neck.

dialogue: [Lucian and Rengar ready their weapons.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ain’t a thing you could say that I’d wanna hear, Thresh!

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I have a feeling you’d change your mind, if you knew what I had to show you…

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: An ancient secret, to help you in your quest…

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: ...and turn the tide of your fight against the Harrowing.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You. Want to help me. In my fight against the Harrowing?

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: [SNIFF SNIFF] I know that smell. It is deception—a predator’s trick!

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I see I’ll not get anything past you.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: You’re right. I was not being completely forthcoming.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I expect to gain something from this.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: A treasure, located within the ruins of this temple.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: You help me retrieve it, and I give you valuable information.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Information that could help you defeat the Ruined King.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You want to make a deal with me... to help me defeat the Ruined King?!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now I’ve heard everything.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This is me—Lucian. You remember me, right? We got history, and it ain’t exactly a happy one.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Neither is my history with Viego.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Do you have any idea how it feels? To go from warden of your own domain…

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: ...to a mere prop in someone else’s love story?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: An errand boy to some narcissistic fool, lost in some bygone era?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I can imagine.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Then you know I am telling the truth.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Follow me into this temple, and I swear to you—we will both leave richer.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I am many things, Lucian. But a liar is not one of them.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I keep my word.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Helllll no. This guy is up to nothing but evil. Don’t go anywhere with him!
He does seem to hate Viego. Let’s hear what he has to say.
I’m not sure. We’re already working with cold-blooded killers. How much worse can this guy be?

dialogue: What’s your feelin’ on this, kid?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Thresh might be the one person who hates Viego more than we do.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And if he’s got somethin’ that might give us a leg up…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...well then, I reckon I’ll take it.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: That would be… rather unfortunate.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I was hoping to have a word with you in private.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You wanna think of another way to phrase that?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: In answer to your question, young one: Yes...

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: ...I kept Senna safe in my lantern, for many years.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s a mighty generous way to put it!

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Calm yourself, Lucian. I bear no ill will toward you.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Wish I could say the same for me. Get ready to push daisies, creep.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Such animosity, from events long past. When all I wish is to discuss your future.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Yes! Rengar will assist you in this neck attack!

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: That would be rather unfortunate. I was hoping to have a word with you.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I think you’ll want to hear what I have to say.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Rengar agrees. This Thresh predator makes my hair very large.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: We must kill him or retreat at once.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I know that’s the smart move. And trust me, on any other day, I’d be right there with you. BUT...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: As much as I hate to admit it, I think you’re right.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You got that right. This whole Harrowing situation has made some mighty strange allies, huh?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The way I see it…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Somewhat discouraged, you and the sentinels follow Viego’s trail to Piltover.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So, this is Piltover, huh? The City of Progress.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Thought it’d have more… I dunno, contraptions and flyin’ doo-dads?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And I thought it’d be more ruined. Where’s the Harrowing?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look around to see the Black Mist is indeed nowhere to be found.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Huh. Maybe King Creep hasn’t found his way here yet.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You saw the worldstone map at headquarters. Looked like the Black Mist had overtaken the whole continent. It should be here.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Why don’t we ask that grimey ne'er do well with the cigar?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, Mr. Nasty Bad Habits!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You talkin’ to me, kid?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We were wondering if you’ve seen any signs of a Harrowing in this city?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know—Black Mist… people acting funny… pale green ghost king with a giant sword?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Sounds like you’re talkin’ ‘bout Bilgewater. That whole damn place is swimmin’ with Harrowin’.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Gotten so a fella can’t pull a heist no more, with all the ghouls and Black Mist and whatnot.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I came here to get away from that stuff.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: These fancy-pants Piltovans got these hextech contraptions that blow all the Mist away. It’s the damnedest. Here, I can vacation in peace.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Aw, you’re here on vacation? You must let me stitch you a swimming suit. You simply cannot go to a public beach wearing that.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You touch my duds and we’ll have us a problem, little lady.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I don’t need no swimmin’ hole to enjoy my time off. My vacation is goin’ to rich places with lots of money and robbin’ the crap out of ‘em.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I don’t need nothin’ but rich folks, and ol’ Destiny here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves proudly pats the stock of his scattergun.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Ha! He sails halfway around the world to pillage! Sounds like some of Olaf’s ancestors.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Now, if you’ll excuse me, I’ve gotta find a bank to knock over.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves starts to walk away but comes face to face with a startling sight…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A river of Black Mist comes pouring around the corner, heading straight for Graves and the sentinels.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Aw, hells.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s what I was gonna say.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Guess them fancy Mist-stoppin’ machines must’a broke!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels and Graves run for cover as the Black Mist comes roaring by, filling the street with its vile presence.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Well, this sure puts a damper on my vacation plans.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s looking for another fetter. We need to find it first. Come on!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels follow the Mist’s path through the streets of Piltover, with Graves following closely behind.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You arrive at the window of a small curio shop. The Mist presses against the glass of the store, seeking entry.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Seems like the fetter must be in this shop.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [An antique parasol in the window display begins to glow with magic.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The light in Senna’s chest flickers in response.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: There it is! That parasol.

speaker: Graves

responses.dialogue: Indeed. It’s a piece of the Queen of Camavor’s soul! Gwen is one too. And so is Senna. Isn’t that neat?
One of many. Viego wants to collect them all to revive his dead wife.
Oh, it’s nothing you’d be interested in. Just a plain ol’ parasol. Seriously, nothing to see here.

dialogue: Hell, you say that’s a fetter?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Seems to me there’s an awful lotta demand for this thing.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: And high demand means high coin. I’ll be seein’ you rubes later.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh? Leaving already? But you’ve scarcely begun your vacation—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves pulls a canister from his belt and throws it to the ground. It quickly fills the street with thick, gray smoke.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though you can’t see your hand in front of your face, you hear the sound of glass shattering.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What the hell is going on?! I can’t see!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gradually, the smoke dissipates.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Where is it? The fetter! He stole the fetter!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Why, that low-down snake in the grass… What’s he gonna do with a piece of some dead woman’s soul?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Give it back to us, after we catch up to him and beat him to a pulp.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: How are we supposed to find him? We don’t even know which way he went.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. But the Mist does.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The Black Mist begins to change course, searching for the missing fetter. Like a bloodhound, it picks up Graves’s trail and follows him down the street.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh-huh. Let’s get after that soul-stealin’ bandit.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Interestin’... Mighty interestin’.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Interestin’... Mighty interestin’.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: That right?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Kid, I’ve seen a lot of antique parasols in my day.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: And ain’t none of ‘em made this kinda fuss.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a long chase, the sentinels corner Karma in a ruined meadow.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Stop! Hand over the trinket.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’d hate to have to purify a holy woman.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Such malice in your soul, Lucian…

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Perhaps you should look within, and purify yourself.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look on in horror as Karma plunges deeper into ruination.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Thick plumes of Black Mist swirl about her body, as she fires a magic tether from her palm.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The tether holds Lucian in place, and slowly begins to choke the life from his body.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Open fire!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the sentinels attack Karma with their relic weapons, Irelia leaps to the front, her blades poised to strike.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You betray the First Lands.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: No. I bring them love. The purest love, one befitting the First Lands.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With graceful ferocity, Irelia slings her blades at Karma.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma responds with a burst of magic that knocks the blades and Irelia clear across the field.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Such peace. So tranquil. Here, let me show you...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Her hands pulsing with harrowed spirit magic, Karma levitates across the clearing toward Irelia.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Stop right there!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven leaps into action, slashing at Karma with her relic blade. The other sentinels lend their support, filling the meadow with the light of their weapons.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In moments, the fight is over. Karma collapses to the ground, incapacitated by the sentinels’ relic weapons.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Freed from her magic tether, Lucian stumbles toward Karma and snatches the silver flower from her hand.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: [PANT] ...Not so peaceful now… are you…? [PANT]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma looks up at you, with pitch black eyes that seem to channel some great evil from beyond the realm of the living. She speaks with a voice that is not her own.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: You think you are heroes, saving the world from darkness…

speaker: Karma

responses.dialogue: I don’t need to hear anymore from you. Let’s finish her off, sentinels!
Okay, I’ll bite. Tell me this love story.
Hey, I did not travel halfway around the world fighting Mist monsters to be called a villain. Take it back!

dialogue: But you are villains... in the greatest love story ever to be told.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: You will DIE! No. NO! Stay back!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma seems to struggle within herself, vying for control with the vile entity that has possessed her.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Her ruination miraculously fades. With all her former clarity, she speaks to you in dire tones.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Please… I have much to say...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Wait. Let her speak.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Long ago, in the Land of Camavor… two lovers…

speaker: Karma
dialogue: A young king, Viego, took as his bride a seamstress named Isolde.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Their romance was enchanting, their love true… until tragedy ripped them apart.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Isolde is still broken. She must be put together once more. Her pieces…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: The fetters.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: They are aspects of her. Unique facets of her persona...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Karma points to Senna.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Fierce protector…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [She points to Gwen.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Youthful joy…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [She looks at the silver flower in Lucian’s hand.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Resilient beauty.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: But they are only pieces, never meant to be separate. See?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The light in Senna’s chest begins to glow once more. It flickers, calling out to the other pieces of Isolde.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Both Gwen and the silver flower begin to glow, their lights pulsing in unison with Senna’s. It seems as if the three are communicating.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [An incomplete silhouette of a woman forms between the three.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s… her.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: No. It is but a fragment of her.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Once again, Karma begins to struggle for control of herself.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: She is incomplete… and… and…

speaker: Karma
dialogue: So she will be until he remakes her.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: You have no right to keep them apart. Let her be whole!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Gosh—I’m the Ruined Queen’s joy?! What should I do? I have so many questions!
[SHRIEEEEK]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’ll answer them later. The wraiths have found us!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Across the meadow, a large mob of wraiths bursts out of the woods, calling to each other with blood-curdling shrieks.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [They spot the sentinels and begin to charge.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Karma! We have to go! Can you get up?!

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Do not fret for me, Irelia. I have found… peace.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let her go! She’s gone! We’ve got to get this fetter to the Grove of the Ancients!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Sprinting with all their might, the sentinels flee down the path leading to the Grove.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You take one last look behind to see Karma, still lying on the ground.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [She looks up at you in bliss as the mob of wraiths overtakes her, swallowing her in thick, writhing darkness.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Having escaped the gladiator prison, the sentinels find themselves on the streets of the Noxian capital.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Whew! I am ever so relieved to be out of that place.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m glad to have our weapons back. Swingin’ that bucket really did a number on my shoulder.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Where to now? Anyone got a plan, or should we just chat away while the monsters take over?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hmm. I say we let the Mist guide us.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And the Mist seems to be flowing to that old fortress over there.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna points to an ancient foreboding structure. Black Mist pours in through its tightly guarded doors and parapets.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: That’s the Immortal Bastion. All the secrets of the Noxian Empire are locked away inside.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: More magic secrets. The Mist is seekin’ them out. But why?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: There’s only one way to find out.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Aye. We charge the doors, both axes swingin’ with all the fury of the ursine!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I was going to suggest we scout out the perimeter and try to find a weak spot where we can sneak in.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Aye. I can see how that might be “safer”. (...Though far less glorious.)

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: From where I'm standin', I don't see much of a way in. And the place is crawlin' with wraiths.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: We could always jump one of the wraiths and take its keys.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Is that your idea for everything?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It was a joke. ...Thought that was obvious.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From the corner of your eye, you see something black fluttering by.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You turn your gaze to see a stream of wraiths flying toward a statue of a massive, armored overlord in the middle of the thoroughfare.]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Those wraiths—they're all going into the base of that statue. What’s that about?
Whatever we do, we should avoid that creepy statue. That thing is haunted!
I don’t wanna alarm everyone, but… that statue is eating wraiths.

dialogue: [One by one, the wraiths slither through a crack in the statue’s pedestal, disappearing from sight.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. I reckon that statue is not what it seems to be. Gimme a hand here…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian leans into the statue, pushing it with his shoulder. He looks at you expectantly.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the other sentinels assist, leaning into the statue with all your might.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [It soon tips over, leaving a gaping hole in its pedestal, just big enough for a person to climb through.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Beneath the hole, you can just barely see a dark corridor running beneath the city streets.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: There it is.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Glory be! We’ve stumbled upon an underground tunnel!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: That’d be the catacombs...

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: Who would that be? You mean the Noxian king or something?
Why would they need to move secretly if they run Noxus?
And have secret underground parties! ...Right? ...Because that’s what I’d do.

dialogue: I’ve heard rumors, but never seen them. They say the people who run Noxus use them to get around in secret.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Anyway, if the people I’m thinking of use these catacombs, they definitely lead to the Immortal Bastion.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sounds like we’re going into the hole, sentinels. Who’s itchin’ to sneak inside the secret heart of Noxus?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Not so fast, Lucian. I’ll go into the Bastion. I need you to make sure we aren’t followed.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh-uh. I know you’re not sayin’ what I think you’re sayin’.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m saying I need people to watch my back and make sure no wraiths come up from behind.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Meanin’ you’re goin’ it alone.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. I’ll take Riven. She knows Noxus.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Oh. You want me on this?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s the matter?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Let’s just say I’ve seen enough darkness in Noxus. Not sure I want to see more.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: But you did bust me out of the reckoner pits. And for that, I suppose I owe you.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. Rookie, you come, too...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hold up. Rookie gets to go?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I might need that kid’s silver tongue to talk us out of trouble again.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Silver. Right.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna and Riven jump down the hole into the pitch-black catacombs. You start to follow, but Lucian grabs your shoulder.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie—look after her.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: That… sounded vaguely threatening. I get the message loud and clear.
I promise you, sir, I will do my best to protect her.
Oh, for Pete’s sake—I just started this job! What do you want from me?!

dialogue: I mean it. If she gets hurt…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before Lucian can say anymore, Senna reaches up through the hole and yanks you down into the catacombs.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: You got a lot to learn about Noxus, kid. And I don’t have the energy to give you a civics lesson right now.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: You got a lot to learn about Noxus, kid. And I don’t have the energy to give you a civics lesson right now.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels all glare at you in silence, making you wish you’d never been born.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You instantly regret allowing your youthful frivolity to show, and take it as a lesson in choosing your words.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After sneaking your way past throngs of Mist wraiths, you arrive at a lowly tavern near the edge of the city.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This is it. The Singing Swan. Looks even worse than the last time I was here.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Someone ought to have a talk with the owner. Appearances do matter, even to the weariest traveler.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I don’t care if the roof’s caving in. Let’s get inside before these wraiths notice us.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You try the door of the tavern but find it locked up tight.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You knock firmly. A WOMAN’S VOICE answers curtly from inside.]

responses.dialogue: We’ve come to help. We’re sentinels.
For the love of the gods, please open the door! We’re sentinels!

dialogue: Yeah?
How do I know that?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I could blow the door off the hinges. That might prove it.

speaker: Narrator
