dialogue: [The door is flung open. A hand pulls you inside and slams the door behind you, barring it shut.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Sorry about that. You can’t be too careful right now.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Those things are everywhere.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Some of them talk, too. You don’t know they’re not normal until it’s too late.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You sound like you've been through all of the hells tonight.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Got that right. Lost most of our guard to those monsters.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I don’t think I managed to kill a single one.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: They keep getting back up.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s your crossbow. It’s not made for killing wraiths.

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: Not Black Mist monsters. They can only be put down by weapons made with relic stones.
Heh. They’re wraiths. Technically, they can’t be “killed.” Just neutralized.
This is the work of Viego, the Ruined King of Camavor. It can only be undone by sentinel armaments.

dialogue: What are you talking about? This baby’s loaded with prime silver bolts. More than enough for any monster.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Who’s the know-it-all?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: New sentinel. A rookie.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’ve been calling ‘em “Rookie.”

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Clever.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Listen, Rookie… I’ve been hunting magical creatures my whole life. I lost everything to them... Hate them with every ounce of my being.

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: I’m sorry. I—I didn’t mean any offense... Please don’t hurt me.
I’m sure you’re great at killing monsters, but this is different. This is a Harrowing.

dialogue: Do you really think I don’t know how to kill them?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie’s right. These wraiths are the servants of the Ruined King. Only sentinel weapons can end them.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Got a couple extras back at headquarters. If you’re interested, I could swear you in and get you a relic gun of your own.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Save it. I kill magical creatures. Not trying to be one.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uh-huh. Well, I think we’ve gotten all the intelligence we’re going to get out of this place.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Wait…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Maybe we should team up. We all hate monsters. I know the city…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Let me guess. You don’t wanna die alone in here?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What kind of coward do you take me for?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Through Vayne’s tough façade, you can hear the faintest tinge of fear in her voice.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You can come along. But you should know we’re only going deeper into danger.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We need to find the heart of this Harrowing.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You mean the mageseeker compound?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Mageseeker compound?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s where the worst of this stuff is happening. It’s almost like it’s all flowing toward the building.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What goes on in there?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: It’s where the mageseekers keep the magical items they confiscate.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sounds like Viego’s looking for something magical. And powerful.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Just like what he took from me.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t like that look in your eye. Maybe you going into the heart of this ain’t the best way to—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s head out, sentinels. On my count.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: One… two…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...three!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With your sentinel comrades at your side, you charge out the door of the tavern, into the fray of the Harrowing.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Just messing with you, Rookie. No one’s gonna hurt you.

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: I don’t think so.
I mean, I can’t say for sure, but… no?

dialogue: ...Unless you’re a monster. You’re not a monster are you?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Like I said, no one’s gonna hurt you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You follow Graves’s trail to an old chem-tech laboratory in the lower reaches of Zaun.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Here we are. End of the trail.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I reckon our fetter rustler must be inside that building.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lock ‘n’ load, sentinels.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I wouldn’t do that.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I’ve heard of these chem-tech factories. This place is probably loaded with… well, chemicals.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: If a gunfight breaks out around that stuff…

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: We’ll all be burned alive.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Yes. I have seen the effects of such an explosion.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: And so has she.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Listen, Irelia—I don’t know what you think you know about me, but I was NOT the one who—!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stop! ...BOTH of you!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I take your point about the chemicals. Maybe it’s best if one of us goes in and tries to get the fetter without using weapons.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t like it. Never once met a problem that guns couldn’t settle.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’ve never once been in a chem-tech factory. Sorry, babe. Not letting you blow us all up today.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: So what’s our option then? Is one of us supposed to waltz in there and talk it over with this dirtbag?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Actually…

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Aaah, crap. You’re going to make me go in there, aren’t you?
Sure. I’m good at talking. I can probably figure something out.

dialogue: [Your heart sinks as you realize Senna is looking directly at you.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Wearing a hooded cloak to conceal your identity, you enter the factory alone.]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Whoa! I don’t think you want to do that in here!
Hey. You the guy selling the… stolen thing?
‘Sup. You know where I can score some fetters, man?

dialogue: [Behind a vat of highly flammable chem-waste, you find Graves—attempting to light a cigar.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Now—what I got here is special. Ain’t no common, ordinary, everyday loot.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: That there’s a piece of the Ruined Queen herself.

speaker: Graves

responses.dialogue: You are in luck, my criminally enterprising friend. It just so happens that I am a wealthy fancy pants who owns all Piltover!
[REACH INTO POCKETS] Of course. If you’ll allow me to take out my coin purse, I think you’ll find my offer more than sufficient...
You’re selling the Ruined Queen’s soul? Do you ever wonder if that’s immoral? Or at least dangerous?

dialogue: So, I’m gonna expect you to pay a royal price. You got me?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Stranger… I think you best DRAW!

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: OKAY, OTHER SENTINELS, I COULD USE SOME HELP NOW!
[ULTRA-COOL] I hate to break it to ya, partner, but... this ain’t the first time I’ve seen the end of a gun barrel.
Hey, hey, EASY. I’m not trying to pull a fast one. Look—I’m not even armed.

dialogue: [With a mean glint in his eye, Graves pulls his scattergun on you.]

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: Vayne! I knew you’d rescue me! ...Wait, you’re talking about me, right?
Vayne! You came here for me?

dialogue: Let the idiot go.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Shut up.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And hand over that fetter while you’re at it.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Haw! You folks talk about as big as your guns.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: But I think we both know neither of you have the guts to use those—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Without warning, Vayne fires a bolt of light from her crossbow—directly at Graves’s head.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves ducks just in time. The shot from the crossbow whizzes by his head, barely missing.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Holy— YOU JUST SHOT AT ME!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Idiot, and fetter, NOW.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Uh-huh. Hey, I got a better idea—

speaker: Graves
dialogue: How’s about I shoot back instead?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves pulls the trigger on his scattergun. A hail of hex-shot rips through everything in the room.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From your cover, you smell the distinct odor of chemicals leaking from the vats around you.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You tellin’ me what to do, stranger?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Oh, wait—you’re the buyer, ain’t ya?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Stolen?! Fella, I don’t know what kinda two-bit hustler you take me for…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: This here thing I’m sellin’ was rightly acquired through hard, honest work.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You start to sweat as Graves looks you over with contempt.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You talk funny.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I don’t like folks that talk funny.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You wanna buy from me, it’s regular talk only, okay?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You own all Piltover?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I guess that’d make YOU the one who got all bent outta shape about me robbin’ your bank that time.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I did a month in jail ‘cause of you, you miserable, scum-suckin’ dandy!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves looks on eagerly as you empty your pockets.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [His expression fades into a scowl, as he sees a single piece of pocket lint fall from your empty hand.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Let me get this straight…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You came all the way out here. To a toxic chem-tech factory. At the bottom of Zaun…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: … and didn’t bring no money?!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Let me get this straight…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You came all the way out here. To a toxic chem-tech factory. At the bottom of Zaun…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Just to preach to me?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Who the hell are you talkin’ at?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You crazy pissant.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You got some kinda deathwish or somethin’?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You crazy pissant.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You got some kinda deathwish or somethin’?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [On the peak of Targon, the sentinels behold a strange sight]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Beams of white cosmic light swirl about the thick plumes of Black Mist, each repelling the other, like oil and water.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the eye of the chaos, Viego retrieves an old copper sundial. Though green with age, it shines with a magical luminescence.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: There she is. Another piece of my love. Thank you for your assistance, Aspect.

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: We are called to destruction, be it by war, or Harrowing.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Yes, yes. Go make your wars now. Off with you.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Drop the fetter! Now!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah, Senna. I knew you’d come to your senses.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: At last, you’ve come to relinquish your piece of my beloved queen.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Keep dreaming, Ruined Creep. I’ve come to make sure you don’t leave Targon with that fetter.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’ve got a moon goddess, and we ain’t afraid to use her.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: He speaks true. The Night Matron has come to bring dusk to your reign.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah. Then it seems I must respond in kind...

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Oh, Pantheon? Before you run off to plunge the world into endless war, perhaps you could wage a small one right here?

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: I will whet my spear on their bones.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a single mighty swat of his spear, Pantheon knocks the sentinels off the peak...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and sends them crashing onto the plateau beneath it.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Ooof! ...Ow. I think I just broke my blade again.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: And maybe my tailbone.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: If it’s a war this fellow wants, it’s a war he’ll get!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: AHHHH, I FEEL THE RAGE COMING OVER ME!

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: You must be reborn, as I was...

speaker: Pantheon

responses.dialogue: Buddy, we are sentinels, and most of us have relic weapons. If I was you, I’d think twice about this.
Oh, no. <WHEEZ> I did not just climb thousands of feet up Mount Targon to do battle with the Aspect of War. Can’t I get a breather first?
Pantheon, you jerk! I was at the peak, ready to be greeted by the Aspects! They would’ve given me amazing powers! I will never forgive you for this!

dialogue: ...through combat, and suffering.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We can take this guy. We’ve got Diana, and we outnumber him.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pantheon pounds the butt of his spear on the ground in a steady rhythm that echoes across the surrounding valleys.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In response, an entire army of wraiths materializes at his rear. They bear matching armaments, and lock their shields together in a tight phalanx.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I had to say somethin’.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pantheon raises his spear aloft, and his army of wraiths advances toward you, with shields and spears raised.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, would you look at that? They’ve got matching uniforms!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: ...And their synchronized movements are so snappy!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Can you not admire things that are trying to stab us?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels attack with a volley of gunlight.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [But the shots deflect off the shields of the wraith phalanx.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re not getting through!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: I’ve faced such a formation before.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Really? I can’t imagine when.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: And do you know how we repelled it?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: We broke their formation! Stripped away their shields with our blades!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Strip their shields! Yaaaghhhhh!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf runs down the row of wraiths, knocking each shield away with his axe.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven joins in as well, smashing through the phalanx’s defenses with her blade.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: They’re open! Everyone fire!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The bladed sentinels continue to strip away the wraiths defenses, while the other sentinels follow up with gunfire.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a matter of minutes, Pantheon’s wraith army is destroyed.]

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: No matter. I am an army unto myself. And by my spear, you will know all war!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pantheon drives his spear at Olaf, catching him in the helmet and knocking him head over heels.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [He clubs Riven with his shield, knocking her to the ground.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Then Pantheon thrusts his spear at you...]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, look out!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Diana leaps in front of Pantheon, deflecting his spear. She hooks the curve of her crescent blade around the rim of his shield.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Atreus! If you’re in there, you must listen.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: You have lost control. The Ruined King has corrupted your mind with lies. But there is hope for Targon! I have seen it!

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: There is hope… in war.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Seeing her words are wasted, Diana pulls Pantheon’s shield away with her blade…]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Now!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels fire on Pantheon with everything they’ve got.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [He staggers back, toward the edge of the plateau…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [... and falls, thousands of feet, toward the valley below.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Farewell, worthy foe. Could’ve just as easily been me plummeting to a glorious end, but...

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: ...maybe next time.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Any sign of Viego?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. He’s no fool. He’s long gone by now. Gone to collect all those other pieces of her.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Let us pursue him then.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian and Senna exchange surprised smiles.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Why do we wait? We are going to pursue him. Right?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Listen, uh… Night Matron. You’re a god. Your place is here, on Targon.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s right. What about your followers? You saw those people in that cave. They need you.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: They need a future. And they will never have it, so long as this evil persists.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: As sure as the night must end each day, I must help you end this Harrowing.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian and Senna confer in private.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Senna…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I do like her enthusiasm. The fact that she’s a god doesn’t hurt either.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah, is there something special I’m supposed to call her?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I dunno. Never met a god before.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With some uncertainty, Lucian turns back to Diana.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It’d be an honor to have you on the team, uh… Your Holy… Night... Moonness.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: You may call me Diana.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: [SNICKER UNDER YOUR BREATH AT LUCIAN’S AWKWARDNESS]
Holy Night Moonness? Wow...

dialogue: Diana. Right.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Just fire up that Wayfinder, kid.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the sentinels prepare to deploy to the next battle, Riven and Irelia take you aside. They look serious.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Rookie. Do you have a moment?

speaker: Irelia

responses.dialogue: I have absolutely no idea what you’re talking about.
You two actually agree about something?
Why? I’m super strong and powerful and attractive.

dialogue: We need to speak about your… fighting ability.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Listen, we’ve been watching you fight. It isn’t pretty. You have next to no combat experience.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: And your situational awareness leaves… much to be desired.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Though it loathes me to ask, the butcher and I…

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Riven.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: The butcher and I would like to teach you some combat stances. Or… how do I say this? A more enlightened way of preparing for a fight.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: The two of us have a long and bloody history, and that can’t be solved here. But we’re going to teach you to forgive your enemies, even as you strike them down.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: But most of all, Rookie… we’ll teach you how to forgive yourself.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The three of you train into the night. Though the two of them seem at constant odds, you catch the odd smile on their faces as they spar.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Maybe they aren’t so hopeless after all. You have earned the [Merciful Warrior] upgrade.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I told you they were delusional.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Don’t get chummy with me, butcher.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Hmph. It’s... possible.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I’m just as surprised as you, Rookie.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: That is… hmm…

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: They’re in more trouble than we thought.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Later, at headquarters...]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Do you have everything locked up back there?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Locked? Why would we need locks?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A hardened jailbird with a history of thefts is in our weapons vault, Lucian. If he—

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Shh, he’s comin’.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Da-da-da-DAHHHH! Presenting, for your refined palates… the tasteful stylings of SENTINEL GRAVES!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: [GRUNT]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Alright, Malcolm. Raise your right hand and repeat after me…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Naw. I don’t think so.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Come again?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Let’s get one thing straight here…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I ain’t got no intention of bein’ some evil-squashin’ do-gooder.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I ain’t doin’ this for no “honorable death” or to “restore balance” or any other crap like that.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I’m doin’ this ‘cause this here Ruined King gave me the ol’ Bilgewater stick-up…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: And once I’ve settled the score with him, I’m outta here. I ain’t trying to be friends with nobody.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Matter of fact, I wouldn’t piss on a’ one of y’all if you was on fire.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves nods at Vayne, with a surprising amount of reverence.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: ‘Cept maybe you. You tried to kill me, Vayne, and I gotta respect that.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Good. Now fall in line, and take your damn oath...

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...before I try again.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Disarmed by Vayne’s blunt, threatening manner, Graves reluctantly raises his right hand and proceeds with the oath.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I, Malcolm Graves, swear by the light of the ancients...

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I, Malcolm Graves, swear by the light of the ancients...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Meanwhile, in the Shadow Isles…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego holds an ancient music box and stares at it with great longing.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Not much longer, my love. This, I swear to you.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: So, it’s true?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: All this dumb stuff you’re collecting… it’s really pieces of your wife?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: My dear Vex, I will never lie to you.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Indeed, these are her fetters. This music box… that mirror… the comb—once-cherished possessions that now bind her spirit.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: All must be found in order to bring her back to her rightful place at my side.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You’re doing all this for love? But that’s so… so… normie.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: I feel so… lied to. So… depressed.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: And not the good kind of depressed either.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: I guess we have pretty different visions of what a sad, ugly world looks like.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: See ya later, King.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As Vex walks toward the door, Viego thinks fast…]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Wait! My sullen cohort, I beg you not to go.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: For I have something truly great in store for you.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Not interested. Have a dumb life. I’m out.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: What I mean is—I have something truly… awful... in store for you.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: [SIGH] ...I’m listening.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Excellent. Have a seat. And I will tell you my horrible plans for you… and this world.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the back of the court, a lone figure hides among the crumbling stone columns, listening to Viego’s words…]

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: (Such grand plans, my king.)

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: (I wonder where I might fit in them.)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Back at headquarters, Irelia takes the sentinel oath...]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Irelia.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fight bravely, and remember your oath.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ready to choose your sentinel ensemble?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Hmm. I feel powerful, yet still graceful. ...It’s perfect.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Another well-dressed client!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Welcome to the team.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Not sure if you noticed back there, but when you got knocked on your ass in that meadow… I was the one who—

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: What would you like? A medal?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Do you think this changes anything? Are we to be friends now?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Shall I forget that you led a thousand bloodthirsty invaders to our shores?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: We may both be sentinels. But do not mistake us for allies.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I was just trying to be polite. Forget I said anything.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven storms off, spotting Lucian and Senna in an intimate discussion across the room.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You’re awful quiet. Having a Ruined Queen moment?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Isolde. Her name was Isolde. Still is, in fact.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s got all her fetters. If I had them, I could talk to her. The whole her.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What good’s that gonna do?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I don’t know. Might be good to know what she wants, is all.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: (Boy, howdy. Here it comes.)

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s split into all these different parts that feel different things. We don’t even know what they all think. What if…?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What if part of her really does want to be with Viego?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, for cryin’ out loud, Senna—what about what WE want?!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: If that tiny piece of Isolde is what’s keeping you alive, then I say we let it stay right where it is.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I can’t lose you again.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Did you need somethin’, Riven?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: No. Just found out I wasn’t welcome on the other side of the room, so… thought I’d try this one.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s just about time to head out anyway.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I think being stuck in here is making us all a little ornery.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I wasn’t being ornery.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels arrive on the coast of a ruined Ionia.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The waves, black and furious with Harrowing, roll over the remnants of an old sentinel base.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This is it, sentinels. Ionia, the First Lands. They say it’s where magic itself was born.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Is that why its ocean is so choppy? And ugly with Black Mist?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: And grabbing at my leg?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What in the—?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels look down to see tendrils of black seawater tugging at your legs, as if trying to drag you back out to the depths.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: My blades upon your shapeless watery neck, ocean!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf hacks the ocean tendrils with his axes, while the other sentinels fire shots from their weapons into the harrowed water.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined Ionian sea releases its grasp just enough for the sentinels to stumble away from the shore to safety.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Good ol’ dry land. Nice to see ya, friend.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: First time I’ve been attacked by an ocean. Well played, Ionia.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t get too comfortable. Someone’s out there. In the bushes.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels listen with bated breath for several seconds, but hear nothing. Then—]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie, look out!

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: [Duck.]
[Dive out of the way.]
[Use the Wayfinder to Parry each of the blades with cat-like alacrity.]

dialogue: [You look up to see a flash of metal blades slicing through the thicket, spinning toward your head.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You’ll go no further!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You invaders thought you could bring this foul darkness to Ionia?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No! It’s not like that—

speaker: Irelia

responses.dialogue: STOP! We’re the Sentinels of Light! We’re here to fight that foul darkness!
You’re going to kill the Sentinels of Light?! We’re your best chance at beating this foul darkness!
Don’t kill me! I just became a sentinel a few months ago! I barely know these people!

dialogue: This land will be your grave.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Sentinels of Light? If that’s true, then tell me…

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: What business do the sentinels have with a known war criminal?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You realize that Irelia is glaring angrily at Riven.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Riven? What do you have against her?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Ask her yourself. I’m sure the Butcher of the Bay would gladly tell you of her past.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Some in this land may have forgiven her. But I am not one of them.

responses.dialogue: You’re clearly mistaken. Riven is the only reason we got out of Noxus alive. She’s good people!
Riven seems like a stand-up person. So, if she did something to you... maybe you deserved it?
Uh, Riven? Is there something you’d like to tell us? Something about being a butcher in a bay?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: She’s right.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I… I was an officer. In the Noxian forces.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: During the war… I did some things I’m not proud of. Things I ran from. Still run from. I…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna interrupts and angrily comes to the defense of her new sentinel.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Her past is irrelevant.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: She committed atrocities. Because of her, thousands of Ionians are dead, never to walk this land again.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And you’ll be among them if you don’t help us fight what’s coming!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Like it or not—she fights the same foe as you now.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Now, do you want to dwell on the past? Or focus on the danger ahead?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You need our help. Work with us.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: ...You’re right.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: My blades have slain invaders by the score. Though I admit, I have no answer to this plague.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Our spiritual safeguard is falling. Karma—our Enlightened One—was always so steadfast...

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: But she’s been shaken, ever since this darkness arrived on our shores.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Where is Karma now?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: At the Lasting Altar. She’s meditating, communicating with the Spirit of Ionia, trying to find a way to heal us.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sounds like a good person to know. I need you to take us to her.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Very well. I will show the way. But I have one request.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Keep that one away from me. I do not trust her.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You duck, managing to avoid the worst of the attack...]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: OWOWOWOW! OH, GODS, I’M DYING!
Uh-oh. I think I’m hit. Didn’t really feel it though, being the warrior that I am.

dialogue: [...But the tip of one blade just manages to nick your ear.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: It’s just a small cut. Consider yourself lucky, Rook.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You dive out of the way just in time to avoid the blades, as they return to their apparent wielder...]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Yeah! Did you all see that?!
[SUPER-COOL] What else you got, blades?

dialogue: [You swing the Wayfinder at the fleet of spinning blades. You knock a couple aside, and the rest miraculously miss your body.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The blades regroup in midair, and return to their apparent wielder...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels arrive at the mageseeker compound. Black Mist pours into every door and window of the complex.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This is it. Whatever Viego is looking for, it’s within those walls.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Brace yourselves. We don’t know exactly what we’re walking into.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: I read you loud and clear.
Can’t I just use it now? I mean, maybe Demacia doesn’t need saving.

dialogue: Rookie, keep your hand on that Wayfinder. But don’t trigger it unless I say so. Got it?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. Everybody on board? On my count, we charge in. Ready?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: One…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Two...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Thr—

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Sentinels! Why… Why have you come here?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re here to end the Harrowing and liberate Demacia from the Black Mist. Who are you?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Shyvana.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Be careful with this one, Senna. She’s more monstrous than she appears.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Yes. Monstrous… The reason for all the suffering. Pain inflicted by my own kingdom.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: So many have suffered here, for so long. Simply for being different.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Perhaps it is best if this place is harrowed to its core. Perhaps a ruined Demacia would be an improvement.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You’re insane.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my! Her hue is changing! To a most unbecoming shade of green.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s becoming ruined. She’s giving in to the Mist!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Say the word, and I’ll put one right between her eyes.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: More threats... They fear us. They threaten and maim...

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: They banish us. Keep us in cages…

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Not anymore.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Shyvana shakes the surrounding walls of the mageseeker compound. Heavy pieces of petricite brick begin to fall.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my! This is most impolite!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Within seconds, you and the other sentinels are buried in rubble.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: [cough] Is everyone okay?! Senna?!

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: I’m alive. But I’m pretty stuck.
<cough> …<cough>... <wheeze>... Think I broke a rib, but I’m okay.
Actually, I feel remarkably safe under this rubble. Maybe we should stay here and wait this out?

dialogue: Get these rocks off me and I’ll be better. I can’t move. Rookie, you with us?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Can anyone move at all? ...Gwen?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: But my scissors are dandy.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen’s scissors hover freely in the air, awaiting her command.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: See if you can cut us out of here!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Snip snip! Away with these dusty old bricks!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen’s scissors begin snipping away at the rubble.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Piece by piece, the rubble disappears, until the sentinels are free.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Nice chopping, Scissors. You wield a mean pair of blades.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Where’s the beast woman? I’ve got a score to settle.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Save that anger. You’re going to need it for whatever’s inside this building.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Ready, sentinels?

speaker: Lucian and Gwen
dialogue: Ready!

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Sure... Run toward the Harrowing, right?
Hells yes! Let’s do this!
Um… Well… Hey, what if I stand guard out here?

dialogue: Rookie?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yep. You’re ready. Let’s go!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You need me to slap this kid?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Nah. I’ll straighten ‘em out.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It ain’t just Demacia, Rookie. We let this place fall, we let the world fall.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Harrowing begets Harrowing. Noxus, the Freljord, Ionia… Wherever the hell it is you come from—they’ll all fall to the Ruined King.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: No. It got knocked out of my hand! It’s buried in here somewhere.
Are you in the right headspace to receive some potentially terrible news?

dialogue: Can you reach your Wayfinder?

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: No. It got knocked out of my hand! It’s buried in here somewhere.
Are you in the right headspace to receive some potentially terrible news?

dialogue: Can you reach your Wayfinder?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s it. I’m slapping that kid. As soon as I get my arm free.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Vayne, do not slap our rookie.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Sorry, sir. But I can’t run toward anything right now. I’m stuck.
Thanks for the motivational speech, sir. I’d salute you, but... I can’t move.

dialogue: Rookie, remember what you signed up for. Sentinels run toward the Harrowing. We don’t hide from it.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Moments later, you arrive back at headquarters, exhausted but unharmed.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: So, how’d everybody like ol’ Bilgewater? Quite the spot, ain’t it?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: We’ll have to do it again some day.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Absolutely not. I would rather climb Targon a thousand times over. In the dead of winter.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Me, too. That curvy lady with the guns was quite rude.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I’m glad to be away from that sketchy guy with the knives. Pretty sure he didn’t have a pulse.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, it’s done. And now you’ll never have to see him again.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Beggin’ your pardon…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: WHAT?!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Why is HE here?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Must be a stowaway. Cast him overboard.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: He must’ve been in the Wayfinder’s field of magic. That sounds plausible, right?
Maybe he got too close to us when I triggered the Wayfinder? That’s my best guess.

dialogue: Does anyone know how this… thing got in our headquarters?!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, get him out of here!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: How do we do that?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Send ‘em to the deep!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Take him back to Bilgewater! Now!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, Senna, let’s think this through.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: There’s nothing to think through. What else could you possibly do with a homicidal ghoul who can’t die?!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm…

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ta-daaa!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: NO!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Why not? He took down Fortune, he found our Wayfinder, wraiths can’t hurt him…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s because he’s already dead, Lucian!

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Yep. My crew left me to die. Viego was on my crew!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You hear that? He wants Viego gone. Just like we do.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: If he can do to the Ruined King what he did to Sarah…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You wanna swear in something that’s every bit as evil as the things we’re trying to kill? Be my guest.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But I don’t have to dignify it with my presence.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Okay… Sentinel Pyke. Repeat after me: I, Pyke, swear by the light of the ancients...

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: I, Pyke, swear by the light of the ancients…

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: ...and the saltwater that runs through my veins! And the tide that carried my body back from the grave!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Okay, that’s actually not…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know what? I’ll take it. Let’s continue.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Later, at headquarters...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...a dispirited Senna cleans her relic cannon.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Can’t believe it. Everywhere we’ve been, he’s kicked our butts and sent us fleeing back to headquarters with our tails between our legs.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We haven’t stopped him from taking a single fetter.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: True. But you also gained another sentinel.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Across the room, Diana has just returned from her fitting.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Look, everyone! Isn’t she just the height of marvelousness? The sentinel gold really brings out her luminosity!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah. Another sentinel.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: (...I just wonder if it’ll make a difference.)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna continues cleaning her gun. Her small, personal cloud of Black Mist writhes around the weapon, dancing with the warm, white glow emitting from its barrel.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, Sentinel Diana? You ready to stand in the light, or fall in darkness?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian suddenly looks uncomfortable.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uhh. I meant, stand in the… Moon… light? Or fall in… darkness? Not darkness as in night. I’ve got nothin’ against night! Dammit.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: There’s no way of makin’ that sound better, huh?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It’s fine. I do not take offense. Many are ignorant of celestial matters.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The light of the moon fights the darkness, too.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It is no different than sunlight. In fact, it is all the same light.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Perhaps, one day, Targon will realize that, and what we now see as opposites…

speaker: Diana
dialogue: ...can peacefully coexist.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian turns his gaze to Senna. He sees her Black Mist interplaying with the light from the relic gun’s barrel.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. Sure hope you’re right about that.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Hot on Viego’s trail, the sentinels arrive in Noxus. Before them, the Reckoners' Arena awaits, shrouded in Black Mist.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, confound it. It seems there’s no sentinel base here either.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It’s here. It’s just been paved over.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Must be somewhere underneath this gladiatorial arena.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So they built a monument to bloodshed on top of a sacred bastion of light. Wow.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yep. Welcome to Noxus.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As you approach the arena gates, you can hear the roar of a lively—and bloodthirsty—crowd.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Huh. Sounds like the arena’s full.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: You know, I’m no expert on Noxian arena sports, but something tells me to run far away from this.
Ah, cool. We’ve all been working so hard fighting this Harrowing. Maybe it’s time we unwind and enjoy a local sporting event.

dialogue: Even in the middle of a Harrowing, these people still make time for bloodsport. Wow again.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels enter the arena floor to behold a startling sight…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A Noxian man, clad in shoddy armor, attempts to fight a swarm of wraiths.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What kind of fight is this? One poor grunt taking on a pack of wraiths? Not exactly sporting.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Aye! Whatever happened to a wholesome one-on-one bludgeoning between well-matched participants?! This combat is NOT GLORIOUS!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though the gladiator gives it his all, the wraiths quickly overwhelm him.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The man’s lifeless body falls to the ground, joining countless others. In the stands, thousands of ghostly spectators roar with approval.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What kind of degenerate is running this spectacle?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a spectator’s box, at the far end of the arena, a figure stands.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From this distance, you can just barely make out the twin axes that twirl in his hands.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: What do ya say, folks?! WAS THAT NOT A FIGHT FOR THE AGES?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined crowd cheers again, though its energy seems to be waning.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: INGRATES!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: (Do they think this is easy? They have no idea how hard it is to make quality matches…)

speaker: Draven
dialogue: (...How much blood and sweat I’ve spilled to put together this spectacle. For their entertainment.)

speaker: Draven
dialogue: They should be CHEERING MY NAME!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: I can still save this show. I just need more combatants! There must be more somewhere.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Draven...

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yep. Legendary maniac of the Reckoners’ Arena. Is it just me, or does he seem extra maniacal these days?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like the Mist has got him. And everybody else in this place.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But our fight’s not here. Viego wants something from Noxus. We need to find what his Mist is searching for—

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Hey, the gate back here just locked. Just in case anyone was wondering about having an exit.
Ah crap. Did that gate just lock? If I didn’t know better, I’d say we’re about to fight for our lives.

dialogue: [From behind, you hear the closing of a metal portcullis.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: We-ellll… LADIES AND GENTLEMEN… It seems we have MORE COMBATANTS in DRAVEN’S BIG SHOW!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, the crowd in the surrounding stands erupts in cheers of bloodlust, sending a chill down your spine.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: All these people are screaming. Shall I join them? Oh, please say yes!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Better draw your weapons, sentinels.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like he just made us his main event.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Ordinarily, you’d be right.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Yeah. I was afraid you might say that.
Fine. Let’s investigate. I think you’ll see that it’s nothing but ordinary, everyday Noxian bloodsport.

dialogue: But we came here to fight the Harrowing. And this has Harrowing written all over it.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the sentinels prepare to deploy to the next battle, Olaf and Diana take you aside. Between the two of them you’re not exactly sure what they want.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: ROOKIE! My friend and companion. Let us speak of our glorious battle sagas!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Olaf, please.

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: I, too, feel my battle saga lacks glory.
Are you saying I’m weak?
Diana, did you put him up to this?

dialogue: Oh, fine. Rookie, you have a very inglorious battle saga. You require aid.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The truth is, our fights grow fiercer by the day. Even my kind cannot stand against Viego without aid.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You need training, little one, in how you may throw yourself into the thick of battle, slay many foes, and emerge victorious!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: To do that, one must have a plan. You must combine the serenity of the mind…

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: WITH THE GLORY OF DEATH!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Well, not for you, anyway. For me! Olaf! I’m Olaf.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: As we spar, open your mind to the truth of your body. Strike with purpose, but be unrelenting.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Diana and Olaf train with you into the twilight hours. It is brutal, vicious combat, but as the battle wears on, you begin to see a shared spark within their eyes.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The two could not be more different, but they understand that to face death, one must be prepared. You earn the [Cunning Berserker] upgrade.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: See?! They know about the battle saga!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I’m beginning to wonder if this was a good idea.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Not weak of spirit, for you shine like a beacon to all who might call us allies.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You are puny, though. Tiny! I’ve seen birds carry off larger prey!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I did no such thing! Olaf and I are in agreement.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Ha ha! Thank you, moon woman! I will dedicate many battles to your celestial sky orb!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Later, at headquarters...]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Rengar.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fight bravely, and remember your oath.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ooh, magnificent! I have always wanted to dress a kitty. (They never hold still though.)

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: You may dress me.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: But do not touch my tail or claws. Or rear area! Or stomach! Or toes! Or—

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Shush, kitty! To the dressing room.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: You okay?
You seem down.

dialogue: [Across the room, you find Lucian, looking despondent.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Can’t believe I did that.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Makin’ a deal with Thresh… What’s wrong with me, Rookie?

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Oh, she’d blow your kneecaps off.
She’d understand.

dialogue: If Senna found out, she’d…

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Attention, everyone. I’d like to present, best in show… SENTINEL KITTYYYY!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Yes! Rengar feels strong! Rengar is ready to hunt!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Where is the Ruined King? I will slice his ghostly throat with my new sentinel blades!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: And then fall onto my back and eviscerate him with my hind claws!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Then I will hunt this Thresh for what he has done to my sentinel allies.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: How do you know about Thresh?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I, uh… filled him in on the way here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, I appreciate the loyalty, Rengar.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Very important trait for a sentinel. Right, babe?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: [You and Lucian share a sideways glance.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Absolutely. Stand together in the light, and all.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [That moment, in the Shadow Isles, Viego sings a brooding melody.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [All of the fetters he has collected are gathered around him, pulsing with energy.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Three they are…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Not once apart…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: ...A king His heart And she.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Thresh! You treacherous worm. You dare to interrupt this cherished moment?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Apologies, my king. But I thought you’d want to be interrupted for this…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a single fluid movement of his bony fingers, Thresh draws the jade mask from his coat.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Is that…?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: It is. I recovered it for you from the deepest jungles of Ixtal.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The jade mask pulses in unison with all of the other fetters.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Yes, my love. We are ever closer to reunion.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: My liege, I know my allegiance cannot be proven with a single act.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Nothing can ever undo the treachery I committed against you...

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: ...but I was hoping this might be a start? A first step in rebuilding our alliance?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Very well, Thresh. I am a merciful king. And today, you have proven yourself worthy of a second chance at my side.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Though I have some stipulations…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: There is only room for one ruler in this land: the True King of Camavor.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: All else must serve me.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Of course, my king. I will serve you faithfully.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: See that you do, Thresh. Because next time…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: ...I won’t be so generous.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As Thresh leaves, he caresses a wisp of Black Mist and absorbs it into his hand.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [ A slight amount of burgeoning flesh grows over the exposed bone in his fingers.]

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: (Indeed. Whatever would I do without your generosity?)

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. That she would.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No she wouldn’t. She’d blow my kneecaps off.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels follow the Black Mist as it snakes through Piltover in search of the stolen fetter.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You arrive at the bottom of Piltover to find the Mist flowing into the lawless undercity of Zaun.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Damn. Looks like the Mist is headed down into Zaun.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And it looks like someone doesn’t want us to follow.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Hey, who put all these booby traps in the way? Don’t they know we’re on an important world-saving mission?
Fine with me. Leave me in Piltover. I’m a big fan of sunlight.
It’s a big city. This can’t be the only way into Zaun.

dialogue: [Senna nods at a series of barricades and chem-tech mines, blocking the entrance to Zaun.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: They think a blockade is gonna stop the Black Mist? I got bad news for them.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Yes, well, chem-barons don’t know much about sentinel business, do they?

speaker: Ada
dialogue: That’s where we come in. I’m Ada. She’s Dess.

speaker: Ada
dialogue: We’re your local sentinels. Protectors of Piltover.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: And Zaun, if need be.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m Senna. Your... commanding officer.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Dess and Ada react in awkward surprise.]

speaker: Ada
dialogue: Oh. Okay, wow. Didn’t know the boss was coming today. Nice to meet you… commander.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: At ease. Do either of you know a way into Zaun? We need to catch a criminal before the Ruined King does.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Gosh. All the major thoroughfares have been majorly and thoroughly mined.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: You’d be blown to bits if you tried to use any of them!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: How about non-major thoroughfares? Anything connecting Piltover to Zaun? A pipe or a vent or a canal? ...Anything.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Well... I suppose there’s one.

speaker: Ada
dialogue: Dess, no. They’re not interested in that.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Ada turns to you to reiterate...]

speaker: Ada
dialogue: Trust me, you’re not interested in it.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Okay. Now, we’re definitely interested in it.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Oh, boy. Maybe Ada’s right. It’s really unpleasant.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Great Bear’s Lightning, just tell us already, ya shirking frost-blossom!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Dess and Ada share looks of coded deliberation.]

speaker: Ada
dialogue: Okay. Show ‘em, I guess.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Dess leads the sentinels to a cylindrical hatch a few yards away. With a look of disgust on her face, she opens the hatch.]

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Be my guest.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, my. It smells like… the opposite of flowers.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Dess?

speaker: Dess
dialogue: Yes, boss?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Did you just take me to a sewer?

speaker: Dess
dialogue: You did say anything.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well. Okay then. Lucian?

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: #*%$ no! This is not what I signed up for! I quit!
#*%% yes! This is exactly what I signed up for! Throw me in first, sir!

dialogue: Yeah. I see where this is goin’. What do ya say, Rook?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Great. I’ll see ya at the bottom, kid.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian picks you up by the back of your uniform and heaves you into the smelly, tin chute.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You close your nose and mouth tightly, anticipating what lies below.]

speaker: Ada
dialogue: That would be the chem-barons—lovely group of cutthroats who run Zaun.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: They’re in a real panic because of the Harrowing. They’ve got the whole city sealed off.

speaker: Irelia

responses.dialogue: Yes, well, the thing is—

dialogue: You would choose temporal comfort over lasting security?

speaker: Irelia

responses.dialogue: Actually, I wouldn’t say that Zaun—

dialogue: You would not brave the darkest depths to save what is left of this world?

speaker: Irelia

responses.dialogue: YES, OKAY, I’LL GO TO ZAUN AND FIGHT THE MIST! ...Wow, you’re really inspiring, you know that?

dialogue: And would you not prefer to hear the rattle of your final breath before you gave the Ruined Tyrant one more inch of this land?!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Glad to hear it. Now help us find a way through that barricade.

speaker: Ada
dialogue: I don’t think you’ll be managing that.

speaker: Ada
dialogue: This barricade was set up by the chem-barons—lovely group of cutthroats who run Zaun.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: They’ve rigged this entrance to explode all kinds of ways. It’s an impenetrable blockade.

speaker: Ada
dialogue: You’re right. It’s not the only way into Zaun.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: But all the other routes have been blockaded, too.

speaker: Dess
dialogue: The chem-barons are in a real panic right now. They’ve got the whole city sealed off.
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Arriving in Ixtal, the sentinels must split up to find traces of the Harrowing. Frustrated by Lucian's growing concern, Senna sends him and the Rookie off to scout east while the others head in different directions.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: A rustling sound turns out to be Rengar, who expresses interest in the challenge of hunting wraiths. Unfortunately, he is swarmed, and Lucian and the Rookie must try to help.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Defeated by the wraiths, Rengar loses his confidence and refuses to fight. The Rookie spins a fanciful tale and, despite Lucian's amusement and disbelief, manages to reinspire Rengar. With their new ally roused, the trio pushes on after the Mist.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Lucian vents to Rengar about his desire to protect Senna. Thresh appears and offers to make a deal with the sentinels due to his fury with Viego. Despite their bitter history, Lucian follows into a temple to hear him out.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Lucian helps Thresh recover the fetter he seeks, and Thresh shows him the promised secret: a mural that tells the tale of a resurrection gun. Furious that he's been had and Thresh has disappeared, Lucian swears both Rengar and the Rookie to secrecy.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: After fighting off the Mist, the sentinels are confronted by Irelia, who mistakes them for enemies. While Irelia initially refuses to believe any group containing Riven can mean well for Ionia, she agrees to take them to Karma and the Lasting Altar.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: At the Lasting Altar, Karma reveals to the sentinels that Viego is coming for another fetter. After charging them to take the fetter to the Grove of the Ancients, where it will be safe, wraiths invade. The sentinels fight them while Karma flees.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels approach the forest, but Karma is overwhelmed with regret at not intervening while Ionians died. Giving in to Viego's corruption, persuaded by his determination, she becomes ruined and flees further into the forest with the fetter.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels manage to purify Karma temporarily. Before transforming back, she explains each fetter is part of Isolde, and Viego is determined to combine them to bring back his lost love. As wraiths arrive, the sentinels flee into the Grove.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The Spirit of Ionia and the Grove's magic shield the sentinels from their foes. In the lull, Senna ponders her connection to Isolde. Then Viego himself arrives, corrupting the land and stealing the fetter, which convinces Irelia to join the fight.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels meet Graves in a surprisingly unharrowed Piltover, but then the Mist rolls in. They track it to a shop, where Senna identifies a parasol as the fetter it seeks. Graves then steals the fetter, and the sentinels pursue him to recover it.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Pursuing the Black Mist to Zaun, the sentinels find the entrance blocked off. Two local sentinels explain that there's only one way down: the sewer.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Graves has vanished into the lower reaches of Zaun, but before the sentinels can go after him, Vex's shadow magic envelops them. The local sentinels hold off the yordle, while the rest of the team continues pursuing the fetter.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels track Graves to a chemtech factory, and Senna sends the Rookie in to negotiate. Vayne and Senna soon join the negotiations, but when Graves refuses to hand over the fetter, Vayne shoots at him, and he returns fire.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels are surrounded by volatile chemicals, and Graves keeps firing. They all escape just as the building blows, but stumble into Vex, who takes the fetter. Lucian sees value in a fearless gunman who's furious at Viego and recruits Graves.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf and the sentinels chase Vex to the bottom of the glacier.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Cease your running, shadow lord! And give Olaf the grueling fight he yearns for!

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Nah. I think I’m done here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Magical artifact in hand, Vex continues her escape, heading for an icy pass between the mountains.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, dear. That dreadfully joyless fairy is escaping!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: And she’s still holding that shimmery trinket from the glacier. What on earth could she want with it?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Whatever it is, it’s not good. STOP THAT YORDLE!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex remains several yards ahead of you, as her shadow whisks her across the ice at surprising speed.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re not gaining any ground. Gotta try to cut off her escape.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This mountain pass looks like her only way out.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes. And if the snow on these mountains were to fall into that pass, she’d have no way out!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You want us to cause an avalanche? Isn’t that dangerous?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Dangerous? You daft southerners…

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Of course it’s dangerous! But it’ll stop her, won’t it?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay. Never thought I’d say these words, but…

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Hey, what if we make a lot of noise? I heard that causes avalanches.
I say we just shoot the mountain with our guns. That oughta bring down some snow.

dialogue: Everyone help me figure out how to start an avalanche.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You soon hear the unmistakable rumble of snow shifting on the mountainside.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Everyone, take cover!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Heaps of snow begin sliding off the mountain, into the pass.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In seconds, the mountain pass fills with a mass of snow and ice, blocking Vex’s retreat.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Ugh. Seriously?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hand over the trinket. It’s all we want.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That, and stop helping Viego in his insane plan to ruin the world.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. That too.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You guys are the worst. And I know I say that about everyone, but this time it’s true.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: You’ve actually turned me from indifferent to… slightly miffed.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: And you really don’t wanna see a teenage yordle miffed.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex’s posture stiffens, ever so slightly, as she summons a large shadow beneath the sentinels’ feet.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Inside the shadow, the sentinels’ movements and speech are dramatically slowed.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What… is this? I can barely… move.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Yeah. That’s despair. Enjoy it.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: ...Or don’t. See if I care.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sentinels… stop… her.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels rush toward Vex, but their feet move at a snail’s pace.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [By the time they arrive where Vex was standing, she is long gone.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Where the hells… is she?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the distance, you can just barely see Vex and her shadow disappearing into a stream of Black Mist. The shadow beneath you dissipates.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: NOOOOOOOO! My heroic ending… It’s gone!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. So is that magical trinket.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I’m doomed to live. And to die the worst death of all… death from OLD AGE!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. I might know a way you can fix that.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian… I hope you’re not about to suggest what I think you are.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Why not? You’ve seen this fella in action. You tellin’ me you wouldn’t want his fury on the front line, chopping up the Harrowing?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s out of his mind.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: The guy is clearly insane. And you’re insane for wanting him in our party, Lucian. ...No offense.
Sure. If we can harness his rage for good, he might be a valuable asset.

dialogue: Rookie, back me up on this.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I don’t know, Lucian. If you think we can trust this guy… I guess we can try him out.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Well, out with it then. Olaf hates hearin’ whispers behind his back.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Olaf, what if I told you we’re on a mission to fight the most worthy foe in all Runeterra?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: I’d say point me in this foe’s direction! We’ll see how worthy they are!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, if anyone can give you a hero’s death, it’s this guy.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That idea might not be as dumb as it sounds. Good thinking, kid. (For once.)

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes. Olaf’s battle roar will part snow from rock, filling this valley with the frosts of many ages!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Ooh! I’ve always wanted to try screaming. It seems like ever so much fun!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. Everyone yell as loud as you can on my count. One… two…

speaker: Everyone
dialogue: AAAAAHHHHHH!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You want to use our powerful, ancient relic guns… to shoot a mountain?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So that it’ll dump a bunch of snow?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It ain’t exactly sophisticated. But I like it.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well then... Let’s show this mountain who’s boss.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The valley’s illuminated with flashes of gunlight as the sentinels fire their weapons at the nearby mountainside.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Smart kid.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Glad you think so. You can babysit ‘em from now on.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Guess they don’t teach good judgment during training.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: They teach survival. And more sentinels means more chance of that.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You, Senna, and Riven enter an arena packed with ruined Noxians. Draven enters through the opposing gate.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Helloooooo, violence fans! ARE. YOU. READY?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven basks in the thunderous applause of the crowd.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: We’ve got a real bloodbath in store for ya today… starring yours truly… DRRRAVENNNN!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: And my opponents, fighting for the right to leave Noxus alive:

speaker: Draven

responses.dialogue: Hey! ...I mean, I am, but… HEY!
I’ll have you know, I’m a fully grown adult!
The name’s Rookie! And by the gods, you’ll remember it after this day!

dialogue: LADY BIG GUNS!... RIVEN, THE FILTHY, TURNCOAT TRAITOR!... and… SOME KID!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: At least he didn’t call you traitor.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Draven, stop this madness! Call off the fight, or Noxus will fall to the Harrowing!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd boos Senna ferociously.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Hmm… I’ve considered your plea, and I have to say...

speaker: Draven
dialogue: NAHHHH! LET’S GET THIS VIOLENCE UNDERWAY!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven hurls an axe at Senna’s head, abruptly starting the fight.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna reacts quickly, shooting the axe away with her gun.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Cheap move. Now I’ve gotta hurt you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna opens fire on Draven, but he rolls out of the way with surprising agility, evading her shot.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: I’ve still got ONE AXE LEFT, FIGHT FANS! WHAT AM I GONNA DO WITH IT?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven hurls his axe at Senna’s gun. It lodges in the barrel, disabling the weapon.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Damn. Riven, Rookie—close in while he’s out of axes!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven and you sprint toward the unarmed Draven.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Ready, Rookie? Let’s cut him down!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You leap onto Draven’s back, attempting to strangle him from behind, while Riven charges from the front.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd loves it, much to your surprise… and Draven’s surprise.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [He throws you over his shoulder, right into Riven. Then he turns to the crowd with disgust.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: You’re cheering… FOR THEM?!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: (Gotta get ‘em back. Can’t let some out-of-town mudheels steal my shine!)

speaker: Riven
dialogue: He’s distracted. Charge him again!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven and you rush toward Draven once more. As you draw near, you see his eyes sparkle with a sly glint, and his hand reaching behind his back.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: What’s this, folks? It seems Draven is REACHING FOR SOMETHING IN HIS BELT…

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Yes! He’s got… MORE AXES!!!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven hurls both axes in quick succession—one at you, and one at Riven.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven bats hers away with her sword. You are not so lucky.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie! Are you okay?!

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: I’m good. It’s just my shoulder. Get Draven!
Hells no! That really hurt, and I think I’m bleeding!
I dunno. Did the crowd like it? I just want to make sure we’re going over well with the fans.

dialogue: [Senna rushes to your side. You feel a warm trickle of blood flowing from your shoulder.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Well, folks—it looks like SOME KID is down! That axe in the shoulder really seems to have taken the wind right out of their sails!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd roars with excitement. Draven eats up that approval, savoring every last cheer.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Will the kid get back up? Or will the champ FINISH ‘EM OFF?!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Let’s go! Charge him before he comes back!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Or we stand in front and let him attack.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: What?! He’ll kill us.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No he won’t. He’s milking the applause.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: That’s not a bad idea. Keep him occupied with the roar of the crowd.
That’s the worst idea I’ve ever heard! Just attack him now!

dialogue: When he attacks again, we take a dive. And wait for an opportunity.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven draws two more axes from his belt, and draws his arm back to hurl one.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I hope you’re right about this, Senna.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven throws the axes at Senna and Riven. Though they deflect the axes at the last possible moment, they fall to the ground, pretending to be gravely injured.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uckk. Got me.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Right in the throat. Down I go.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Oh, no, violence fans! It seems Draven’s opponents are all DOWN FOR THE COUNT. It’s all over but the cryin’!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Whaddya say?! Should I FINISH THEM OFF?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crowd gives its loudest, most bloodthirsty scream of the night, but Draven still wants more. He turns his back on his fallen opponents to face the crowd.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Ah, ladies and gentlemen, that was TERRIBLE! I said—SHOULD I FINISH THEM OFF?!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This is it. Everyone attack!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With Draven absorbed by the crowd, Senna and Riven tackle him to the ground and hogtie him with his arms behind his back.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: WHAAAT’S THIS, FIGHT FANS?! DRAVEN HAS BEEN AMBUSHED BY HIS LOW-DOWN, UNSCRUPULOUS OPPONENTS!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fight’s over, champ. You lose.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: For now, Big Guns. But when the champ goes down, there’s always a grudge match— H-HEY! WAIT! WHERE ARE YOU GOING?! SOMEBODY UNTIE DRAVEN!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined crowd gives you all a standing ovation, applauding well after you’ve left the arena.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the streets outside, you find the rest of your sentinel party, looking much relieved.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, you did it, Rook. You got her back in one piece.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: [Sarcastic] Sure. That’s exactly what happened. I did all the fighting and saved everyone.
Yeah. Wish I could say the same for me.
Don’t! Touch! The shoulder!

dialogue: [You wince as Lucian pats you on your badly injured shoulder.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I do hope everyone is in good spirits after that awful encounter.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t know about all that. Rookie’s injured. My gun needs repairs. And Viego got away with another fetter.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Another what?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s just get back to headquarters. You’ve got a lot to catch up on.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You start to activate the Wayfinder, but Senna signals you to stop.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A weary Riven sits alone, countless troubles showing on her face.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hey there. So… where ya off to now?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Not sure. Can’t go back to Ionia. And I sure as hell can’t stay here.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Guess I’m a warrior without a home.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [All of the sentinels exchange knowing glances and nods.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Riven… what if I told ya you could have a home?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I’m listening.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna, Riven, and you emerge from the catacombs into the depths of the Immortal Bastion.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Well. This is it. The infamous Immortal Bastion. All of Noxus’s dark, dirty secrets can be found within these walls.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Looks like the Mist has already found some of them.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna points to a heavy door at the end of the corridor. A dense cloud of Black Mist pools against the door, barely trickling in around its edges.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Through a parting in the Mist, you can see a symbol painted on the door—a black rose.]

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: The Black Rose? Who are they exactly? Some kind of florist, I’m guessing.
[LIE] Oh. The Black Rose. I definitely know all about them. I mean, only an idiot wouldn’t. Right?
The Black Rose? Such a warm and welcoming name. I’m sure they won’t mind us using their secret tunnels.

dialogue: Sure enough. We’ve stumbled right up to the Black Rose’s doorstep.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: The question is, why would the Black Mist want to get in there?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Because whatever Viego is looking for is in that room. Too bad we’re going to find it first.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna attempts to open the door, but finds neither a handle nor a lock. She backs away, sensing something.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Seems to be sealed by some kind of enchantment.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [On closer inspection, she finds ancient Noxian letters engraved on the door.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: “Dark secrets bloom for those who share their own.”

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: See? It is a florist. Maybe it wants us to leave a bouquet of flowers at the door.
Sounds like it wants us to reveal something about ourselves. Like our darkest secrets?
Who cares? We’re armed to the gills. Let’s blow this door down!

dialogue: What the hell does that mean?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sounds kinda contrived.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But I’ve got nothing better. Let’s tell the door our darkest secrets.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Okay. I think I’m done here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Clearly disturbed, Riven turns and begins to walk back toward the exit.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hey, where are you going?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: We’re even now. Don’t get me wrong—you’re wonderful people. But I’m not sticking around for hokey riddles.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s her problem? Ah, well. Guess it’s up to us now.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And seeing how I’m an open book, maybe this is something for you to solve, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, go on. Tell this door a big, juicy secret.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Okay, door. Here’s my secret: ...I wet the bed ‘til I was eight.
I cheated on all my tests during sentinel training!
I once murdered a guy and dumped his dismembered body in the sea! Actually, it was more like manslaughter, but it was still awful, and oh dear gods, it feels good to tell someone this!

dialogue: [Looking at the door, you plumb the depths of your memory for your darkest secret. One that you’ve never told anybody.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, the door to the Black Rose vault begins to moan and creak…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and then, it pops open.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Riven stops walking away and turns back in disbelief.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Don’t tell me that actually worked.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Way to go, Rookie. You might have a bright future as a sentinel…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...If I can forget about that awful secret you just shared.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Now be ready. We don’t know what’s in here.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As soon as the three of you step through the doorway, you stop dead in your tracks.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The room is thick with Harrowing. You feel the same evil presence you felt in the mageseeker vault in Demacia.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s here. I can feel him.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Show yourself!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego obliges, materializing from the Mist.]

speaker: Viego

responses.dialogue: Senna, maybe it’s best you stay back and let us handle him. Lucian told me to—
Senna, I really think you should stay back. This guy wants you to engage. He’s up to something.
Senna, I promised Lucian I’d protect you, but frankly, you seem like you can handle yourself, so...

dialogue: Senna. I was hoping we’d meet again.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Undaunted, Senna steps further into the room. You and Riven follow.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Whatever you’re looking for, I’ve come to stop you from taking it.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah. You’re a little late for that.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego reveals an ancient wine flagon.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A wine flagon? You came all the way here for that?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego smiles as the wine flagon sparkles with a mysterious magic.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As if in response, a tiny speck of that same magic begins to glow in Senna’s chest. She clasps her hands over it in fear.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No… I know that glow. It’s the same as the one in me. They’re all… all...

speaker: Viego
dialogue: They are all her.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego reveals the handheld mirror from Demacia, and the ivory comb he took from the Freljord. They all sparkle in unison with the wine flagon, and the glow in Senna’s chest, as if they’re communicating.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego reveals the handheld mirror from Demacia. It sparkles in unison with the wine flagon, and Senna’s glow, as if they’re communicating.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Her fetters—pieces of her soul—scattered across the world.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Just like the piece that’s still in you.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: But I will reclaim them. I will make her whole again. I will restore my love, Isolde!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She was my friend. My protector. You want my piece of her? You’ll have to take it from my dead body.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You’re right. I can’t take her fetter from you. And I have tried.

speaker: Viego
