dialogue: It is bound tightly to your soul. But you can give it to me willingly.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: And in time… you will.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You sick, ego-driven bastard… This ends now!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Aren’t we in Noxus? Let’s settle this like Noxians! Fight me. TO THE END!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Alas, I regret to inform you that I have other matters to attend to.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: But if combat is what you seek, I know of another champion who just might oblige. Farewell.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As quickly as he appeared, Viego disappears into the Black Mist. You hear a familiar cackle coming from the doorway behind you.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: HaHA! Sounds like someone’s itching for a fight!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let us pass, Draven! I have to stop him!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Uh-uh-UHHH. You still owe me some fights, Lady Big Guns!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Draven eyes Riven with contempt.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: So does your dirty traitor friend here.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Eat it, Draven.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re done fighting for you.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Better not tell your buddies that. I’ve got ’em locked up, and if you ever wanna see ’em again… you gotta get through the best fighter in the arena!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: I’m talkin’ about the greatest combatant of ALL TIME—THE RUINED PEOPLE’S CHAMPION… DRRRRAVENNN!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [sigh] Looks like we don’t have much choice.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nope. They’re masters of deception. Some say they’re the ones pulling all the strings in Noxus.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: In other words: not a group you want to trifle with.

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: Oh. Uh, maybe go ahead and tell me anyway. I just want to make sure you know what I know. For your sake.
Right. But, uh… go ahead and tell Senna. She might not know.

dialogue: Then you don’t need me to tell you how dangerous they are.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Sure, kid. Let’s just say some people think the Black Rose are the ones who really run the Noxian Empire.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: In other words: not a group you want to trifle with.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nope. They’re masters of deception. Some say they’re the ones pulling all the strings in Noxus.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: In other words: not a group you want to trifle with.

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: Yeah, that would make more sense. Wait a minute! Secrets… It wants us to tell our dark secrets!
Okay, wow, I just had a thought. What if it wants to hear our darkest secrets? Awful stuff we’ve never told anyone?

dialogue: That doesn’t sound like the Black Rose. I think the flower thing is just a metaphor.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Worth a shot.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna fires her extremely large gun at the door...]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: What does this stupid door want from us?!

dialogue: [...But it remains closed and unscathed.]

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: Wait a minute! Secrets… It wants us to tell our dark secrets!
Okay, wow, I just had a thought. What if it wants to hear our darkest secrets? Awful stuff we’ve never told anyone?

dialogue: Don’t look at me.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, if you try to interfere, I’ll blow your kneecaps off.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie, if you try to interfere, I’ll blow your kneecaps off.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I didn’t ask for your opinion, Rookie.
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Sentinel Headquarters. Far off the coast of Valoran.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Alone at your post, you watch the horizon for signs of trouble.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A battered schooner approaches, and lands on the shores of your island.]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Hello? Who’s there? This is the headquarters for the Sentinels of Light.
Stop right there! You’re trespassing! I’m armed and not afraid to shoot!

dialogue: [Two figures emerge from the boat.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What’s happened to the headquarters? Place barely has a roof on it.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: I’m the only sentinel here. And I’m not equipped to make repairs to the headquarters, so...
They’re all dead. I tried signaling for help. I kept expecting reinforcements to arrive, but...

dialogue: Where are all the other sentinels? Who’s your commanding officer?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You mean to tell me we sailed halfway across the ocean to recruit one damn sentinel?

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Would you be upset if I said “none”?
I just started a few months ago. But I swear, I’m a fast learner!

dialogue: You better be the best damn sentinel in history. How many years of experience do you have?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Are you kidding me? The kid’s a rookie?! Of all the rotten luck…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Listen, Rookie. Just over the horizon there is a cloud of evil bigger than anyone’s ever seen.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: A Harrowing that could end the world. In other words...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Stuff’s about to get real ugly.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So if you don’t want the world to die, I’m going to need you to dig deep and find some veteran skills in that rookie head of yours. Understand?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [At that moment, a distant cacophony of low rumbling and tormented shrieks sends chills down your spine.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look out over the ocean to see a massive cloud of Black Mist filling the sky, spreading toward you at a rapid pace.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s here.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Of course I do. But the sentinels told me to use this gun. And I can’t get it to fire!
Okay, please don’t be mad, but… no. And my sentinel gun doesn’t seem to work anyway.

dialogue: Lock ‘n’ load, Rookie! You know how to shoot, right?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, ain’t that… perfect. I’m so glad we wasted all that time sailing here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No time for griping, Lucian. We’ve got a fight on our hands.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In an instant, a dark cloud of wraiths engulfs the beach.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie—you can help by… well…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: By pistol-whipping some of these wraiths with that busted gun of yours. Now, come on!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and your new sentinel friends must fight to survive.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Thank the gods. We’re in the right place.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Good. Not sure this boat would’ve made it much further.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I was going to say we need your help, but from the look of it, you don’t have much to give.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Whoa! Easy there, kid.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re sentinels. I’m Senna. He’s Lucian.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re in need of help.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Though from the looks of it, I’d say you don’t have much to give.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Back at headquarters, the sentinels induct Olaf into their order.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...And may we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: ...May we stand in the light, and smite the darkness with every bloodied axe we’ve got!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Felt like it needed something more.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Right. By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Olaf.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fight bravely, and—

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: YES! FIGHT BRAVELY! IN AN EPIC BATTLE THE SKALDS WILL SING OF FOR AGES!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: —and remember your oath.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: OH, I’LL REMEMBER THAT OATH SO WELL THAT—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stop talking! ...Please.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Gwen will get you suited up.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: The pleasure is all mine! Come with me, Mr. Maniacal Screams.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Let's see if we can't find you some garments more fitting of a sentinel... Though I will miss your magnificent, smelly animal skins.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What are you smiling at?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Nothin'. Just enjoyin' the show.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So, this is your plan? Find all the lunatics in the world, and give them our most closely guarded weapons?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I'll admit. He's... unorthodox. But...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What we're doing ain't exactly a mission for normal people. We need more sentinels.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And some of 'em are bound to be…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Nutjobs?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Badly damaged?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I reckon you could say that.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Attention, everyone! Your esteemed seamstress proudly presents: the newest, most well-fitted sentinel in all the land...

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: ...Sentinel Redbeard Angry Axes!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Not quite as supple as the fur of an ice yak, but it'll do nicely!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Now, when do I get to try out my new axes on some shadowy scourge?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You're in luck, nutjob—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I mean, Olaf.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It just so happens we're about to deploy again. Rest assured, there’ll be plenty more scourge left to fight.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: That's what I like to hear!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, if he decapitates one of us, I'm holding you responsible.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels arrive at the foot of Mt. Targon. A smattering of old bricks is all the remains of the base that once stood here.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Mm. Looks like no sentinel base here either.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Startin’ to think the ancient sentinels didn’t know how to make a building that would last.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hey, they had a lot on their plate. Saving the world and all.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: The mountain is still here. At the very least, we can say we saw that!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You peer up at the mountain looming before you. Though you feel every bit of its daunting presence, its upper half is hidden in a thick haze of Black Mist.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Though… where is its top? Mountains have tops, do they not?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: I see Ionia isn’t the only land to have been changed by this darkness.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Greetings, travelers. Welcome to Mount Targon, “Stairway to the Gods.”

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Though I hope you aren’t going to climb it today. It seems you’ve picked an inopportune time to visit.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re here to stop this Harrowing. So we’re headed wherever this Mist is flowing.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Oh. Then I suppose you will be braving the mountain.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It seems this Black Mist is flowing straight to its peak.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Wonderful. Now give us the bad news.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Very well. Most people never survive the climb. And those who do often come back as something… inhuman.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I was being sarcastic.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: And I was not. The climb is certain death, especially today.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’re sentinels. Dealing with certain death is kinda what we do.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Strange. Your mortal life is so brief, yet you cannot wait for its end.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. I’ve been tryin’ real hard to talk her outta that.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So, you going to tell us how to get up there, or…?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Diana sighs, and pauses to contemplate.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: If you must climb Targon, you will need a guide. One who has made the climb before.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: One who has bathed in the light of the infinite, and returned with the power of celestial beings.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Where are we going to find a freak like that?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: You will find her in me.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I will take you up the mountain. And together, we will discover what this Mist wants with Targon.

speaker: Gwen

responses.dialogue: Dang right! I can’t wait to be part god!
Are you kidding? We’ll be up that mountain in no time. ...Wait, how high is it exactly?
Uuuhhhhboy. This is gonna suck.

dialogue: Stupendous. We shall make splendid new memories on this mountain! Right, Rookie?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a furious chase, the sentinels arrive at the safety of the ancient vastayan woods.]

speaker: Gwen

responses.dialogue: Yeah… <PANT> I never… realized… <PANT> how outta shape I was.
Sounds like you need to do more cardio training. Morning runs, Gwen. You and me. I’ll get you into shape.

dialogue: Oh, goodness… [PANT] My sides hurt ever… so much. [PANT]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stay on your guard. Look!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You watch in horror as the wraiths attempt to follow you into the Grove...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...But to your astonishment, the wraiths disintegrate upon entry, turning to a fine black dust that blows away with the forest breeze.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: How curious… The woods just ate ‘em all up!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Well, I’ll be knocked arse over beard—this forest really DOES protect!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: So long as the Land is healthy, the Black Mist doesn’t stand a chance. Every rock and tree will rise up to defend Ionia.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Astounding. I thought one had to ascend Targon to achieve such power.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Here, it’s as common as the air itself.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: It comes with its share of problems.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: A lot of outsiders want to take that magic for themselves.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Irelia shoots another accusing glance at Riven.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Since we seem to be all protected by “The Land” now, can we talk about what the guru lady told us back there?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: She had an awful lot to say about your Ghost Queen, darlin’. You reckon it’s true?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I don’t know. Guess I’m still sorting through it myself.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: If we’re all different parts of her personality—me, Gwen, this flower here...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...And all those other fetters out there that we don’t even know about yet...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Then I guess there’s a lot I don’t know about Isolde.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Our entire victory hinges on someone we don’t even know? I am not liking our odds.
So, what’s the plan then? We just wait for her to show up?
You may not know all the parts of her, but you seem to know the one that’s inside you. That’s something.

dialogue: But I do know she has a big part to play in our fight.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: One thing I am sure about...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We need to keep this fetter out of Viego’s hands.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: It will be safe here. So long as the Spirit of the Land lives, Viego has no power here—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels become keenly aware of an ominous change in the air.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [An ill wind blows from outside the grove, carrying a familiar voice—Viego’s voice.]

speaker: Viego's Voice
dialogue: Hello, my love.

speaker: Viego's Voice
dialogue: Did you miss me, as I have longed for you?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No...

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Is that him? But… how?

speaker: Viego's Voice
dialogue: I call upon you, my subjects. Deliver her to me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna clutches the silver flower tightly against her chest. The boughs of the surrounding trees begin to shake and come alive.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Everyone get ready! He’s not getting in here!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Just tell me what to shoot.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The limbs of the trees grab at the sentinels’ arms. Rocks roll into place at their feet, locking around them like shackles. Vines slither around their mouths, silencing them.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Mmphhhh!

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: The woods just took our fetter!
Uh… I don’t really know what’s happening, but I think we just lost our fetter.
Wow, you don’t see that every day.

dialogue: [You break free from the vines and rocks just long enough to see the silver flower being carried away by the vines.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the other sentinels struggle free, they see Viego, hovering high above the grove...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...gripping the silver flower in his pale green hand.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Come, my love. Let us return home.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego disappears into the Black Mist, taking the fetter with him.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: How did this happen?!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: The Land… he’s… corrupted it. I—I don’t know how.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Nothing is safe here! The Spirit of Ionia is…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ruined.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: All that is worth fighting for… is forever lost.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. There is hope.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: If we can defeat Viego, I believe we can undo these Harrowings.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You don’t know that.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No, I don’t. But I’ve got a feeling.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The light in Senna’s chest glows warmly. Somehow, it’s reassuring.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: It is more than I have. The Spirit… it’s silent. It must be restored.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: I will join you, and we will dethrone this tyrant.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s got nothing to do with odds, Rookie. This is fate we’re dealing with.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Mine, Isolde’s… even yours. Our paths are intertwined, whether we like it or not.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We just have to make sure we don’t mess it up.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m… not sure.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This may come as a shock to you, Rookie, but… not even your commanding officer knows everything.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I thought I knew her. Now... I’m not so sure.
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Mount Targon's peak has been shrouded in Black Mist. The sentinels, determined to make the perilous climb, encounter Diana at the base of the mountain, who volunteers to guide them them on their climb.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Halfway up, Diana suggests retreat when she hears the Aspects locked in a celestial clash. The Rookie convinces her that protecting Targon is worth risking the Aspects' wrath, but before they can continue, they are set upon by Solari.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Cutting down the Solari and continuing the climb, the group finds Atreus and Viego vying for another fetter. Before they can assist, Viego ruins his opponent, reawakening Pantheon. The newly restored Aspect of War then calls down an avalanche.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Sheltering from Pantheon's avalanche in a cave, the group is trapped by falling rocks. Diana despairs and nearly succumbs to ruin, but the faith of two Lunari restores her will to fight. Reinvigorated, Diana clears the rockfall.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Viego induces Pantheon to fight the sentinels while he makes off with another fetter. After overcoming Pantheon's wraith army, Diana herself defeats Pantheon. Seeing no future for her people while the Harrowing persists, Diana joins the sentinels.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels arrive in the mageseeker vaults, determined to uncover Viego’s plot.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Here we are. The mageseeker vaults.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I figure whatever Viego is looking for is in the middle of this Black Mist cloud.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This is it, sentinels. Into the darkness!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With the other sentinels at your side, you charge into the black core of Demacia’s Harrowing.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In the center of the Mist cloud is a mageseeker chest, secured with a formidable lock.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. Looks like the Mist is trying to get into that chest.

speaker: Gwen

responses.dialogue: Something the Mist wants. Which means we should probably keep it closed.
Something the mageseekers locked up tight. Let’s proceed with caution.
Give me a hammer, and we’ll find out!

dialogue: Ooh! Rookie, what kind of shimmering treasure do you think awaits us?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From out of the Black Mist cloud, a figure materializes.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Ah, sentinels. We meet again. In this, a prison for magic, no less.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Don’t they know true love cannot be sundered by lock or cage?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No… It’s him... Viego. (Mustn’t let him see us!)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen conjures her Hallowed Mist shroud, concealing herself from Viego.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What do you want from Demacia?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Only what is mine...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The locked chest opens. A handheld mirror levitates out of it…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and floats through the air to Viego’s hand.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: What I have crossed the realms to rebuild.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You came back from the dead for some old mirror? Why?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He seems to be in the habit of taking things he thinks are his.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Why did you take her from me? She… She was my guide.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You speak as if you knew her.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She was as much a part of me as anything. You had no right...

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You know nothing of my queen!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: There are many facets to her. Many parts of her persona, known to no one but me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [He glances at the mirror in his hand. It glows with a pale, green light.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [A tiny spec of light begins to glow in Senna’s chest, flickering in unison with the glow of the mirror.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: What?! This cannot be!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: With all of my strength, all of my love, I called to her, and drew her out!

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Yet, a tiny piece of her remains. Lodged inside you, clinging...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s still there? Living in me? But… how?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: No matter. I will reclaim every last bit of my beloved queen.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Come to me... my love.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego strains as he attempts to draw out the tiny piece of the queen that remains inside Senna.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Open fire! Let’s purify this creep!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels open fire on Viego as he pulls harder on the soul fragment, desperate to dislodge it.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: She holds fast. You WILL relinquish her!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Nooo! Leave her be, you villain!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen pulls Senna into her Hallowed Mist shroud, making her undetectable to Viego.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Where is she? I can’t feel her! What have you done with her?!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What are you doing?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Hiding you in Hallowed Mist, of course.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But I have to stop him!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No, Miss. Not like this.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You there. New sentinel. You can perform a great service for the King of Camavor today…

speaker: Viego

responses.dialogue: Oh. You mean Senna? I, um… haven’t seen her.
Do I look like a snitch to you?

dialogue: By telling me where your leader is hiding.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Insolence! You are but another enemy of our union. Another foe of our bliss. I will remember your face.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Keep firing! Unload on him!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels unleash a hail of gunlight. Each shot chips away a small amount of Black Mist but does little to harm Viego.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: You would deny me happiness? Lock it away, like the magics in this vault?

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Then you will perish beneath its weight.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Where did he go?!
He’s gone! And he took that mirror! Was that important?

dialogue: [In a blink, Viego disappears into the Black Mist, taking the mirror he retrieved from the vault.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A moment later, the building begins to shake violently.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t know! But we ain’t stickin’ around to find out.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: He’s bringing the building down!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Aw, you’re no fun!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good call, Rookie. Discretion is the right move here.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: You’re no fun either.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Maybe. But I still outrank you.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Aw, you’re no fun!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good call, Rookie. Discretion is the right move here.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: You’re no fun either.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Maybe. But I still outrank you.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Superb idea! I’ll find a heavy object for smashing!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stand down, Gwen. Not the time to go smashing magical boxes.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Aw. How else are we going to see what’s in it?
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: After locating the lost sentinel, Lucian, Senna, and the Rookie fight off the swarm of wraiths descending on them.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels discover a mysterious girl, Gwen, fighting off wraiths with a pair of oversized scissors. When even more wraiths arrive, she hides everyone, allowing them to make a mad dash to headquarters.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels discover what they need to do to defeat the Harrowing. With the Rookie in tow, the group heads out to fight the Black Mist in Demacia.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The group meets Vayne, who tells them the Harrowing is concentrated on one building: the mageseeker compound. With dawning knowledge that Viego is seeking a powerful magical artifact, they head out to face the Ruined King.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: A ruined Shyvana confronts them at the entrance to the compound, before burying them in rubble. Once free, everyone—including the Rookie—charges in.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Viego confronts the sentinels in the mageseeker compound. He attempts to wrest a fragment of his lost love's soul from Senna, but Gwen intervenes. Viego then vanishes, but not before collapsing the building atop the sentinels.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels escape and track down Viego, but before Senna can harm him, Shyvana attacks. At Vayne's provocation, Shyvana transforms, and the group must fight a ruined dragon.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Viego escapes while the sentinels subdue Shyvana, who is then locked in the dungeon on Senna's orders. Having witnessed the scope of Viego's evil, Vayne volunteers to join the Sentinels of Light, and the party regroups at headquarters.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After enduring countless rounds of fire from Graves, the sentinels find themselves standing ankle-deep in flammable chemicals.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: This battle is unwinnable.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: We are backed into a corner. We cannot return fire... What is our plan of retreat?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s got to run out of ammunition eventually. Right?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves pulls the trigger on his scattergun once again, rattling off a seemingly endless volley of hex-shot.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Hide all you want.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Great thing about hex-shot—it’s easy to steal!

speaker: Graves

responses.dialogue: Graves! Stop shooting, you imbecile! You’re going to blow us all sky high!
Hey, Graves? If we keep this up, we’re going to die in a horrible chemical explosion. Let’s call a truce, okay?

dialogue: I just robbed a whole warehouse of this stuff! I can shoot for days!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves calls back to you as he takes cover behind a large piece of machinery.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Is that the kid talkin’? The one who tried to pull a fast one on me?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Sorry. I don’t believe a word outta your lyin’ mouth.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Idiot or not, the kid’s telling the truth. This whole place is about to blow.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You the crossbow lady? The one that shot at me?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You, I can respect.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Great. So let the kid go. You can shoot at me all you want.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You got it.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Graves unleashes another torrent of hex-shot, tearing through what remains of the factory’s storage tanks.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Hey, Vayne—couldn’t you have asked him not to shoot us?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A pool of bright green chemicals bursts into flame.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: On, no. Chem fire!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Out! Everyone! NOW!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels escape the laboratory just in time to watch the whole thing explode.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, goodness. I do hope that gruff, foul-mouthed man who shot at us is alright.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: [COUGH COUGH] ...Thought you could… [COUGH] ...Get off easy?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Well, I got news for ya… I won.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You have to get up pretty goddamn early in the morning to pull one over on Malcolm Graves.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I’m takin’ this here magic parasol, and headin’ to find another buyer. One who—

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Oh. There you are.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: For a minute, I thought I might have to put effort into this.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Your two friends up there were really annoying, but… not anymore.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Dess and Ada? What did you do to them?!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Hang on. Who are you supposed to be? Some kinda vampire yordle or somethin’?

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Ughhh. Seriously? That’s like... way more questions than I wanna answer right now.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Think I’ll get what I came for and split. Later, normies.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vex’s shadow snatches the fetter from Graves.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Hey!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before Graves can fire a shot, Vex and her shadow disappear into the Black Mist, with the fetter in hand.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: That... yordle... JUST TOOK MY MEAL TICKET!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah. Welcome to our world.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: This ain’t… This ain’t NO WAY to live!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: It’s gotten so a fella can’t make a livin’ no more. Honest or otherwise.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Gosh. I am so sorry, Mr. Bandit Guns. Perhaps smoking and swearing would cheer you up?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Naw, that ain’t gonna do it, little lady. As long as this Ruined King and his Black Mist are runnin’ things… ain’t no place for a thief in this world.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: And I’m not sure I wanna live in a world where I can’t rob nobody.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Aw, don’t be that way. I hate to see a scumbag depressed.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Y’know, Graves, that job you did on the chem lab back there was… really somethin’.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I mean, wasn’t a whole lot of skill to it, but it sure got the job done.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hell, you didn’t even stop shootin’ when the buildin’ was on fire. It was almost… impressive.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian. Stop.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Trust me on this, darlin’.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Uh… thanks?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Matter of fact, someone with gumption like that… might be crazy enough to make a difference in this world.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: No. FIRM NO.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: He’s an experienced gunslinger who doesn’t fear death!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s a criminal, and he just tried to murder us!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And now he wants to murder Viego...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna and the sentinels look critically at Graves, judging him for a moment.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...Which is the same thing we want.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Stand still and take your smitin’, shadow beast!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Flee then! And lead me to your powerful, shadowy lord!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: OLAF NEEDS A WORTHY FOE!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, Mr. Grouchy Fur Jackets?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Huh. Now where do you suppose he ran off to?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: He got us out of the snow. Maybe we’d best leave him alone now.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah, let’s get back to the tasks at hand: finding Viego and stopping this Harrowing.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna is interrupted as the barbarian comes flying over the top of a nearby hill, landing at your feet.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The barbarian gets to his feet, collects his wits, and shouts at an unseen foe beyond the hill.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: HA-HAA! Is that all you’ve got?! I thought you’d be stronger!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Unleash your fury, shadow lord!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A young, dreary yordle dressed in black appears on the hilltop.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: [SIGH] I told you—I’m not lord of anything. I’m just Vex, okay?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The yordle’s shadow unleashes a torrent of Black Mist that slams the barbarian into the face of a rocky cliff.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Gah! Ha-HA! YES!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What’s going on here? This guy’s getting his face caved in and he’s excited about it?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Seen a lot of beatings in my time. Never seen anyone this excited to take one. What’s going on here?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: You are the one! Today, I die a warrior’s death! Praise the Thousand-Pierced Bear!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The barbarian gleefully charges at Vex.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a shrug and a sigh, Vex hurls a bolt of pure Black Mist, staggering the warrior briefly.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With another long sigh, she begins to cast a spell, going for the kill.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Yes… YES! DO IT, YA FUZZY SOOT STAIN!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, no! Mr. Furious Furs is in a most dreadful spot!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: We should help him. Any enemy of these Mist monsters is a friend of mine.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: This guy seems out of his mind. I don’t want to get involved in this weirdness.
I always root for the smaller fighter. Let’s help the yordle.
Yeah, let’s save him! But… is it just me or does he seem happy with how this is going?

dialogue: I’m inclined to agree. What do you say, Rook?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: When this guy’s berserker state wears off, he’ll be glad we saved him. Trust me.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Open fire, sentinels!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels open fire on Vex.]

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Ugh. Fine… I didn’t wanna do this fight anyway.

speaker: Vex
dialogue: Come on, Shadow. We are so done with these people.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You okay, Olaf? It’s a good thing we showed up when we did.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Good thing? GOOD thing?! Do ya know what you’ve done?!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah, we just saved your hide. How about some gratitude?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Gratitude? You’ve doomed me to an inglorious end!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Um… what?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Do ya know how long I have searched for a foe powerful enough to end me?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: At last, I find one—a truly worthy opponent, capable of giving me the hero’s death I deserve.

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: I told you. Told you all. “Let’s not get involved,” I said. But nobody listens to the Rookie.
Great. He wanted to die, and we ruined it. He’s about to kill us, isn’t he?
[To Olaf] Hey, let’s not fly off the handle. I’m sure one of us can accommodate your death wish.

dialogue: AND YOU JUST DENIED ME THAT RIGHT!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: And now I’m gonna give ya each an inglorious death of your own.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: You know, I’m beginning to think this fur-draped fellow is not as approachable as I’d hoped.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah, surprising. Normally, I get along well with other monster haters.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, I thought you said he was a good guy.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, hang on, Olaf. We spent a bunch’a time at sea together! You remember. We fought the Harrowing? You, me… Sarah Fortune showed up?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Olaf recalls none of that!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf rages toward the sentinels, swinging both axes in a berserker fury.]

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Fight! Gods, please, choose fight!
Whatever happened to running? That’s worked for me in the past.
Maybe he’s got a point about honorable deaths. Let’s let him have his way with us.

dialogue: Okay, forget what I said about this guy. We’ve got two choices: Fight him, or let him chop us to pieces.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m leaning toward fight.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m on the same page.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m disappointed in you, kid.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re sentinels. It’s our job to get involved in weird things.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Even if it’s an ornery barbarian in fur pants fightin’ a sad, magical… pixie thing.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Looks like that yordle is using Black Mist. That means she’s working with the Ruined King.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Now, please smack yourself for being so wrong, Rookie.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I’d do it myself, but my hands are frozen.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s just the heat of battle.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: One of YOU? You... are not worthy opponents.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a grueling fight, you and the sentinels finally manage to bring down Shyvana.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s how you do it. Good shootin’, folks.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though still ruined, her strength is gone. You watch as she fades back into her human form.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yep. I’d call that beaten.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne moves closer, squinting with mistrust at Shyvana.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: No. She’s still kicking.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne aims her loaded crossbow at Shyvana’s temple, point blank.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t. It’s not right.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Agreed. She doesn’t look half as terrible now. I almost feel… pity for her.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Pity? Have you people lost your minds?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s a murderous fire-breathing hellbeast in front you. One minute ago, she was trying to roast you alive!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Take it from me, if you get these things down, it’s best to finish the job.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Never leave a monster alive.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: She said stand down, Vayne.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Shyvana didn’t know what she was doing. She’s under the influence of the Black Mist.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We can lock her in the mageseeker dungeon until she returns to normal.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: She’ll never be normal.

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: Yes. I’m with Senna. It would be wrong to kill her.
Are you kidding? She tried to roast me alive! Fire away.
Hmm. Maybe compromise and just wound her?

dialogue: What do you say, Rookie? You want to let this monster live?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, where’d Viego get off to?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I don’t see him. I do believe he’s… gone.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s get after him then. Rookie, fire up that Wayfinder and take us back to headquarters. We’ll plan our next move from there.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Wait...

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Suppose you find this guy? Then what?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You must’ve fired a hundred shots at him today, and barely made a dent.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’ll figure it out.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You’ll die. Face it—you might know Harrowings, but I know monsters.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: And I know every one of them’s got a weak spot. Even this guy.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sounds to me like you’re volunteering.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That depends.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Those fancy magical weapons you people use…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: They come in crossbow form?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I think we can find something that’ll suit ya. Welcome aboard.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, are you sure about this? This woman seems a little… eager.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: That depends. Does she still want to slap me?
I don’t know. She seems… unhinged.
Yeah. I think Vayne is exactly what we need in a sentinel.

dialogue: We need all the help we can get. Don’t you think so, Rookie?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Good. Well, Vayne… welcome aboard. Are you sure you’re ready to be a sentinel?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Are you sure the sentinels are ready for me?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Ready as we’ll ever be. (...I hope.)

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Take us home, Rookie.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Rookie activates the Wayfinder, and the entire party disappears in a flash of blinding white light.]

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: I take it you’ve never owned a pet.
I’m willing to take that risk.

dialogue: Take it from me, kid. If you spare these beasts—they always come back to bite you.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Hmph.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne glowers at you scornfully, with great disappointment.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You got a lot to learn, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You go around shooting everything, there won’t be any world to save.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Take the dragon lady to the dungeon. She won’t harm anybody there.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You got a lot to learn, Rookie.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You go around shooting everything, there won’t be any world to save.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Take the dragon lady to the dungeon. She won’t harm anybody there.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’ll keep her under control. No slappin’, I promise.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Don’t know if I can stop her from shootin’ you though.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m kiddin’, Rook. See? I can do jokes.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’ll keep her under control. No slappin’, I promise.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Don’t know if I can stop her from shootin’ you though.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’m kiddin’, Rook. See? I can do jokes.
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Digging their way out of a snowdrift, the sentinels discover a giant, axe-wielding berserker chasing after the same wraiths they're fighting.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Olaf's battle with a shadowy figure is interrupted when the sentinels come to his aid. Olaf is displeased with their interference in his glorious warrior's death and demands a fight.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The Rookie has a close call with Olaf's blade but eventually placates him. Olaf agrees to team up with the sentinels to fight the shadowy figure. The group then sets off through the ice caves in search of its foe.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: The sentinels confront Vex, but make little headway. Olaf, pacified by the Rookie, can't enter his berserk state to help until the group provokes him. Nonetheless, the shadowy yordle manages to secure the artifact and escape.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: To stop their enemy's flight, Olaf and the sentinels trigger an avalanche, but Vex slows them down with a cloud of despair and disappears. Lucian suggests recruiting Olaf, with Senna reluctantly agreeing.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Threatened by a massive Harrowing, the sentinels have taken refuge in the old headquarters.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: See there? We made it. Safe in the tidy confines of—

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my. This place needs a lot of stitching.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: It’s pretty bare. I think I’ve got some canned sturgeon and a hunting knife.
Are you kidding? I haven’t seen a supply ship in weeks. I’ve been eating sand snails.
We’re loaded! Anything you could ever want is stocked in this crumbling shack.

dialogue: It’s seen better days, for sure. Rookie, how are you stocked on supplies?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay. Looks like we’ll be roughing it tonight then. Everyone, find a spot on the floor and settle in.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Tomorrow, we fix the boat and try to rein in that Black Mist. ...Somehow.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You move to your cot into the corner of the room...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [But your rest is interrupted by a startling sight.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [An old stone tablet in the back of the room begins to flicker with a magical glow…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [And an unfamiliar face appears, projected by magic.]

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: Hello? Headquarters, this is the Serpent Isles base. Can you hear me?

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: I don’t know! This has never happened before!
I’m not sure. I always thought these old stone tablets were for decoration. I never knew they did this.
H...how many hells do you think there are?

dialogue: What the many hells is that?!

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: This is the Serpent Isles sentinel base. I’ve activated your communications portal.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: The situation is most dire. The Black Mist...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’ve been dealing with it out here, too. How far has it spread?

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: Everywhere.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: We’ve been following its progress on the Worldstone...

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: In all my years, I’ve never seen a Harrowing like this. It moves quickly, with purpose, covering entire continents overnight.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: We’re holding our ground in the Serpent Isles, but... I can’t say how much longer we’ll last.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Where is the Ruined King? If I can just find him, I’ll snip him into so many pieces...

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: I’m afraid it’s not that simple. Viego travels through the Mist in the blink of an eye, moving across the world at will.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: You must leave immediately and take the fight to his Black Mist. Your nearest region is Demacia. It’s as good a place to start as any.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Demacia? That’s a thousand leagues away! Even if we fix our boat, it’ll take months to—

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: I see you know little of the secrets of our order. Touch Demacia on the Worldstone map.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian’s finger finds Demacia on the map. A beam of magical light shines from it, illuminating everyone in the room.]

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: This enchanted map can instantly transport you to any sentinel base in Runeterra.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: You must visit every region, cleanse them of Viego’s influence…

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: And if possible, recruit worthy soldiers to our cause.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Of course I’m ready. Anything to get me out of this place.
Actually, I’m more of a homebody. Think I’ll stay here with the sand snails and the dilapidated shack.
Sorry, I’m still just kinda stunned that these old tablets can do all of this. I mean, how is any of this even possible?

dialogue: Hmm. Looks like we’ve got our work cut out for us. What do you say, Rookie? You ready to see the world?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know what? It doesn’t matter what Rookie thinks. The kid ain’t coming.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Come on, Lucian. You heard the sentinel. We need recruits.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Experienced recruits. We can’t be babysittin’ some greenhorn when we’ve got a world to save.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now, Scissors over here... She’s earned it. Welcome aboard, Scissors.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Marvelous! I shall sew joy into every seam of this world! Viego will have no refuge!

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: There’s just one more thing you’ll need. Your headquarters should be equipped with a Wayfinder. It looks like this.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A holographic image of your gun appears on the tablet.]

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: It’s your ticket back to headquarters. You can activate it anywhere in the world, and it will teleport you home.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That looks like your gun, Rookie. I guess we know what it does now.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, you heard the man, Rook. Looks like I’m gonna need you to hand that Wayfinder over. You weren’t using it anyway.

speaker: Buhru Sentinel
dialogue: I’m afraid that won’t work. The Wayfinder can only be used by the sentinel to whom it was bound.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Hey, that’s me! I’m the only one who can use the Wayfinder. Looks like you need me on this journey after all.
You know what? I think that might be me. Sorry. Guess I’m the only one who can use the Wayfinder.
Yep. I’m the only one who can use the Wayfinder. Now who’s the “greenhorn”? And what does that word mean?

dialogue: Oh, no. Let me guess…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Just get your bag, Rook.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And don’t get too comfortable. I got my eye on you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian touches the Worldstone again.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With a flash of magical light, you and the sentinels are teleported from headquarters...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You arrive in Demacia to find that little remains of the old sentinel base.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Beneath your feet is a sentinel glyph carved into the limestone landing. It glows softly on your arrival.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before you, the entire city of Demacia lies shrouded in Black Mist. The shrieks of wraiths and the cries of the living come from just inside the gates.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Damn. Guess the sentinel base is long gone.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Looks like there might not be much left of the city either.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: At least, nothing that’s not ruined.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: I’m sorry, Lucian. It must be hard for you to see Demacia like this.
So… what now?
What’re we standing around for? Let’s go unruin it!

dialogue: Sorry, babe. Not the homecoming you were hoping for.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: But first, we’ve got to get the lay of the land here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, where’s a good place to go to get some intelligence?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hmm. There used to be an old tavern up here just inside the gates.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: A tavern? Really, Lucian. Isn’t it customary to toast after the battle?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Place was always full of salty ol’ sailors and mercenaries. If anyone can tell us anything about what’s happened around here, that’ll be the place to find ‘em.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Worth a try.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s… not optimal. But it’ll have to do.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Oh. Crackers. Is that a… type of bread?
Crackers? Sure, I’ll harvest some wheat and get it to the mill right away. Do you know how to build an oven by any chance?

dialogue: I’ve had canned sturgeon. It’s not bad on crackers.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You messing with me, kid? Keep it up, and see where it gets ya.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s… not optimal. But it’ll have to do.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: They’re pretty good, actually. Once you scrape off the slime sack.
They’re the worst thing you’ve ever eaten. Especially the slime sack.

dialogue: Hell, I’d eat a sand snail. How bad could they be?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This ain’t the way to treat company, Rook.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Seriously?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No. Rook's joking.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Sorry. I guess I need the jokes to keep my sanity. The truth is I’m scraping to get by and never know where my next meal is coming from.
Sorry, sir. Just trying to lighten the mood. The truth is this place is a real dump.

dialogue: The kid's having some fun at our expense.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sorry won’t get us anything, Rook.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The Mist doesn’t care how sorry you are. Neither does Viego.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: All they’re gonna understand is the light from a gun barrel.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I’ll tell you what now. We go in guns blazing and purify this place.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Stay close, Rookie. You’re about to earn your first stripe.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Look at you, all rarin’ to go.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t tease the kid, babe. I remember when my spirit wasn’t broken yet.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’ll see plenty of action soon enough, Rookie.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Later…]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...And may we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: ...May we stand together in the light, or fall in darkness.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: By my authority in the order, I proclaim you Sentinel Riven.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Fight bravely, and remember your oath.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s wrong? Don’t tell me you wanna back out already.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Senna, I appreciate you doing this. I do, but…

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It’s been a long time since I’ve belonged somewhere. There are things about me—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I know. Back there at the Black Rose door… I could tell. You’ve got a past.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And that’s okay. Your present is here. With us.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I want to believe you. I really do.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With tears in her eyes, Riven leaves to get suited up in the weapon room.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So. You ever gonna tell me what happened back there with Viego?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Nothing happened.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s not what Rookie said.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Sorry. He tricked me!
You try saying no to Lucian. He can be really scary.

dialogue: Rookie! Why?!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [sigh] He’s putting her back together.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The Ruined Queen?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Isolde, yes. All of those things he’s collecting... They’re her fetters. Bits of her soul.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And the one inside you?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: It’s the only one he can’t touch. Unless I give it to him.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh-huh. And why would he think you’d do that?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I don’t know, Lucian.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This… THIS is why I said you should stay away from him. You’re too important, and there’s a lot we don’t know here. Let the others do the fighting!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We are NOT having this discussion ag—

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Attention, all sentinels! The great seamstress Gwen would now like to model her newest creation… SENTINEL RIVEN!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Wow. I… don’t know what to say.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I feel like a whole new Riven. Sentinel Riven. Yeah...

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Oh, no. You two look upset. Did I just interrupt something?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No. We were just…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Talking about where to go next. You got any preference?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You arrive in a cold, disorienting darkness.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Your feet can’t find the ground. It feels as if you’re suspended in ice.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What’s happening? Where are we?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I can’t feel my nose. What strange sensation is this?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’re just cold. I think we’re in a snow drift.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Guess this is where the sentinel base is. Or was.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Looks like we won’t find any sentinels here either. The place has been buried in decades of snowpack.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Snow? What is that exactly?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You’re a strange one, Scissors. I’ll tell you about it later.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: I would, but uh… I can’t tell which way is up.
I would, but uh… I can’t seem to feel my hands. They’re completely frozen.
Got it. Wait, who’s talking? Is that Senna?

dialogue: Rookie, are you with me? Try to dig out of this. Go up.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You’ll figure it out. You’re a bright kid.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After a few minutes of frantic digging, you and the sentinels emerge in the forests of the ruined Freljord.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s one ruined Freljord alright.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: First order of business is to find out what Viego wants here. Let’s spread out and search.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You take one step and walk right into another deep snow drift.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ah, hells. This stuff is waist deep.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Amazing. What splendid fluffy whiteness. It’s like… freezing cotton!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uh-huh. I’m glad you’re having fun playing in the snow, but we really need to find a way around it.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: A shovel would come in mighty handy right now.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, a formidable yell echos through the pines, raising the hair on your neck.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Come back here and taste the edge of my axe, ya ghoulish draugr!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: *GASP* What a peculiar, angry man. Is he wearing dead animals?!

speaker: Gwen

responses.dialogue: I don’t think it’s a good idea to approach that guy. He looks dangerous.
Gwen, in my experience, it’s best to stay away from furious people swinging axes.
Sure, why not. Let’s go talk to the crazy, axe-wielding berserker.

dialogue: He must possess a wealth of tailoring knowledge. Ooh, I must pick his brain.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hang on. I think I know this axe wielder.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Name’s Olaf. He’s a good guy...

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...as long as you don’t piss him off.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The crazed berserker attempts to chop down a wraith with his steel axes.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Why won’t you DIE?!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: He seems to hate wraiths. How bad can he be?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Not only that—look what he’s doing to this snow.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You watch in disbelief as Olaf hacks his way clean through the snow drifts, leaving a clear path for you.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This looks like an opportunity. I say we get behind this maniac and let him plow us out of here.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Wonderful. I just know we’re going to become fast friends.

speaker: Gwen

responses.dialogue: [SARCASTIC] Yeah. This is going to end well.
[SINCERE] Yeah, okay. I can see this working out well for us.

dialogue: Hello? Mr. Angry Animal Skins? Do wait for me!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Now let’s get after that berserker.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Drop the sarcasm, Rook. We’re doing this.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Glad you approve.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [After several minutes of hacking through dense vegetation, you and Lucian finally reach the heart of the Ixtali jungle.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sure is dark in here.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Bet there’s a lot of jungle critters watchin’ us right now.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hope Senna’s okay in all this.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, Lucian stops and whirls to his right, drawing his guns.]

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Probably just a cobra. I wouldn’t worry though. They’re more scared of us.
Tee-hee. Lucian… are you scared?
I didn’t hear anything. Except for you yelling “You hear somethin’?!”

dialogue: What was that? You hear somethin’, Rook?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Maybe it was nothin’.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Huh. Kinda funny, ain’t it?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I mean, look at us—we hunt wraiths and ghouls and all the foulest creatures of the Harrowing…

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Sure. We both got scared. Whatever you say.
You’re the one who got scared. Not me. You can’t scare this.

dialogue: ...but put us in the jungle for five minutes, and we get all weak-kneed!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re in this together, Rookie.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That means we BOTH got scared.

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: What was that?
Did you hear something?

dialogue: [A tree branch rustles behind you. This time, it is you who’s startled.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I didn’t hear anything. Are you still messin’ with me, kid?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The source of the rustling reveals itself, leaping onto your back from the trees above.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rookie!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Who dares to hunt in my jungle?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You feel the big cat’s claws sink into your back. Lucian draws his guns.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Unclaw the kid, or I’ll blow your tail off, cat!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: Rengar? We’re not hunting a Rengar! We don’t even know what that is!
There seems to have been a misunderstanding, Mr. Cat. We’re not hunters.

dialogue: If you have come hunting Rengar, you have come for the wrong game! For I am nobody’s prey!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Ha! You expect me to believe you are not hunters?!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Why do you carry such weapons, if not for hunting very large game?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well… I reckon we are huntin’ big game. Matter of fact, you could say it’s the biggest game of all.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Ahh. You are hunting the Ixtali river elk.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Rengar finally releases his claws from your back. You breathe a sigh of relief.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No. What we’re lookin’ for is even bigger than that.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Bigger than an elk?! Rengar doubts the veracity of your claim!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah, well, Rengar’s never seen a Harrowing before.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Right now, these jungles are swarmin’ with things so monstrous you’d—
[DISTANT BLOOD-CURDLING SHRIEK]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: What was that sound?! That was no creature of this jungle. Rengar knows them all!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That, my big feline friend, was a wraith.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And it’s exactly what we’ve come here to hunt.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Then Rengar will hunt it with you!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Minutes later, you, Lucian, and Rengar are hot on the trail of the wraith.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: How will we track this “wraith”? What do their droppings look like?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: They don’t really, uh, make droppings.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: But I’m starting to see trails of Black Mist, and that means we’re close.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: How exciting to search for new game! Season after season, Rengar has hunted countless prey in this wilderness.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I have slain them all in great numbers, and grow weary of collecting their heads.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, I’ve got a feelin’ you won’t be bored today. Wraiths will give you all the hunt you can handle.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Outstanding! What kind of bait do you use to attract them?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No bait. I reckon you could say they just come right to ya.

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: I don’t think you can really make trophies out of wraith heads. Sorry.
It’s not that easy. Your knives won’t do anything to these wraiths.

dialogue: That does not sound challenging! I will cut off their heads with my knives and mount them as trophies on my wall!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, the hair on Rengar’s back stands up, and his tail fluffs to enormous size.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: What is that? Something is here.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s our wraith.

speaker: Wraith
dialogue: [SHREEEEIK]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: A whole herd of wraiths!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I’ll take all their heads as trophies!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You watch in astonishment as Rengar leaps from wraith to wraith, slashing at them with his knives.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Despite his enthusiasm, Rengar’s blades pass through the wraiths, with no effect.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Nothing? No effect?! But I am Rengar—apex predator and master hunter! You are my prey!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The wraiths swarm Rengar without mercy, sapping the life from his body.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The fierce hunter falls helplessly to the ground beneath a blanket of shadowy limbs.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Come on, Rook. Looks like we got a cat to save.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Kid, you do NOT wanna rile me right now!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I will shoot everything in this damn jungle, including you.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Kid, you do NOT wanna rile me right now!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I will shoot everything in this damn jungle, including you.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Then I will make jewelry from their teeth—a whole necklace of wraith teeth!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: So all who see me will know I bested them!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Then I will use my razor-sharp teeth and claws!

speaker: Rengar

responses.dialogue: Yep. Still bleeding from them, in fact. Thanks for that.
I sure do. By the way, how clean were those claws?

dialogue: You have felt them. You know of their razor-sharpness!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels follow Miss Fortune ashore in an attempt to retrieve a fetter.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Way to use your big name, Graves. You really had her eating out of your hand.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Somethin’s happened to her.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Sarah Fortune has always been the most ruthless, connivin’, backstabbin’est cutthroat in the whole damn isles…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: ...but now she seems like she’s… gone wrong.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. She does seem a little off her rocker. Things must’ve gotten real bad between her and this Gangplank fella.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I have tracked her! She is hiding up ahead in that cave for boats.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Ahead in the shipyard, Miss Fortune stands, fetter in hand, searching for someone in the Mist.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: There’s our little loose cannon.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Careful. You get someone like her cornered, you’re liable to get a face full of lead.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Sarah—whatever you’re thinking of trying with Viego… don’t.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: “Don’t?” Ha! That’s your advice?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Do you know what I’ve been through the past few months?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: How much I’ve lost? How many times I’ve nearly found myself dead at the bottom of the bay…?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: And here the Ruined King drops his anchor in my harbor, and I’m supposed to ignore the opportunity?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: This whole war. This power struggle with Gangplank... I could end it today.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Bad idea. Never deal with monsters. Especially this monster.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: You’re wrong. I know what he’s capable of. And I can use him.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: He cannot be used! I’ve chased him and his shadow lord across the world, hoping for a glorious death.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: They’ve not even granted me that!

responses.dialogue: He ruined the entire Spirit of Ionia. What makes you think you stand a chance?
He’s got a powerful yordle friend that’s helping him spread misery. You won’t win this.
He just took down the Targonian Aspect of War! You don’t want any part of this guy.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It is true. Viego’s power is greater than the heavens themselves. Everyone he encounters, he ruins.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Listen, you all seem like nice people...

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: ...but in Bilgewater, nice people get their throats cut. And the cutthroats get the spoils.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I don’t intend to be on the losing end of this.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Losing? The sentinels have been putting down Harrowings for a thousand years! What makes you think we’re gonna lose?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Don’t take it personally, Lucian. You sure you know which way the winds are blowing?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yes. We do.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Unless Isolde has been lying to me this whole time, I know it’s our destiny to confront Viego and end his reign.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Make it your destiny, Sarah. Fight Viego with the sentinels. Be on the right side.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: And if we win… what? I get to come back here and deal with Gangplank? Doesn’t sound like such a rosy ending.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: If you free Bilgewater from this Harrowing, everyone here will respect you.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: They will know your strength, and they will follow you to the world’s end. People will speak your name in reverent tones for ages, and your rivals will fade into obscurity and disgrace.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Damn, that was pretty good. You actually had ME inspired for a second.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Do not speak to me.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Fine. (...Didn’t wanna talk to you anyway.)

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Miss Fortune pauses, contemplating her options.]

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: You all make a convincing case.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: And even though I don’t think you stand a chance in hell, I’m willing to see how this plays out.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: If you can take out the Ruined King, the fetter is yours.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I mean, you could give it to us now. That’s probably the safe move.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I’ll hold the treasure for now. Because if you don’t take out the Ruined King…

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: ...I intend to have my ass nicely covered.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh-huh. Excuse us a second, Sarah.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: There’s one of her and, like, ten of us. Why don’t we just jump her and take the fetter? When in Bilgewater…
Why does she insist on holding the fetter? This whole thing is suspect.
She’s just hedging her bets. I think she’ll make good on this once she sees how strong and reliable we are.

dialogue: What do y’all think? She seems a far cry from the Sarah I knew. Can’t say if she’ll come through on this or not.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Okay, Fortune. We’ll do it your way.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We’ll find Viego, fight him, and win. But when we do…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...I’m holding you to your end of the bargain.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Now for the matter of finding him…

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Rengar’s whiskers are twitching. Something is in the air.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A hot burst of Black Mist blows into the shipyard from the docks ahead.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You get a strong whiff of rotting fish, and the foul, musty scent of Harrowing.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Down there. In the Slaughter Docks.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s his trail.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You do that and you’ll have twenty goons comin’ outta the woodwork to cave your head in, kid.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Don’t be fooled. Sarah Fortune don’t never sail alone.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I gotta admit, I wouldn’t sit with my back turned to her.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: But if you can earn her trust, she’s a mighty powerful gun to have at your side.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I gotta admit, I wouldn’t sit with my back turned to her.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: But if you can earn her trust, she’s a mighty powerful gun to have at your side.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels arrive on a jetty in Bilgewater Bay. Black Mist extends as far as the eye can see, obscuring your view of the island in the distance.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before you, a fleet of armed warships blocks the mouth of the harbor.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s going on here? Looks like some kind of blockade.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: These ships mean business. Got enough firepower to blow this island clean off the map.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Whoever it is seems to have our fetter. Look…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna points to a stream of Mist flowing into the cabin of the largest ship.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: What if we use our best manners and ask them nicely for it? Why, they couldn’t possibly say no.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Sure. I hear Bilgewater is famous for its warm hospitality.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Funny you should mention that, Vayne. It just so happens that I am from Bilgewater.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...And?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Well, I ain’t tryin’ to brag, but ol’ Malcolm Graves is kinda a big name in this town.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: A name that’s sure to carry weight with whoever’s on this ship.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: How’s about I climb aboard and see if I can’t pull a few strings with the captain?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Hee-hee! Why, I think Mr. Scruffy Smokes-a-lot is trying to impress you, Vayne.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Ugh. Is he going to do this the whole time?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t complain. At least he’s making himself useful.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’ll check out the ship with Graves. Gwen, Vayne, and Rookie—you come with me.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Let me guess…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian, you take the others and investigate the town.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: So I can be worried sick about you being on some ship with a buncha sketchy cutthroats? No way.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I can handle cutthroats. You’ve got the dangerous job...

speaker: Senna
dialogue: See what’s going on in town. There’s a lot of commotion down there, and it’s got Viego written all over it.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: But—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You know I love you, babe.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna plants a kiss on Lucian’s lips. He immediately melts.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: [grumble] She did it to me again.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You follow Graves on board, into the dark cabin of the ship.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Y’all just watch. I’m fixin’ to show ya how we do business in ol’ Bilge…

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Hello?! Anyone home?! Malcolm Graves here!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Don’t worry, this ain’t a stickup. I’m lookin’ to speak to the captain—

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Well, well. Look what washed in with the tide…

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Malcolm Goddamn Graves.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Sarah Fortune? Awww, hell naw.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: What’re you doin’ here? When’d you get a whole fleet a’ warships?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: When other interested parties decided to challenge me for control of Bilgewater.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I’ve decided to lock the place down until we get this whole mess sorted out.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: You gonna introduce us to your fellow scumbag, Graves?

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Yyyeah. Uh… Vayne, and everybody, this is Sarah.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: You seem nervous, Malcolm? Like you’ve got something to hide, maybe?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a fraction of a second, Miss Fortune’s demeanor darkens, as she thrusts her blunderbuss pistols into Graves’s face.]

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: What’s Gangplank paying you?!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Wh-what?! I ain’t workin’ for no Gangplank!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: You tell that wharf rat that his days are numbered. Nobody sinks Sarah Fortune!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: I ain’t even on speakin’ terms with Gangplank! I can’t stand that orange-eatin’ bastard! You know that!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: What I know is you just showed up on my ship with fancy new equipment and an expensive team of mercenaries.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: There’s only one man this side of Piltover with that kind of coin.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Now tell me what he’s planning, or you’ll be smoking that cigar through a new hole.

speaker: Graves

responses.dialogue: Uh, Miss Fortune, ma’am? He’s telling the truth. We don’t know any Gangplank.
Gangplank? Seriously, that’s the guy’s name? What is he, a pirate?
Sarah—Can I call you Sarah?—We’re not mercenaries. We’re Sentinels of Light.

dialogue: You’re... You’re crazy! What’s wrong with you?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Sentinels of Light? You expect me to believe that?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I’ve only met one sentinel in my time, and he was nothing like your kind. He was—

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Senna! You were right! It’s him!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Lucian?! I was just talking about you!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: I take it this is your crew?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yep. Could you kindly refrain from killin’ ‘em? We’re about to need every gun we’ve got.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Sarah Fortune lowers her pistols from Graves’s face.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Lucian. You know this woman?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah, remember? I told you about that time I was on a boat with Olaf?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, Sarah was there, too. And we ran into Hecarim…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hecarim?! When did you meet him?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: It’s a really long story with a lot of characters, darlin’. Can we talk about it later?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What else are you hiding from me?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and Lucian exchange worried looks.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uhhh—

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The important thing is that I found out Viego is already here.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Viego?! He’s back in Bilgewater?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: (As if I didn’t have enough to worry about with Gangplank...)

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: What does he want here?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We believe he’s looking for something of great importance to him. Something on board your ship.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Did you pick up any loot recently?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Does a fish breathe water?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Rafen! Bring out the last haul!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Miss Fortune’s first mate Rafen delivers a pile of recently acquired treasures to the cabin.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Among them is a brass bell covered in a writhing blanket of Black Mist.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Look, Miss—another fetter!

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Fetter?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: A piece of the Ruined Queen’s soul. This is what Viego’s tearin’ up the world to find.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: So… the Ruined King misses his wife. How romantic. And how desperate.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: (...Maybe desperate enough to give me what I want.)

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Rafen! Lower the brow. I’m going ashore.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What are you doing?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Going to find our ruined friend. I believe he and I have business to discuss.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What? Sarah, no! You can’t deal with this guy! He’s—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Before she can be reasoned with, Miss Fortune grabs the fetter and exits the ship.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, Lucian, your old sailing buddy has just taken the fetter and left to find Viego. You got anything to say?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We gotta talk some sense into her. Come on.

speaker: Miss Fortune
