dialogue: You put on a convincing performance, kid.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Like you’ve never heard of the so-called “Saltwater Scourge”… ”Reaver King of the High Seas”… “Scum-sucking Hagfish Who Takes All You’ve Ever Cared About”…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Nope. We’re Sentinels of Light. We don’t keep up with you lowlifes.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...No offense.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: You put on a convincing performance, kid.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Like you’ve never heard of the so-called “Saltwater Scourge”… ”Reaver King of the High Seas”… “Scum-sucking Hagfish Who Takes All You’ve Ever Cared About”…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Nope. We’re Sentinels of Light. We don’t keep up with you lowlifes.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...No offense.
{i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: In Noxus, the sentinels discover that their base has been paved over by the Reckoner's Arena, where gladiators are fighting wraiths. Draven presides over the ruined crowd and, after spotting the sentinels, decides to make them his next combatants.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Though the sentinels triumph, they're imprisoned with Riven for the next arena fight. Fortunately, she's devised an escape plan, one that requires the Rookie's silver tongue to execute.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Once free, Riven and the sentinels follow the Black Mist to the Immortal Bastion. Wraiths reveal an concealed entrance to the city's catacombs, and Senna, Riven, and the Rookie descend in search of the secrets the Mist seeks out.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: At the Black Rose's chamber, Senna, Riven, and Rook confront Viego. He’s found another fetter, a part of Isolde, and taunts Senna about the one she possesses. Before they can stop him, Viego vanishes, and Draven demands the three finish their fight.

dialogue: {i18n sentinels_hub_2021.None}
description: Draven forces Senna, Riven, and the Rookie to battle him in the arena. After a struggle, the three exploit Draven's pandering to the crowd to get the upper hand. The sentinels return to headquarters to recover and plan, with new recruit Riven in tow.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels finish fighting through the sea of wraiths on the arena floor.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The ruined crowd roars in approval, thoroughly entertained by the action.]

speaker: Draven
dialogue: YES! Ladies and gentlemen… WASN’T THAT VIOLENCE SPECTACULAR?!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Have you not enjoyed DRAVEN’S BIG SHOW?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Much to Draven’s satisfaction, the crowd begins to chant his name: “DRAVEN! DRAVEN! DRAVEN!”]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Listen to me, Draven! Everyone here is in a deep pile of trouble!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The Ruined King is here. We don’t know what he aims to do, but we need you to let us outta here so we can stop him.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Let you out? But…

speaker: Draven
dialogue: You’re my BIG STARS! My PRIZED COMBATANTS!

speaker: Draven

responses.dialogue: Listen, you psycho. See that black stuff coming off of you? That’s Black Mist, and it’s got hold of your mind.
Mr. Draven, sir… I would LOVE to be your arena star, but can we please fight this Harrowing first?

dialogue: The audience LOVES YOU! And therefore LOVES ME! I CAN’T let you leave.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Show them to their pens.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In seconds, an army of ghostly Noxians pours through the arena gates, swarming the sentinels.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You resist at first, but there are far too many to overcome.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Is everyone okay?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No. Oh, no!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: They’ve taken my sewing tools!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Yeah. They’ve taken all our sewing tools. My crossbow’s gone, too.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: What is this dreadful place?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I reckon we’ve been put in the gladiator pens.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: More like gladiator prison. These people are here against their will…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...to be fodder for “Draven’s big show”.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Great. The whole damn world’s about to be ruined, and we get to spend our final hours in gladiator jail.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: After everything we’ve been through, this is how it ends?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A woman’s voice speaks to you from the neighboring cell.]
Sounds to me like you’re looking to break out.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Who’s there?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: They call me Riven. ...And other less flattering things.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: I’ve been in here a while, and I think I’ve figured out an escape plan.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Can’t do it by myself though. I need a few people to make this work.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It’s either that or we fight each other in the arena tomorrow. What do ya say?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re listenin’.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: First thing we need to do is get one of the arena guards in here.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And how do we do that?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Well… which one of you is the best liar?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’d be Rookie. Kid used to be a diplomat apparently.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...Or a con artist. I forget which.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Great. Sounds like we’ve got our liar.

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: [SCREAM CRUDELY] Umm… okay. HEEEYYY, GUARRRD!!!
[POLITELY REQUEST] Sure thing. Hello? Guard? Is anyone there?
[ACT BADLY] Oh, no. Something dreadful has happened in my cell. Won’t someone come to investigate?

dialogue: Listen, kid. Somehow, I need you to get the guard to come to your cell. I don’t care how you do it.

speaker: Noxian Guard

responses.dialogue: Just wondering about dinner. What are the entree choices tonight?
My shoe. It… fell in the filth bucket. Do you have a towel by any chance?
Gosh, I wish I could just tell you, but it’s probably better if you come in here and see it for yourself.

dialogue: Yeah? What do you want?

speaker: Noxian Guard
dialogue: You’re awful mouthy for fresh meat. How ‘bout I shut yer gob for ya?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Tapping his truncheon in the palm of his hand, the guard enters your cell.]

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: I’m sorry, what?
I’m on it.
Vayne, take him out!

dialogue: Now, take him out!

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: I’m sorry, what?
I’m on it.
Olaf, take him out!

dialogue: Now, take him out!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nice work. Keys are on his belt.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You take the keys from the unconscious guard’s belt and open the cell door.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That was the big plan you’ve been devising? Hitting him over the head and taking his keys?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Hey, it worked.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Now we just have to take out the other guards.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Other guards? How many are we talkin’?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Couple dozen or so.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, boy. Sure hope this filth bucket holds up.

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Kid, the only thing on my mind... is how you’re going to manage to top today’s performance…

speaker: Draven
dialogue: WHEN YOU FIGHT IN MY ARENA AGAIN TOMORROW!

speaker: Draven
dialogue: Kid, the only thing you’re going to be fighting…

speaker: Draven
dialogue: ...Is a fresh new challenger, WHEN YOU ENTER MY ARENA AGAIN TOMORROW!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Just do it!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Vayne

responses.dialogue: I’m sorry. I didn’t mean anything by it. It’s just that you’re the toughest person here, and—hurry, he’s coming!
Orders? No, that was a suggestion! And I suggest you hurry because he’s about to club me.

dialogue: You are giving orders to me?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Sure, kid.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a quick blur of violence, Vayne beats the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Nobody smacks our Rookie but me.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Just do it!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a flash, you club the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: I guess you didn’t hear him talking about your beard. He said it looked like it belongs on a yeti’s bottom.
Really? Could’ve sworn I heard him making fun of your lice. I’m surprised you would take that.

dialogue: What? But this man’s just a grunt. A decidedly unworthy foe.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: AHHH, THAT TEARS IT!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a fit of berserker rage, Olaf beats the guard unconscious with the filth bucket.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels make quick work of the Solari soldiers, leaving their bodies sprawled on the mountain path.]

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: That’s right. Think twice before you mess with our mountain guide. Right, Moonbeams?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I cannot celebrate their deaths.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What?! Why not? Those zealots would’ve killed you!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There are other Solari, just like them. Countless others.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Shall I kill them all? What then is the point of all this?

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: Because… the other Moon people! Remember them? That’s why you’re doing this.
Because Targon can change. Sure, it sucks today, but you can lead it to a better future.
Forget Targon then. Do it for all Runeterra.

dialogue: Why bother to save something so intent on destroying itself?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: You make a good point, young one. You are wise beyond your years.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Perhaps you are living proof that some people are worth saving.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Spend some time with the kid. You’ll change your opinion.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Let us continue our climb, and do what must be done.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The thunderous rumbling shakes the mountain once again. This time, it sounds much nearer.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The Aspects grow more distressed. We must hurry to the top.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Later, you arrive at a large plateau on the side of the mountain.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The rumble of the fighting above is now deafening, and growing louder by the step.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: HOW MUCH FARTHER? I DON’T THINK MY EARS CAN TAKE MUCH MORE OF THIS!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The peak is just above us!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s happening up there?! Can you see?!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels look up toward the peak of Targon. Through the thick black fog of the Harrowing, you can barely see a battle taking place.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: I only seek the fetter. Stand down, Aspect!

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: I am no Aspect. I am Atreus!

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: Foe of Aspect, darkin, demon, and all who would wield such power against mortals.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pantheon thrusts his spear at Viego. The latter blocks with his massive sword, and the two lock in a vicious stalemate.]

speaker: Viego
dialogue: I see. That’s a pity then.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: If you were an Aspect, you might have stood a chance.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: For I am VIEGO, Last and Greatest of the Kings of Camavor… Devoted Husband to Queen Isolde… Reclaimer of History’s Greatest Love...

speaker: Viego
dialogue: And no mere mortal is going to stop me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Viego swats away Pantheon’s spear, and draws back his sword to strike.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, no! I can’t look! That poor man with the thimble on his head is about to be stuck like a pin-cushion!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Atreus! You must resist!

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Wait, that’s not an Aspect—that’s Viego! Who’s the other guy? Is he on our side?
Are you talking about the guy with the spear? He seems pretty powerful. What are we going to do that he can’t?
But they’re at the peak! What if we go up there and the Aspects decide we aren’t worthy?

dialogue: Hurry! We have to help him!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Onward, to the peak!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels rush to reach the peak and assist Atreus...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...But not quickly enough.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With Atreus’s defenses down, Viego runs him through with his sword.]

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: Uhhhnn…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Yes, Atreus. I know the pain you must feel.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: The pain of regret, of failing to be that which you know you could be. The pain of your own mortality.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: Why not give in, and let the ghost of your higher form return?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the Black Mist swirls around Atreus and flows into his wound, he begins to change…]

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: No! NO…

speaker: Viego
dialogue: I’m afraid so.

speaker: Viego
dialogue: What is your name… ASPECT?

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: I am… Pantheon—Aspect of War...

speaker: Pantheon
dialogue: ...And I have slept for far too long.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pantheon raises his spear and releases a war cry that shakes the mountain to its core.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Oh, no. Heavens help us.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What in the Bear’s name is happening?!

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: Pantheon? Like, the Targonian war god Pantheon?
Gotta be honest—I wasn’t that close with Atreus anyway.
Is that… bad?

dialogue: Atreus is no more. Pantheon… has returned.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What does that mean?!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It means the entire world is about to suffer.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Large pieces of rock begin to crumble down from the peak above you.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Desperate, the sentinels stand flat against the face of the mountain. Boulders crash all around them, just missing.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: This isn’t going to work! We’ll be crushed if we stay here!

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Ah, being crushed by the Aspect of War—I always knew I’d go out like this.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Everyone, run for that cave over there!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna nods toward a cave entrance several yards away.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You gather your nerve, and make a run for it, hoping the large, thundering boulders somehow miss you in their fall.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: That is Atreus—a human soldier, blessed by the Aspect of War. (...Though it seems to be doing him little good now.)

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Fill the Ruined Creep with gunlight, that’s what. Let’s go!

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: Oh, is that all— WAIT, THAT’S HORRIFYING!
Stardust? You know, it almost doesn’t sound so bad when you put it like that.
I guess that’s a risk we’ll have to take!

dialogue: Then you will be turned to stardust on the spot.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The same.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Fool. Atreus was human. He could be reasoned with.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: With Pantheon in control of his vessel, he will seek only war and destruction!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Fool. Atreus was human. He could be reasoned with.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: With Pantheon in control of his vessel, he will seek only war and destruction!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels rush for the safety of a nearby cave as rocks and boulders continue careening down the mountain outside.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hurry! Everyone in!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a matter of seconds, the entrance is sealed by the rockslide, entombing you in the dark cave.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Well… at least we’re all safe.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re trapped, Riven.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Hey, I thought we were gonna die, and we didn’t. I’m not complaining.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: So, this is our fate? We dwell forever in cold, dark caverns, like some wretched brood of frost trolls?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There’s nothing else to be done. Pantheon has returned to fight alongside the Ruined King.

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: We can still stop this. Let’s clear those rocks out of the way and get up to the peak!
Yeah. And even if you did fix all that you’d still have to deal with the Solari. Targon is screwed.

dialogue: And we are forced to cower in this cave, while Targon succumbs to the Harrowing.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Even if we survive this Harrowing, what hope is there for peace?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Diana seems to go into a trance. Her eyes glow with soft, pale moonlight…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...Then they slowly change to a sinister shade of green that you know all too well.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Nothing here has purpose… All that matters… is…

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Uh-oh. Looks like Miss Moonbeams has met the Harrowing.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Diana, come back to us! Don’t listen to the Mist! Targon has a beautiful future, and you are integral to it!
That’s the Mist talking. Diana, you have to realize that. Resist it with your… moon power or whatever.
I’ve already said all I can! My silver tongue is all out of words!

dialogue: She must’ve taken in a big dose of that Mist out there. Rookie, talk her down!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Nothing but destruction… awaits… Destruction, and true love… Viego and Isolde… History’s greatest love story…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ah, hells.
Could it really be?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Two figures emerge from the depths of the cave.]
I don’t know. Be careful.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian draws his pistols and aims at the shadowy figures.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Who is that? Show yourselves! Slowly.

speaker: Lunari Commoner 1
dialogue: Is that truly… her?

speaker: Lunari Commoner 2
dialogue: We saw the light of her eyes. We had to know.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Who are you talkin’ about?

speaker: Lunari Commoner 1

responses.dialogue: Aspect? Diana, were you planning on telling us you were a god?
Aspect? No! That’s just Diana. She’s our mountain guide.
Aspect? Oh, right. I knew she was an Aspect. I figured it out pretty early on.

dialogue: The Aspect of the Moon. She travels with you.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: What do ya know? All this time, Moonbeams was a moon goddess.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: You two are... LUNARI.

speaker: Lunari Commoner 2
dialogue: Of course we are. That’s why we’re in this cave—to hide from those murderous Solari.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I have no comfort to offer you. They are still out there.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There is nothing but destruction outside this cave.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Stay in here as long as you can. For there is no hope to be found in Targon.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The Lunari absorb Diana’s somber advice with looks of confusion. Then…]

speaker: Lunari Commoner 1
dialogue: I beg to differ, my lady.

speaker: Lunari Commoner 1
dialogue: We found you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Suddenly, the signs of ruination begin to fade from Diana’s face.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: What? You sound… happy? Why?

speaker: Lunari Commoner 2
dialogue: We spent our whole lives hiding. Because we believed in you—the Night Mother...

speaker: Lunari Commoner 2
dialogue: It got so bad that sometimes we wondered if you were… well, you know. If you were real.

speaker: Lunari Commoner 2
dialogue: And now, here you are.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The two Lunari bow before Diana, who seems somewhat uncomfortable with the reverence.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: No. All those years I couldn’t protect you. You had to hide...

speaker: Lunari Commoner 1
dialogue: Begging your pardon, Night Mother… but now that we’ve found you… Well, I think our hiding days might be over.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The two Lunari followers look up at Diana, with tears of joy streaming down their faces.]

speaker: Lunari Commoners 1 & 2
dialogue: Praises to the Aspects. Praises to the Moon!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Huh. Must be nice, being a moon goddess.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Yeah. How come none of my followers do that for me?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know I love you, darlin’.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Diana approaches. The moonlight of her eyes has returned to a healthy pale glow, free from all trace of Harrowing.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Well, sentinels. I believe we still have a Ruined King to battle.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Shall we remove the rocks from the cave entrance?

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Are you stark ravin’ daft? It would take Olaf two weeks to clear that pile of rocks. And that’s if I was angry.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: My dear barbarian, you are on Targon—conduit to the heavens, and all their power.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Spreading her arms, Diana releases a ray of pale, white light that blasts away the rockslide at the mouth of the cave.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Now, pray to them we are not too late.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Did you not see their power? The Aspect of War and the King of Harrowings working together.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There is no power in existence that can withstand that.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I must say, that is not a very rosy outlook.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It is the way things are, child.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Rookie! If I needed pessimism, I’d go to my husband.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Damn right.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Do not scold your rookie…

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It is true. Targon’s future is bleak.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the Sentinels prepare to deploy to the next battle, Olaf and Irelia take you aside. They seem to have something on their minds.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: ROOKIE! My young friend! You are terrible.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: In combat, Olaf. You have to say in combat.

speaker: Olaf

responses.dialogue: You said you’ve never seen skin as bright and clear as mine.
You said I was terrible at everything! Then you hit me.
I’m going to need a lot of therapy after this is over.

dialogue: I did say that! What did it sound like I was saying?!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: In truth, young one, you leave much to be desired in the realm of combat.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Our enemies grow stronger by the day. You need training to match.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: And who but I could put the fire of the endless, frozen hells within you, so you might march upon a sea of your enemies’ bones?!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: An… interesting visual, but not untrue. Olaf and I excel at pushing back enemies who yearn for death.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Your foes wish to take all you could ever have! It is dishonorable not to face them with that same intent!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You will learn to fight with everything, for should you fail, all you love might be lost.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Least of all your life! Who would tolerate dying ingloriously to unworthy foes? Not Olaf! Not I!

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Now steel yourself for GLORIOUS TRAINING!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: ...Please don’t kill the Rookie.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Olaf and Irelia spar with you for what seems like an eternity. You weather blow after blow, a newfound rage burning within you.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Even in simple sparring, you see a spite within their eyes toward foes yet unslain. You earn the [Spiteful Vanguard] upgrade.]

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Did he say that? I wonder.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Certainly brighter and clearer than I! But that’s not why we’re here.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: HAH! Trust me, child, if Olaf had hit you, you would know.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: The northman is not lying, Rookie. You’d be quite dead.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: Therapy?! I don’t even know what that is!

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: You don’t say…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels escape the mageseeker vault just in time to see it collapse behind them.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Though you feel relieved, Senna seems angry at Gwen.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Why?! Why did you hide me in that mist shroud?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I was protecting you from him, Miss.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You were holding me back! I was meant to fight him!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: No… I couldn’t let him see. We can’t let him take what’s left of her.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What’s left of “her?” You mean the Queen? The one whose spirit lives inside me?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: How do you know about her? What does that have to do with you?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Because of your interference, Viego got away.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Let’s spread out, see if we can find his trail.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Senna—wait.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Maybe Gwen was right. If Viego wants what you’ve got, maybe it’s best if you stay hidden. Let us—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Don’t even say it, Lucian. I’m doing this.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Don’t look at me. I know better than to get involved in this.
He’s right, Senna. If Viego wants to pry something out of you, maybe it’s best if you stay clear of him.
Are you kidding? I’m more scared of Senna than some dead king.

dialogue: Rookie, back me up here.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: There’s the monster! Viego’s heading down that street!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I see him! In that patch of Mist!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You turn to see Viego, darting toward the gates of the mageseeker compound.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: After him! Whatever he stole from the vault, we can’t let him leave with it!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You pursue Viego through the courtyard, but he remains one step ahead, darting through the Mist clouds at incredible speed.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Just when you gain ground, Viego disappears again. A second later, he reappears in a patch of Mist, just outside the courtyard.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This ain’t working. He’s too fast in this Mist!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Maybe I can cut off his path.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Senna fires her gun, taking out a large piece of the Black Mist, thwarting Viego’s exit.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: There. Now he’s got nowhere to go!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Time’s up, Ruined Creep.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [But just when you’ve got Viego cornered, you feel the heat of flames on the back of your neck...]

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Sentinels… why do you persist...

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: ...chasing what you don’t understand?

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: The benevolent King of Ruination… will shape this land for the better.

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: And your kind will not prevail.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: I don’t know about the rest of you, but I’ve had just about enough of the lizard lady.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Vayne shoots a silver arrow from her crossbow, piercing Shyvana’s abdomen.]

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: [ROAAAAR]

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: So… You like fighting monsters, do you, Vayne?

speaker: Shyvana
dialogue: Now’s your chance!

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Uh, Vayne? Did you forget to tell us she can turn into a dragon?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian and Senna both give you long, uncomfortable stares. Neither is happy with you, but neither is angry at you.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Excuse me?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Last time I checked, I was the one who gives the orders, and you were the one fresh out of training.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: So maybe start acting like it. Got me?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Rook’s just looking out for you, darlin’.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Smart. You may be a rookie, but you’re a fast learner.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: I, um… Oh, boy.
Sorry, sir. She’s the boss.

dialogue: Thanks, Rook. Remember this when she ends up dead.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [As the Sentinels prepare to deploy to the next battle, Riven and Diana take you aside. They look serious.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Rookie. We need to talk.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It’s about your… how do I say this? Fighting.

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: This is the first time I’m hearing of this.
Okay, so I’m not incredible. What do you suggest?
Would you change your mind if I said the moon was cool?

dialogue: It’s bad.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Our battles will only get harder. You need discipline and training to survive.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Things neither of us have time for. But we do know a little about turning your pain…

speaker: Diana
dialogue: ...into power.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There is much we have lost, Rookie. Life is long, but it's cruelties extend to us all. Touch us in different ways.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: When you focus in a fight, you can draw from that experience. Steel yourself, in a way.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It’s not the prettiest kind of fighting. You’re not gonna be called the “dancing blade” or anything.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: But to our enemies… and sometimes, to yourself… you will be merciless.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You train with Diana and Riven for hours, trading blow after blow. There is a grim determination on their faces you had not noticed before.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Whatever their pasts are, they grant an unbreakable will. You earn the [Tormented Fighter] upgrade.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: It absolutely is not.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I’ve seen you flailing around at wraiths like a child. Amusing but… ineffective.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Good, you seek improvement. That’s all I need to hear.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: You might be hearing what you want to hear. But go off.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I would not.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Quit invoking the name of the moon before she punishes you.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels dive into the bay just in time to hear the entire dock collapse into the water behind you.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You surface at the shipyard, next to some very soggy fellow sentinels.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: [COUGH] [SPIT] ...Is everyone accounted for?

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: All except Pyke. He must have gone down with the docks.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Good riddance. That guy was giving me the creeps.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [An unfriendly grip clinches your shoulder from behind. You turn to see Lucian, dripping with seawater, and steaming with anger.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You had ONE job, Rookie!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Hold onto the Wayfinder and, when need be, Wayfind us out of trouble!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Lay off the kid!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, NOW you wanna lay off the kid?

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: It wasn’t Rookie’s fault.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: ...For once.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: How are we supposed to get home without the Wayfinder? Walk?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Hee. That’s silly. We’re on an island! We’d have to swim back.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: We are in a shipyard. Let’s steal a boat.
I say we pay one of these smugglers to sail us back to headquarters.
Actually, this place is quite nice. I could learn to call it home. Who’s with me?

dialogue: Yeah… I guess we need to talk transportation options. Who’s got ideas?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Well, that leaves zero options, by my count.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Sometimes no options IS an option.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: [GRRRR] That makes Rengar’s brain hurt!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: There’s a saying we have in Targon: You don’t need to act to meet fate.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: As sure as the moon passes through its phases, fate passes us, and if we’re patient enough, it—
My little sentinel crew.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Oh, look—there’s fate now.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Your pulse quickens as you find Miss Fortune standing at the edge of the landing.]

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Before you think of reaching for your weapons… don’t.

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: My rather sizeable crew has you surrounded.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look around and see dozens of gun barrels aiming at you from behind the crates in the shipyard.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Sarah… do you have any idea how much damage you’ve already done?

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Not quite enough, I’m afraid. Leaving you alive would really hurt my standing with the new king. So…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [From all around you, you hear dozens of flintlock guns cocking at once.]

speaker: Miss Fortune
dialogue: Let’s not make this take all day. On my count, boys. Ready… Aim…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [In a fraction of a moment, Pyke springs from the water at Miss Fortune’s back...]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and drags her into the bay, the two disappearing far beneath the surface.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: They’re… gone.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We will be too if we don’t find cover!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels scatter to various points of cover, as Miss Fortune’s gang unloads its guns in a blaze of fury.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Oh, Sarah Fortune is NOT gettin’ the best of me again today. Give ‘em hell, y’all!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels return with gunfire of their own. Shots rip through the shipyard, seemingly for hours.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [By the time the shooting is done, all of Miss Fortune’s crew have been dispatched, and every sentinel has been pressed to exhaustion.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Well… guess they won’t be needing their ship anymore.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [At the edge of the landing, Gwen peers into the water, where Pyke and Fortune vanished.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Where do you think they went? I do hope they’ve had their swimming lessons.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [To everyone’s shock, Pyke leaps out of the water onto the landing, his knives stained red.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh, my! What happened down there? Are you okay, Mr. Creepy Scares?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Aghhhh… ACKKK.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What happened to Fortune?

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: My list... goes on.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Pyke reaches into his belt, and pulls out an object.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The Wayfinder.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: You are a trustworthy crew.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ha-HA! You creepy, magnificent bastard! Thank you!

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: You don’t have to tell me twice.
Are you absolutely sure? We haven’t even tried their rum yet. Okay, fine, I’m going.

dialogue: Let’s not waste any time. Come on, get us back to base, Rookie.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Goodbye, Mr. Pyke. I wish you luck with your list.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Gwen waves goodbye. To your surprise, Pyke does the same.]

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Sink ‘til you float.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You fire up the Wayfinder, transporting your crew from the islands of Bilgewater.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Just before you disappear, you could swear you see a look of melancholy on the face of Pyke.]

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Now you’re speakin’ my language, kid.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: You want a cigar, too? I’ll get you a cigar. And teach ya to cuss real good.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: We are not thieves.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: ...Well, most of us, anyway.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: And even if we were, it would take damn near all year to sail home.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Have you secretly been hoarding money?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Because the rest of us sure don’t have any.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: That’s ‘cause y’all didn’t let me sell that fetter in Zaun!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Idiot. Then we wouldn’t have the fetter!

speaker: Graves
dialogue: We don’t have the fetter now. AND we don’t have money. Worst possible outcome. Nice job, y’all.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Weirdly, that makes complete sense.

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: No chance in hell. I swelter like a yeti in a sweat cave right now. You can keep it!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I’m always one to remain optimistic, but… NO!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Yeah. I suppose I’m more of a mountain sort. Can’t handle mosquitos.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Ehh, I’m kinda burnt out on this place too.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Halfway up Mount Targon, the sentinels pause to catch their breath.]

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Oh my... [PANT] ...How much farther is it?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What’s the matter, Scissors? Thought you wanted to climb the mountain?

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I DO, but… [PANT] Why does it all have to be… [PANT]… uphill?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The physical climb will be the least difficult part. The mountain will test your mind and spirit like nothing else.

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: Whoa, whoa! Aspects? You mean the gods?! I did NOT sign up for this.
Hey, you never know. Maybe they’ll like me. They liked you enough, right?
Aspects. Puhh. Who are they to judge? Think they’re so high and mighty.

dialogue: And if you reach the top, the Aspects themselves will judge you. Most likely, quite harshly.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A thunderous clash reverberates from the top of the mountain. It sounds as though the heavens themselves are colliding.]

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What in the name of the Volibear is that?! It sounds like the end of all creation!

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It must be the Aspects. I think something has angered them.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Way to go, Rookie. You had to blaspheme.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: This has nothing to do with you. That sound can only mean one thing: The Aspects themselves are battling.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: And believe me, a clash between the gods is not something you want to be involved in. We should go no further.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m afraid that’s not an option. Whatever’s going on up there, it has something to do with the Harrowing. We have to be involved.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I do not know Harrowings, but I do know celestial power. It is to be respected. Feared.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: The Harrowing is to be feared. If we turn our backs on it, it will destroy everything. Even Targon.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: I have fought countless human invaders and cut through them all like a scythe.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: This evil is different. It will infect all you care about. You must respond swiftly, before your homeland is lost...

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Just as mine was.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Losing Targon would be devastating. But it would be a material loss. All mountains fall with time.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The power of the Aspects transcends this realm. They can harm you in ways you cannot comprehend. Nothing is worth their wrath.

speaker: Senna

responses.dialogue: Yeah, how about the Moon? You like the Moon right? You don’t want to see what the Ruined King will do to that thing.
How about the people of Targon? Do you really want to see them lost to the Harrowing?
Like that crazy hair you’ve got going on. It must’ve taken you forever to get it to stay that way. It’d be a shame to see it ruined.

dialogue: Nothing? How can you just let your own home be destroyed?! Surely there must be something here worth saving to you?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I suppose there is one thing…

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I am a Lunari, a follower of the Moon.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: It has blessed me with its light. Shown me the error of Solari falsehoods. Rewarded my questions with real answers.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I owe it to the Moon to find the others.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Others?

speaker: Diana
dialogue: The other Lunari. They have been persecuted. Slaughtered for their beliefs.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: And though I’ve never met any, I believe there are survivors. If I could find them, I know I could protect them.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Perhaps I could even persuade the Solari to stop hunting them.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: I could even unify Targon. Show everyone we’re all following the same light.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: That is my dream for this world, lofty as it may be.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I think it’s a beautiful dream. Why, if I was a murderous Solari, you’d have me convinced.
Hey! You there!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels turn to see a band of Solari fanatics coming up the mountainside behind them.]

speaker: Diana
dialogue: And speaking of Solari...

speaker: Solari Fanatic 1
dialogue: Well, well. A moon-worshipping vermin. It’s been a while since I’ve seen one of those.

speaker: Solari Fanatic 2
dialogue: I thought we’d gotten them all.

speaker: Solari Fanatic 1
dialogue: You know how their kind are—always scurrying out of hiding in the dark.

speaker: Solari Fanatic 2
dialogue: What are you doing out in the daylight, night-vermin?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: What the hell do you think you’re doing?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: In case you didn’t notice, there’s a worldwide Harrowing going on.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: The Solari should be uniting with the Lunari, not hunting them!

speaker: Solari Fanatic 2
dialogue: This doesn’t concern you, stranger. These heretics disgrace Targon with their false light.

speaker: Solari Fanatic 2
dialogue: And it’s up to us to snuff it out.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The Solari charge Diana with their blades drawn.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: What was it you were saying about unity?

speaker: Riven

responses.dialogue: That does not make me feel better!
Riven! You’re not helping!

dialogue: Settle down, kid. If it makes you feel better, the Aspects will probably kill us all. You won’t be alone.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Hey, I’m trying here.

speaker: Diana

responses.dialogue: …Uh-huh... Okay. Wow.
That... was an overshare.
…So what you’re saying is I’VE GOT A CHANCE.

dialogue: I endured much. The Full Moon showed me mercy, even though its truths tore my life apart, forcing me to live in unbearable solitude, with a trail of dead in my wake.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Most are not so fortunate.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: They are manifestations of the celestials themselves.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Revered entities with the power to shape worlds.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: But I can appreciate blasphemy. Do go on.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Accompanied by Lucian and Rengar, you warily follow Thresh into the temple ruins.]

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: You sure we shouldn’t signal to the others? They’d probably wanna know we found Thresh.
You’re doing what you have to do to beat the Ruined King.

dialogue: Can’t believe I’m doing this.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Well. Here we all are. Excellent.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Oh, we’re here alright. Now show us this ancient secret that’s gonna defeat Viego.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Not yet. First, you must uphold your end of the bargain.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: The Ruined King’s treasure. I believe it’s in the next chamber.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Fetch it for me.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You look through the doorway to the next chamber. Inside, a jade mask rests on a small plinth.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Streams of Black Mist billow into the room and swarm excitedly around the mask.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The mask? What is it, another fetter?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What do you want with that?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: That is my secret, Lucian.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Why can’t you get it yourself?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Does it matter?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You know what? Deal’s off. Rookie, Cat—let’s go.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and Rengar start to follow Lucian out of the temple ruins.]

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: I see. I suppose you’ll find some other way to save your wife...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian stops in his tracks, seething… and reconsidering.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Don’t you go bringin’ her into this.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: She’s already in it. And that’s the rub, isn’t it?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian glares coldly at Thresh for a long moment…]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This ancient secret of yours better be good, Thresh.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...then walks into the neighboring room.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [A moment later, he returns with the jade mask.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Got your treasure. Happy?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Thresh eagerly reaches for it.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh-uh. Now you make good on your end of the deal.

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Oh, honestly, Lucian. You take me for some two-bit street hustler?

speaker: Thresh
dialogue: Fine…

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Thresh shines the eerie green light from his lantern on the blank walls of the ruins.]

speaker: Narrator

responses.dialogue: Those are reliefs! They seem to be telling a story.
This is the powerful ancient secret? It looks like graffiti.
Can someone tell me what it says? I never learned to read pictures.

dialogue: [Ancient reliefs appear, illuminated by the dark magic of the lantern.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: A story about an old Harrowing, from the looks of it.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Rengar loves stories! Especially about hunting. Is it about hunting?!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Says here there was a powerful weapon... at the sentinel base in Shurima…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: A gun that can avenge fallen allies… and bring them back to life?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: What a hot load of ancient bull.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: The deal’s off, Thresh. Not impressed with your far-fetched legends—

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian stops as he comes to an eerie realization…]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Both Thresh and the fetter have disappeared.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Uh, fellas?

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: We’ve been had.
We just got ancient secret knowledge!

dialogue: I hate to say it, but…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Nothing to do now except meet back up with the others…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...and NEVER BREATHE A WORD OF THIS TO ANYONE as long as we live. Understood?

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You nod nervously, uneasy with the position Lucian has put you in.]

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Rengar can keep a secret. What happens on the hunt, stays on the hunt!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: That’s nice, Cat. Why don’t you go find a tree to scratch?

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: You wish to throw me off your trail?

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: You plan to leave Rengar behind!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I cannot show my face in this jungle until I have proven I am still a fearsome predator!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: I beg of you—let me join your hunt for this Ruined King!

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: We will slay him and mount his head on our wall, and Rengar will prove that he is still top of the food chain!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Aw, Cat… don’t make this harder than it has to be.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Are you serious? We’ve got a literal zombie!
Are you serious? We’ve got an ex-con with a long criminal record!
Are you serious? We’ve got a doll with scissors!

dialogue: I don’t even know if they allow animals at headquarters.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Are you serious? We’ve got a screaming, axe-wielding berserker!
Are you serious? We’ve got an ex-con with a long criminal record!
Are you serious? We’ve got a doll with scissors!

dialogue: I don’t even know if they allow animals at headquarters.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Dammit, Rookie…

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: [SIGH] ...Fine. I reckon.

speaker: Rengar
dialogue: Outstanding! Let us commence our hunt. For the game is already afoot!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian points a stern finger at you.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: ...But you’re gonna be the one to feed him.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We’re not signalin’ anybody.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Let’s just… see where this goes first.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah. You’re right.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Gotta just hold my nose and do this.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, I’ll be damned. These are reliefs.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Not sure who made ‘em, but it looks like they’re telling a story.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Well, I’ll be damned. These are reliefs.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Not sure who made ‘em, but it looks like they’re telling a story.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Looks that way.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian kicks an old piece of brick in anger.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We just traded a fetter for a tall tale scribbled on some old rocks!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Not one of my better decisions.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: No, Rookie. I think we’ve been had.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [Lucian kicks an old piece of brick in anger.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: We just traded a fetter for a tall tale scribbled on some old rocks!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Not one of my better decisions.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The Worldstone beams you to the humid, tropical subcontinent of Ixtal.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [It’s impossible to see any semblance of a sentinel base, or any sign of Harrowing, through the vast jungle thicket that surrounds you.]

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Wow. Where do we even start here?

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Nothing but dark, shadowy jungle anywhere you look.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: I’ll say. Looking for Black Mist in this forest is like looking for a needle in… in…

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: A big stack of needle-like objects!

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: She’s right. If there’s a Harrowing under that canopy, we ain’t gonna see it from here. What’s the plan, Senna?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Hmm. Looks like we’re going to have to spread out and do some scouting.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Vayne, you and Graves search the jungle to the north.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Well ain’t this a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Graves
dialogue: Y’know, I always did wanna work with someone more ruthless than me.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: And take the new guy with you, too.

speaker: Pyke
dialogue: Salt in your eyes. SALT IN YOUR EYES!

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Great. Team Scumbag and Psycho.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: Real bunch of winners I’m traveling with.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: That’s the spirit. Riven—you and Irelia scout the area to the west.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Oh, I think not.

speaker: Riven
dialogue: Yeah, I also think not. What’re you thinking here, boss?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’m thinking that you two need to start acting like sentinels and not like petty schoolchildren. Okay?

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Diana will come along to make sure there’s no friendly fire involved.

speaker: Diana
dialogue: Not even an Aspect can work miracles. But I will do my best.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Great. Guess me and Senna will cover everything south of here. That leaves Gwen, Olaf, and—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Whoa whoa whoa! You’re putting the two most experienced sentinels on the same squad?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Yeah, since we know each other so well, I thought—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: You thought you needed to keep me safe again, right?

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: NO! No, that’s not it! I just—

speaker: Senna
dialogue: I’ll take Gwen and Olaf to the south. Babe, you take Rookie and scout east.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You notice Lucian eyeing you with contempt.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Meet back here in one hour. If you run into trouble, fire a shot into the air to signal.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Move out! And, uh… try not to get lost out there.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Unbelievable. Rookie duty again! Of all the things I could be doin’ right now, I’m babysittin’ the greenhorn!

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Why do you hate me?
Sticks in your craw? Is that… good?
Hey, in case you’ve forgotten, I’m the one with the Wayfinder. Be nice.

dialogue: This is just stickin’ in my craw all kinds of ways.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Let’s just get into that jungle and see if we can’t find some Harrowing.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: Ah, hell, kid. Don’t take it personally.

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: I know that. And if you ever wanna talk about it...
Oh. Yeah, I figured. Maybe it would help if you told me what it IS about.

dialogue: I reckon this ain’t about you.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: I don’t care to get into it right now. But thanks.

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: You gettin’ smart with me?

speaker: Lucian

responses.dialogue: Maybe I wouldn’t be smarting off if you treated me like an adult. I’m not a child, Lucian.
Duhhhhh. Is this dumb enough?
Sorry, sir. I just don’t get why you’re always so sore at me. What did I do?

dialogue: I got enough to worry about without some smart-assed kid chappin’ my hide.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [The sentinels escort Karma to a trailhead at the edge of the woods, just outside the Lasting Altar.]

speaker: Lucian
dialogue: This the path?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Yes. Just beyond these harrowed woods lies the Grove of the Ancients—a place the Black Mist cannot infect.

speaker: Vayne
dialogue: A bunch of trees? That’s supposed to keep out The Ruined King?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: It is a place of primal vastayan magic. Over the centuries, I have seen many try to tame it.

speaker: Karma

responses.dialogue: Did you say “centuries”? How old are you exactly, Karma?
Centuries? Wow, you look amazing for someone who’s hundreds of years old!

dialogue: All have failed. Viego will as well.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: There have been many Karmas. Many individual lives, shaped by different circumstances.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: But one soul, connecting them all.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Who am I truly? The country farm maiden… the grizzled mariner salt-worn by the sea… the wealthy governess born into privilege…

speaker: Olaf
dialogue: What the frozen hell is she talkin’ about?!

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: Shh! Manners, Olaf! She’s regaling us with tales from her past.

speaker: Gwen
dialogue: (...If only I could recall mine.)

speaker: Karma
dialogue: ...Or Darha. The newest, with all that past wisdom upon which to draw.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: And yet, somehow, she was the most foolish.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: So hesitant to act was she. She… I…

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Are you okay? Are you sure you’re up for this?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I… I let them all die. Thousands. They all died because of my hesitation.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I refused to kill. And in doing so, allowed Ionians to be killed.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Violence corrupts the Spirit. That’s what I thought.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: You there—so young and inexperienced...

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You realize that Karma seems to be looking at you.]

speaker: Karma

responses.dialogue: I don’t know. But I think it’s good that you had principles… even if they didn’t have the results you expected.
Are you kidding? I killed, like, five people just this morning. I am not to be messed with.
What’s going on here? Shouldn’t we get moving to that Ancient Grove place?

dialogue: What would you have done? Could you take life?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: The Ruined King would not hesitate. He would never waver in his principles.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: He would go to any length to protect what he loves.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: His love is boundless. His love is undying. His love…

speaker: Karma
dialogue: ...is peace.

speaker: Irelia
dialogue: Karma, I’ve never seen you like this. Are you giving into this madness?!

speaker: Karma
dialogue: No. My eyes have just been opened. Like clear windows into a bright new dawn.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: He’s corrupting you! Don’t you feel it?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I feel… the sure, strong hand that the world needs. He would be a true spiritual leader.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I must give him what he seeks.

speaker: Senna
dialogue: Karma, you don’t know what you’re doing. Give me the fetter.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I cannot do that. You would stop him. I see it in you.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I will not allow it!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [With surprising speed, Karma floats away toward the thick of the forest, carrying the fetter.]

speaker: Senna
dialogue: She’s fleeing! Someone stop her!

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels pursue Karma into the woods. Sensing your pursuit, she stops, whirls around...]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: All hail the Ruined King—the true Enlightened One.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [...and with a wave of her arm, she emits a pulse of magic from her palm.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [You and the sentinels are felled by its power. As you writhe on the ground in agony, you see Karma flee into the darkness.]

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: [By the time you get to your feet, she is nowhere to be found.]

speaker: Karma
dialogue: You are kind, but you are naïve.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Someday, you will pay a price for your innocence… just as I did.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I could have saved those people. Could’ve saved them all. If I’d only taken action.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: No. You lie.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: You have never taken a life. Though you may act calloused, I can see your spirit is unspoiled.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: Mine, on the other hand…

speaker: Karma
dialogue: I could have saved those people. Could’ve saved them all. If I’d only taken action.

speaker: Karma
dialogue: So eager to leave… But why? To what end?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: We spend the rest of our days in the Grove of the Ancients? Cowering in weakness?

speaker: Karma
dialogue: While his power holds sway everywhere else?
